We also hope that this skin will become the most acclaimed skin, but this is not the case.

 

Figure 4: Red skin “Butterfly Dream”

According to our research, most men praised the “Butterfly Dream” costume, but when it came to female players, the girls’ praise for Butterfly Dream plummeted, and they also put forward various suggestions about the costume. Of course, gender is only one of the important influencing factors. If other cross-analysis is done, other interesting answers may be obtained, but it is certain that the aesthetics of different players are absolutely different. Previously, it was said that tough guys may not be as popular as tall and slender men, but it is only a trend. The composition of players is still a factor that game developers have to consider.

Rationality in Sensibility

Regarding whether the character/skin looks good, there is actually another rule, that is, white/light-colored skins will be more popular than black/dark-colored skins. In skins of the same quality, light-colored skins will be better than dark-colored skins. This has almost become an objective rule, and even the color system has become the most important factor for players to choose, and the sensitivity has exceeded the quality. A purple-quality light-colored skin may be more popular than a yellow-quality dark-colored skin. But why is this the case?

This question seems very emotional and there is no logic to speak of. This is indeed the case. It is difficult for you to directly answer why the same skin is more popular in white than in black. But in fact, there must be a trace of rationality in sensibility. We have considered many factors, such as the background when trying on clothes, the relationship between texture and color, the fit of the skin and the character, and so on. For example, the influence of background and light. Under daily light, the lighter the shape, the more obvious the light and shadow effect, and the more obvious the contrast between light and dark. This is why beginners in sketching initially draw white plaster geometric bodies instead of black geometric bodies. The more common principle is makeup. Eyeliner, nose shadow, lipstick, and eyebrow trimming are all to highlight the facial features, while the foundation is to weaken the details of the cheeks, such as some spots, scars, and pores, so that people’s attention is focused on the facial features. So much effort is spent on the facial features, it is to make the contrast stronger. Of course, a whiter skin tone can also be easier to set off.

 

Figure 5: White makes objects more three-dimensional

In addition, the fit of the skin and the character is another very key factor. In our research process, we found that players have a specific “color positioning” for each character of Naraka: Bladepoint. For example, players think that Ning Hongye should be red, Kurumi should be pink, and Canaan should be white. This will also become another important factor affecting players’ purchase. For example, although the quality of Kurumi’s pink appearance is not the highest, even just blue, players’ evaluation of it will exceed many higher-quality skins.

Final Thoughts

Returning to the question at the beginning of the full text: what kind of characters and appearances will be favored by players, it is difficult to come to a certain answer. People’s views on “beauty” have been changing and have never been unified, but from the above discussion, we may be able to get a glimpse of the aesthetic concepts of different players. In fact, from another perspective, the design of each character image or skin is the product of the careful conception of art designers. After being imported into the game, there may be comparisons of high and low sales, but everyone’s pursuit of beauty is always unrelenting. Perhaps it is precisely because of their wild imagination that people’s cognition of “beauty” has no conclusion.

entry.title: Player Satisfaction: How Do 'Raising' Games Keep You Hooked?
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Do you remember the frog son you raised in those years? When you open Tabi Kaeru (Travel Frog) with a忐忑 (tǎn tè - uneasy; apprehensive) mood, not knowing if your baby frog has come home, packing his bags for him, paying attention to his every move, and smiling like a loving mother when you see the postcards he sent back… That’s right, you are hooked. This type of education simulation game (养成游戏 - yǎng chéng yóu xì) is a branch of simulation games. “Raising” (养成 - yǎng chéng) is its core element. Players need to cultivate a specific object (human or animal) in the game and make it successful. The sense of accomplishment brought by the game is the key to keeping players hooked.

 

Emoji created by Tabi Kaeru players

1. The Psychological Mechanism Behind “Raising”

Raising games are divided into many categories, such as love raising, assistant raising, pet raising, and parent-child raising. The attributes of the raised object determine the development of the game plot and the outcome of the player’s game. For example, the object’s level qualifications, item equipment, skills, image skins, etc.

 

Cards in the love raising game, Love and the West Lake (lit. “Meeting Nishuihan”)

The addictive feeling in raising games lies in people’s psychology of “the more you get, the more you want” (Diderot effect or matching effect), which refers to the phenomenon that when people don’t get something, they feel very calm, but once they get it, they are not satisfied and constantly configure items that match it. In the game, the novice tutorial triggers new players to act, complete tasks, and receive corresponding rewards; then it triggers user investment and forms a closed loop. In the process, the attributes of the object are constantly changing and upgrading. Players get satisfaction from it, and the sunk cost continues to push users to enter the next round of closed loop.

 

Diderot Effect

2. Attributes of Raising Games

Self-Projection and Self-Actualization

In Chinese Parents, players arrange their children’s study and life. The child’s attributes determine the direction of the plot and the ending. Players need to arrange the child’s learning tasks with limited physical strength. According to the different schedules arranged by the player, the child’s IQ, EQ, physical strength, memory, imagination, and courage will change accordingly. Players also need to balance parental satisfaction and the child’s stress. In the game, the child’s admission results and future development are the incentives for players to constantly invest time. In essence, it is an opportunity for players to “redo” their lives in the game. It is to satisfy the player’s self-actualization and high-level needs, and it is also the reason why this type of raising game makes players play happily.

 

In Chinese Parents, the admission notice is the feedback of the player’s raising results

In the game, in addition to being expressed in the form of numerical values, these attributes are also designed in the form of elimination games as a brain map. The higher the number of brain layers, the higher the understanding that can be obtained. Players need to constantly dig deeper, and the skills of digging brain holes are the key for players to improve their children’s attributes.

 

*Character attributes and brain-digging map in Chinese Parents

The game also includes many interesting plots and settings —– face-to-face battles between parents, class committee elections, red envelope wars, Chinese talents, and so on. The authenticity of these details makes many players see their childhood selves. In essence, it is the knowing smile and resonance during the game process that made this game rush to the second place on the Steam rankings as soon as it was released.

Combination of Challenging Gameplay and Raising Gameplay

Onmyoji is an example of the clever combination of the raising system and the challenge system. During the game, players need to match different shikigami according to the battle mode. Drawing charms to draw shikigami, when players draw rare shikigami, it will bring them great satisfaction.

 

*The card drawing interface in Onmyoji

For players, winning in fierce challenges is the main source of their satisfaction. When the difficulty continues to increase, players may feel frustrated in the challenge, and the raising system will come into play at this time; on the one hand, by increasing the level, the player’s winning rate is improved. On the other hand, the raising system provides players with feedback and rewards, invisibly helping users to subdivide tasks. Through the cycle of raising and challenge, users are guided to invest more time and cost. Offset the accumulation of users’ negative emotions, and improve users’ stickiness and loyalty.

 

*Shikigami picture scroll in Onmyoji

This is actually the application of Pavlov’s classical conditioning theory. Pavlov’s experiments show that neutral stimuli (bells, red lights, etc.) that originally could not cause a certain instinctive reflex, when they appear repeatedly with stimuli that can cause instinctive reflexes, this neutral stimulus can also cause instinctive reflexes.

Players constantly train the raised objects in the process of challenge, and the objects win in the duel. Strengthens the connection between raising and victory, making the raising process more “enjoyable”. Form a learned reflex and increase the satisfaction that users get during the raising process.

Different behaviors of players in the raising system. Such as collecting materials, upgrading, training, etc., will bring users a certain sense of satisfaction.

Repeating the “raising - challenge” cycle strengthens the player’s association with raising and victory.

Under repeated cycles, the satisfaction brought by the raising system is enhanced.

At the same time, in addition to challenge, the raising process has also become an important source of the game’s sense of enjoyment.

The two cooperate to effectively balance the negative emotions brought by players facing stronger opponents, balance the rhythm of the game, and constantly give players positive feedback.

 

The interaction between the raising system and the challenge system

Establish a connection between the raising system and the challenge system, and constantly cycle to improve the positive experience of user raising.

Of course, the setting of the raising system needs to consider the following two points:

Rhythm

It is mainly manifested as the time and frequency of the player’s actions on the raised object. High-frequency raising can make players get greater satisfaction in experience, but the player’s excitement will also decrease with the marginal effect. In addition, if the raising takes too long, players may lose patience before they are willing to invest a lot of time and cost, and directly abandon the pit. But on the other hand, the rhythm of the raising system determines the time and cost spent by players in the strategy. When the game update speed cannot keep up with the player’s strategy speed, it may also face a decline in player loyalty.

Balance

The number of raised objects is related to the scalability of the game. Raised objects with different attributes and characteristics can bring higher degrees of freedom to the challenge system, and also determine the development space of the game. However, when designing raised objects, attention should be paid to grasping their balance and making them restrain each other. At the same time, avoid homogenization and retain uniqueness. Avoid players losing their sense of freshness and enthusiasm.

3. Conclusion

Raising games take advantage of the player’s psychology of “the more you get, the more you want”, allowing players to invest time and energy. In this process, the satisfaction that players get is an important reason for their addiction. Whether it is victory in battle, the growth of the raised object, the direction of the plot… These feedbacks meet the player’s needs for self-actualization in the game, so that they can learn conditioned reflexes in the cycle, and constantly bring players a sense of pleasure.

entry.title: Emotional Design Reference for NPC Affinity System
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Emotional design refers to a design approach that takes users’ feelings and emotions as the starting point. Emotional thinking is ubiquitous in games, such as the atmosphere created in the game world during real-world festivals, game sprites with cute appearances that greet you, and world announcements when rare treasures are unearthed (the system helps you show off), and so on. Among the various emotional design elements in games, falling in love and making friends with NPCs is a relatively unique experience for many players. Especially in recent years, in order to make this process feel more realistic, and not just a stack of numbers, planners will plan the interactive content between players and NPCs based on emotional development. To be more realistic, it must be more like the emotional development between two “living people.” The most commonly referenced rule for emotional development between people is “Social Penetration Theory.”

Social Penetration Theory

Social penetration theory refers to the process of relationship development that individuals experience from superficial communication to intimate communication. This theory was proposed by Irvin Altman and Dalmas Taylor (1973). Social penetration theory believes that intimacy is not only manifested physically, but also includes intellectual, emotional, and participation in activities together. Therefore, the social penetration process must include verbal behavior (our words), nonverbal behavior (body posture, expressions, etc.), and environmentally oriented behavior (the distance between the communicator and the audience, etc.).

In social penetration theory, the escalation of intimate relationships between people can be divided into the following stages:

Stage Description
Orientation Individuals reveal small parts of themselves, engaging in small talk and simple, harmless clichés.
Exploratory Affective Individuals start to reveal more about themselves, such as their opinions and attitudes on moderately personal topics. This is the stage where casual friendships develop.
Affective Individuals become comfortable discussing private and personal matters. Criticism and arguments may arise. Close friendships and intimate relationships develop at this stage.
Stable The relationship reaches a plateau where personal aspects are shared openly and freely. The individuals have a deep understanding of each other, and their communication is highly efficient and predictable.
Depenetration (not always present) When the relationship starts to break down and costs exceed benefits, there is a withdrawal of disclosure, which leads to termination of the relationship. This theory does not typically include depenetration stage.

Specifically in the game, taking the example of Revelation M and the interaction with Sikong Wangyue:

 

Orientation Stage

In the orientation stage, the player and Wangyue are in a state of unexpected encounters and casual acquaintances. The topics of conversation are relatively shallow, the NPC’s attitude is not proactive, there is little interaction, and at least one party in the conversation is relatively polite. Wangyue will accept gifts from the player, but will not be proactive towards the player. Activities only include accepting the player’s team invitations and rumor commissions. The player’s understanding of Wangyue is limited to Wangyue’s displayed personality and behavior, and they do not understand Wangyue’s own story. They can only unlock some daily polite phrases (Echo Shells).

 

Exploratory Affective Stage

In the exploratory affective stage, the player and Wangyue are in a state of like-mindedness and regret not meeting sooner. There is some two-person interactive content, and they will expose themselves more in the conversation, and even proactively trouble the player. Wangyue is willing to be dressed up by the player (after being dressed up, Wangyue in the open world will look like the player dressed him up), and Wangyue will invite you to participate in a friend’s gathering.

 

 

Affective Stage

In the affective stage, the player and Wangyue are in a state of mutual support. The chat topics involve emotional attitudes and more intimate two-person interactions. The interaction of drinking with Wangyue is unlocked. In the process of chatting with the player, Wangyue will act coquettishly (not so polite and distant) and will also tease the player (unlocking the Echo Shell “Reluctant to part with me?”), and will also reveal some of his own views on life and emotions.

 

Stable Stage

In the stable stage, the player and Wangyue are in a state of mutual understanding and mutual affection. There are more private interactions and a more proactive attitude, and even more intimate nicknames. In the open world, the player can summon Wangyue to their side. Wangyue will send private messages to the player and proactively invite the player to go out (previous invitations were after the player talked to Wangyue, Wangyue invited the player to go together, this time Wangyue discovered something interesting and invited the player to go together).

 

Summary

Reference of Social Penetration Theory for the design of NPC affinity activity content:

  • Orientation Stage: The player and NPC have just met. The topics of conversation are relatively shallow, the NPC’s attitude is not proactive, there is little interaction, and at least one party in the conversation is relatively polite.

  • Exploratory Affective Stage: The player and NPC begin to understand each other. There is some two-person interactive content, and they will expose themselves more in the conversation (past experiences, discussions of opinions on things), and even proactively trouble the player (implicitly inviting the player).

  • Affective Stage: The player and NPC become good friends. Chat topics involve more emotional attitudes (such as some deep reflections on life and emotions), more intimate two-person interactions (such as going out together), the tone becomes relaxed, and the words reveal familiarity.

  • Stable Stage: The player and NPC become close friends. The NPC becomes more proactive (when the player does not contact them, the NPC will actively contact the player). The player can trouble the NPC with more things, even including some high-value/troublesome content (such as accepting the player’s invitation anywhere, sharing their unique skills with the player), and even have more intimate nicknames (a nickname for each other).

entry.title: Designing for the Real World: Game Accessibility Features (Control)
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

The essence of games lies in setting obstacles, creating challenges, and making players feel the illusion and achievement of overcoming them all by themselves. Designing for the real world aims to serve all types of players that actually exist. Therefore, it is necessary to fully consider the unintended obstacles that players in different situations may encounter when experiencing the game, and provide them with solutions.

To this end, designers have added many accessibility features in the game for various players to adjust according to their own situation. Maybe you are confused about some functions when browsing some function setting interfaces in the game. This article will explain a thing or two from the control level.

Control represents the entire process from input to response. The first thing to consider for control is whether the interactive buttons conform to the player’s habits and ergonomics. Since gaming devices have basically taken shape after decades of development, and most game developers only make game software, game developers rarely need to consider the design of hardware. They usually pay more attention to the matching rules of buttons, the interaction methods of UI, etc.

I. Button Mapping and Operation Methods

In terms of button mapping, the key layout designed for right-handed people largely does not allow left-handed players to play the game conveniently. Faced with games that cannot be remapped, players can only use “cross-handed” or squeeze their hands together for difficult operations.

Therefore, the accessibility feature of custom button remapping has its indispensable significance.

Besides the key layout, players with mild paralysis and joint strain should not be ignored. Long presses, frequent taps, and other operations in combat add obstacles to them or cause muscle fatigue and other problems. Changeable operation settings can avoid this situation.

II. Interaction of Music and Sound Effects

For some players with visual impairment and sensory processing disorder (SPD), the former are more sensitive to sound, and the latter have difficulty processing complex sensory signals. Therefore, overly rich sound effects in the game may interfere with these players’ judgment of their own and other players’ status in the game.

Players can adjust the volume of some background music that has a shocking effect but does not benefit the battle, and increase the volume of some sound effects that prompt enemy attacks and environmental traps, so that the game experience becomes no longer difficult.

III. Camera and Picture Settings

In addition to buttons and interaction, control also covers “how to give feedback to the player when the player performs an operation.” Specifically, after we press the button, how much time does the player have to react to the next step; what changes should there be in the movement speed, camera, UI, and sound effects of the characters in the game; and how should the rules of change be communicated to the player, etc.

In this regard, players with motion sickness have a lot to say. When watching realistic game screens, the optic nerves of these players will feel large-amplitude and high-frequency movements. At the same time, other motion sensory organs (such as the ear vestibular apparatus) do not feel any movement. This situation is very contradictory to the nerve center, so the nerve center strongly issues a dizziness command, hoping that the body can stop and get rid of this ominous situation. In severe cases, players even vomit while playing.

If you have experienced motion sickness, you can probably empathize with these players.

Switch View

Players with motion sickness mostly experience dizziness when playing first-person perspective games. This is because the game screen presents the protagonist’s subjective perspective, and the picture will move with every movement of the character. At this time, the player’s eyes do not have an object to focus on accurately, and dizziness is likely to occur.

In the third-person perspective, players can find an object to focus on accurately in the game. Therefore, even when the camera and characters are moving, the overall change of the picture will not be as drastic as the first-person perspective, and dizziness is not easy to occur.

Therefore, for some games where the picture and lens may have rich changes, a flexible switching perspective can better improve the game experience of players with motion sickness and increase the player’s game time.

Change Field of View

The field of view determines the amount of scene information. The natural field of view of humans is 120°, while the default field of view of traditional first-person perspective games is 85-90°. In the case of a narrow field of view, the scene changes greatly, and any abrupt action may cause discomfort. Nowadays, many games have settings to adjust the range of change in the game’s field of view. In order to reduce motion sickness, players can increase the field of view. In this way, the range of scene changes when turning is reduced, and relatively speaking, it gives the brain more time to react.

Camera Drive

Some games, in order to create a realistic game experience, will increase the shaking of the camera in some situations, such as walking stairs and being attacked, giving people a strong stimulation, which may affect players with motion sickness to control the character normally.

In addition, if the perspective rotates too sensitively when the mouse is rotated, it will also make these players feel dizzy.

Motion Blur & Dolly Zoom Effect

Motion Blur

Motion blur is the moving effect in the image of a scene. It is more obvious in situations where the exposure time is long or the objects in the scene are moving fast.

We are accustomed to motion blur in TV or movies, so it feels unreal not to see it in moving images. In order to enhance the realism of the game, game developers often add motion blur effects.

The picture with motion blur will bring a strong motion effect. When the motion blur effect is reduced, the motion effect of the picture is also weakened accordingly, thereby reducing the possibility of dizziness.

Dolly Zoom Effect

The Dolly zoom effect is the instant when the camera is switched while moving backward and zooming, thereby producing a disorienting effect.

This effect is often performed simultaneously with zoom and camera movement, but the main space in the picture remains unchanged. It is generally used to render a certain tense emotion or emphasize the environment in which the character in the picture is located. Slowly performing this process can achieve the effect of highlighting the target object; it can also be deliberately performed quickly to create an impression of disorientation, thereby causing dizziness.

These are all methods adopted by game designers to make the game world more realistic. However, while adding these effects, they do not forget some players with motion sickness in the real world, and set up adjustment mechanisms for them, which is truly “designing for the real world.”

IV. Conclusion

In the process of designing games, if the designer only starts from himself or daily situations, it is difficult to comprehensively consider the needs of all players, and it is bound to discourage some people. Adding some accessibility features that are beneficial to players with disabilities to experience the game, without affecting the normal experience of other players, is precisely the meaning of “inclusiveness”. We use this to attract and accept as many player groups as possible, and open our arms to a wider world. And this is precisely the meaning of “designing for the real world.”

entry.title: What We Talk About When We Talk About Map Data Visualization
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Cognitive science research shows that illustrations can help people understand knowledge faster and retain it for longer periods. In the era of big data, we have also reached a consensus: data visualization can help us gain insight into the meaning of data. Map data visualization can express the spatial relationship between data in the most intuitive form, and has capabilities that no other method has. So what is map data visualization? What are its application scenarios? What are the implementation schemes on the Web? This article will discuss these one by one, and at the end of the article, some tools for map visualization will also be introduced.

What is Map Visualization and Its Application Scenarios

Map data visualization does not have a very official definition. It can be summarized as: Map data visualization is a data visualization method that visually presents data with geographical characteristics or analysis results on a geographic information map, which makes it easier for users to understand data patterns. The definition in words is not intuitive, and the following examples of application scenarios will make the definition easier to understand.

Starting from our surroundings, querying scenic spots and routes through map software (web pages) is a kind of map visualization, which visually marks locations, paths, road conditions and other information on real geographic information.

 

From a higher perspective, statistical analysis of earthquakes around the world over a period of time, the following figure marks the earthquake points on the world map, which can visually show the seismic zone.

 

In business activities, map visualization often appears in various reports to clearly show the distribution of data in geographic space.

 

In addition to real-world, national and other geographic information, other data visualizations related to spatial location can also be called map data visualization. For example, data visualization on a game map to show the distribution of birth points, character movement trajectories, and so on.

 

Through the above examples, the rules of map visualization can be summarized:

  1. Map visualization uses geographic information as the base map, and uses points, lines, and surfaces to represent data on the upper layer.
  2. Map visualization is usually used to represent the distribution and flow of data in geographic space.

Related Technologies for Map Data Visualization on the Web

Since the map uses geographic information as the base map and then adds data display of points, lines, and surfaces, the discussion of technical solutions can also be divided into two steps: geographic information base map rendering, and data layer visualization. The visualization of the data layer is basically the same as other data visualization methods, using canvas, svg or their upper-level technologies, but it is necessary to choose various projection functions to map the position to the base map. Therefore, this article will focus on the visualization technology of geographic information base maps.

In many systems, the geographic information base map does not actually render a map, but merely pastes a picture. The upper-level data is displayed through absolute or relative positioning, which is a visual deception, but it is effective and can save resources.

It can be seen that the base map in the report map mentioned earlier is composed of a series of polygons, which is a simple base map rendering method. Both Canvas and SVG in Web applications can render polygons (including curved edges).

Below is a visualization of an aircraft seat map. The base map is obtained through the graphic elements of SVG, and the data layer is filled with colors for the graphic elements.

 

The polygon description of maps of Chinese provinces, world countries, and other maps that we are familiar with has a unified format: GeoJSON (GeoJSON is a format for encoding various geographic data structures, a geographic spatial information data exchange format based on Javascript object notation). TopoJSON and other data formats have also been derived later. The coordinate points in GeoJSON are composed of longitude and latitude, so each piece of data in the data layer should also contain longitude, latitude, and numerical values. Some mature visualization libraries do not seem to require users to provide longitude and latitude, but actually complete the calculation internally. For example, in the following example from the Echarts official website, passing in the name of the area can complete the drawing of the data layer.

 

 

Similar to the earthquake distribution map in the previous section, maps that contain terrain information (need to render different heights), or as shown in the figure below, need to display spheres, need to use WebGL technology (WebGL is a JavaScript API, with a very consistent API with OpenGL ES 2.0, used for Web 3D rendering) for drawing. Mature 3D drawing libraries like Three.js are upper-level encapsulations based on WebGL. In actual use, choosing these mature underlying libraries can improve development efficiency.

 

The example of map navigation mentioned at the beginning of the article uses a high-precision base map, which is a completely different drawing technique. They may use a vector map solution, or a tile map (the tile map pyramid model is a multi-resolution hierarchical model. From the bottom to the top of the tile pyramid, the resolution becomes lower and lower, but the geographic range represented remains unchanged). When the map in the viewport is loaded in batches of rectangles, it uses the tile map technology solution. The accuracy of this type of map is much higher than that of polygon maps, and it can basically be accurate to buildings and shops. It is naturally superior to polygon maps in zooming interaction, so it is used for map data visualization with high precision requirements. The data layer also uses longitude and latitude to identify the data location. Now map service providers such as Mapbox, AutoNavi Maps, Tianditu, etc. all provide SDK for JavaScript. Mature chart libraries also encapsulate the calls of these SDKs, which are relatively convenient to use. Offline tile data can also be found online for developers to build offline map services. However, the development difficulty of this type of base map is higher than that of polygon maps, and there are different regulations on the number of calls and commercial access.

Map Data Visualization Tools

Excel

Excel provides map drawing functions, and Microsoft Power Map for Excel needs to be introduced. This is suitable for people who are familiar with Excel to perform static map data visualization. The usage methods of different Excel versions are not exactly the same.

 

Echarts

Echarts is a mature visualization library of js, which not only contains a small amount of 3D functions, but also uniformly provides high-precision base map API, which is suitable for most map data visualizations. Many BI platforms are implemented based on Echarts, but using Echarts requires users to have some programming skills. Programming languages such as Python and Matlab also have corresponding map visualization libraries.

 

Mapbox

Mapbox provides high-precision base map services and rich data layer drawing APIs, with highly free base map style customization, but as a lower-level map tool than Echarts, it requires higher programming skills.

 

Commercial BI such as NetEase Youdata

Many commercial platforms provide map data visualization functions. Their functions are rich and do not require users to program, but they basically require registration and fees.

 

Conclusion

Different data visualization methods are suitable for different information expressions. Map data visualization is suitable for expressing data distribution and flow related to geographic information. Map data visualization can be divided into two steps: base map drawing and data map drawing. Developers need to choose different technical solutions according to different needs scenarios. Data visualization has always been a method, and our real goal is to more clearly represent the information in the data through visualization.

entry.title: Introduction and Practical Application of R-Q Factor Analysis
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Basic Introduction

R-Q factor analysis is a multivariate analysis method developed on the basis of R-type factor analysis and Q-type factor analysis. Its basic idea is to represent the rows (generally representing samples) and columns (generally representing variables) in the contingency table as points in a lower-dimensional space, so that more intuitive analysis can be carried out. For instance, consider a contingency table of different types of players’ purchases of items in a game:

Item A Item B Item C Item D Item E
Type 1 10 5 15 20 5
Type 2 5 10 5 10 20
Type 3 20 15 10 5 5
Type 4 10 20 5 15 10

It can be found that when there are many categories of variables and samples under study, it is difficult to directly and intuitively reveal the relationship between variables through the contingency table. Therefore, the idea of dimensionality reduction can be used to simplify the structure of the contingency table. At this time, factor analysis will be the first thing that comes to mind. However, the disadvantage of general factor analysis is that R-type factor analysis only studies the relationship between variables, and Q-type factor analysis only studies the relationship between samples. But in many fields, both need to be carried out at the same time. Therefore, R-Q factor analysis (also known as correspondence analysis) came into being. Correspondence analysis is to reflect the variables and the relationship between variables on a two-dimensional scatter plot. Closely related variable points are closer, while less related category points are more dispersed. By observing the corresponding distribution map, you can very intuitively feel the connection between variables, as shown in the following figure:

 

Method Principle

Because the theory of this method is more complicated and involves a lot of formulas, due to space limitations, this article does not involve the principle, and only briefly introduces the calculation process. Skipping it does not affect the subsequent practical part.

First, convert the contingency table matrix to a probability matrix, where:

 

Through transformation, the probability matrix P is obtained:

 

Then, the transition matrix Z is obtained by standardizing the probability matrix:

 

Therefore, the covariance matrix A of variables and the covariance matrix B of samples are respectively:

 

Next, calculate the factor loading matrices F and G of R-type and Q-type respectively. They are respectively:


Where λi is the eigenvalue of matrices A and B, and ui and vi are the eigenvectors of matrices A and B.

According to the theorem, matrices A and B have exactly the same non-zero eigenvalues, and these eigenvalues are the variances of each common factor. Therefore, the same factor axis can be used to represent variable points and sample points at the same time. Therefore, F and G are respectively regarded as p two-dimensional points and n two-dimensional points are drawn in a common coordinate plane, forming a corresponding distribution map, which can intuitively see the connection between various categories.

R Language Practical Application

Although the theory of R-Q factor analysis is more complicated, its use in R language is very simple, and it can be completed in three steps:

Step 1: Install the R language package ‘ca’ and load it

Enter the code install.packages('ca') in the command line to complete the installation.

Then load the package with the code library('ca').

Step 2: Read the data

If it is a csv file, it can be completed by file reading code

data <- read.csv(“path/filename.csv”, header= T)

Step 3: R language modeling and drawing

Model with code result <- ca(data)

Then draw with the code plot(result), and the corresponding distribution map is drawn successfully!

At the same time, in the output results, we need to pay more attention to the indicator Principal inertias (eigenvalues), which represents the contribution rate of each eigenvalue. Since we finally need the largest two eigenvalues as two dimensions for the corresponding graph display, the larger the first two eigenvalues, the higher the contribution, and the more it can analyze the real information of the data. Our example is as follows:

 

It can be seen that the first two eigenvalues can explain 86.01% of the data, which is a very good result.

Summary

R-Q factor analysis has many application scenarios. It can be used to analyze the preferences of different types of players for game props and different gameplays, and can be well used in cross-recommendation; it can also analyze the preferences of users from different channels for different types of games, assist in the rational use of channel resources, and thus better promote channels; it can also analyze various dimensions among players of different occupations and different age groups. R-Q factor analysis has the following advantages:

  1. It can reveal the relationship between row variables and column variables
  2. Intuitively express the relationship between multi-dimensional variables in a two-dimensional graph
  3. The operation and implementation are relatively simple

Finally, I hope everyone can gain something from this article and apply R-Q factor analysis to work and study practice!

entry.title: The Significance of Measuring Sample Size: Wilson Score
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

In user questionnaire analysis, sometimes we face a situation:

Fashion A: 8 out of 13 players voted “like,” 5 voted “dislike.”
Fashion B: 16 out of 28 players “like,” 12 “dislike.”
Fashion C: 135 out of 270 players “like,” 135 “dislike.”

At this point, how should we choose which fashion is more popular with players?

Method 1: Look at the net “like” count, i.e., “like” count - “dislike” count. In this case, Fashion B should be the most popular.

Method 2: Look at the “like” rate, i.e., “like” count / (“like” count + “dislike” count). In this case, Fashion A should be the most popular.

Is there perhaps a more convincing method?

Besides wondering why so many people filled out the questionnaire for Fashion C, while only a few people filled it out for Fashions A and B, this problem actually contains knowledge about sample size and statistics. One solution to this problem is the Wilson score, which cleverly applies the knowledge of statistical interval estimation to content evaluation, combining sample size and player evaluation to obtain a fairer and more effective evaluation score.

Image: Outfit in the game “Naraka: Bladepoint” - Yummy Yummy

What is the Wilson Score?

Strictly speaking, the Wilson score can be called the lower bound of the confidence interval for the binomial distribution interval estimation. It makes the following assumptions about players’ voting behavior:

  • Each player’s vote is an independent event.
  • Players’ voting results are only “like” and “dislike”.

Under such assumptions, voting “like” or “dislike” is transformed into a binomial distribution in probability. By collecting player questionnaires, we can estimate the player’s “like” rate p for a certain outfit. That is, in n independent votes, there are k votes for “like”. By using the actual values of n and k, we can evaluate the relationship between k/n and p.

Intuitively, when n is larger, k/n will be closer to p, and when n is smaller, the result of k/n may lack persuasiveness.

Confidence intervals and interval estimation are a type of parameter estimation. For example, regarding the player’s preference rate p for a certain fashion item, unless we ask every player if they really like a certain fashion item, we can never get all players’ opinions on a certain fashion item. Therefore, we need to analyze the results of the questionnaires already obtained to infer the relationship between the player’s questionnaire preference rate k/n and the player’s true preference rate p in the existing results. Since it is an inference or estimation, there are two situations: overestimation and underestimation. The entire interval connecting underestimation and overestimation is interval estimation. In contrast, point estimation only estimates one result.

Wilson Score Calculation

The Wilson score formula is as follows (Wikipedia: Binomial proportion confidence interval):

Where n is the sample size, i.e., the total number of votes;

p is the “like” rate of the questionnaire players, k/n;

z is the standard normal distribution statistic for a certain confidence interval, which can be obtained by looking up the table, usually taking 1.96.

From the score formula, we can find that the Wilson score adjusts the original simple calculation method of k/n with the sample size n, making the result fairer:

When the sample size is small, this value will tend to be smaller;
When the sample size is large, this value will keep approaching the actual data result of k/n.

In fact, this value formula is the lower bound of the confidence interval for the interval estimation of the binomial distribution parameter p. The lower bound, as the name suggests, is an underestimation of the parameter to be estimated. Only with strong evidence can we face up to the results of, for example, 95% or 99% preference rate generated from the questionnaire. Otherwise, under a small statistical sample size, the 95% preference rate will be greatly reduced.

In addition, sometimes it may be necessary to overestimate certain values. For example, based on the principle of prudence, overestimating the future player churn rate, we can choose the upper bound of the confidence interval:

This algorithm was proposed in 1927 by a middle-aged man named Wilson.

In the same year, another elderly man named Wilson won the Nobel Prize in Physics for his research on microscopic particles.

entry.title: What User Experience Can Do in Game IP Crossover Events
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

What is Game IP Crossover?

IP is the abbreviation of Intellectual Property, which is actually the legal concept of “intellectual property.” In the network context, the concept of IP is broader. Generally speaking, a cultural brand that can be independently disseminated on multiple platforms, developed in multiple dimensions, and realized for commercial monetization will be called an IP. IP usually has a complete worldview and values, with three basic characteristics: first, the diversity of forms of literary and artistic works; second, the hierarchical complexity of operating methods; and third, profound influence in social life. In other words, IP is actually a kind of word-of-mouth communication. It does not need to rely on advertising and marketing to achieve effective interpersonal publicity, and it can quickly gather audiences with similar worldviews and values, and even form a culture.

Such a desirable commodity will naturally not be missed by the game industry. IP crossover is now a major trend in the gaming world. In games, IP crossover usually takes the following forms:

Crossovers in the Same Field

Crossovers in the same field, that is, crossovers between game IPs and game IPs. For example, Naraka: Bladepoint, which was very popular upon release, had a crossover with Onmyoji. Specifically, the crossover between Naraka: Bladepoint and Onmyoji is a more common character crossover, adding Onmyoji‘s popular character Yoto Hime as a new hero to the game, and launching a series of Onmyoji crossover weapons and skins.

 

 

Some game crossovers, in addition to appearance and character crossovers, will also bring their own gameplay, plot/character settings into other games.

Cross-Field Crossovers

There is also a cross-field crossover, such as a film-game crossover. Crossovers between games and film and television dramas, animations, novels, etc. are all counted in this large category. Specific crossover forms include the adaptation of film and television works into mobile games, and the simultaneous release of film and television dramas and games to promote the game through the popularity of film and television. For example, the crossover between the Justice Online PC game and the TV series Ordinary Glory is a very good crossover case. In the TV series, the behind-the-scenes story of how the Justice Online development team, in the face of the pressure of huge R&D costs, adhered to the original intention of developing high-quality PC games in the turbulent wave of the PC game market, was included. It lets more audiences know the hardships of the staff behind the game through TV series.

 

Why Crossover IPs?

Attracting new users and increasing revenue and engagement are eternal propositions for games. The emergence of IP crossover promotion methods is also closely related to this. From the perspective of attracting new users, as the penetration rate of game users increases, the cost of acquiring new game users through traditional methods will also become higher and higher. Because IP itself has high cultural vitality, when using IP for publicity, it can be spread more easily and save promotion costs. On the other hand, the audience of the IP itself may also be transformed into game players, achieving the effect of acquiring new users from other fields.

From the perspective of promoting engagement, large IPs themselves have a broad mass base, which may highly overlap with the player groups in the game. Crossovering with IPs will undoubtedly excite these old players and increase their stickiness to the game. Some original lost players may also return due to IP activities. For non-IP audiences, it can also increase the novelty of the game. Furthermore, good crossover events may also bring self-propagation among players, bring more users, and the game’s revenue will naturally increase.

What Role Does User Research Play in IP Crossovers?

IP Crossover sounds like a marketing-oriented content, so what role can user research play in it?

First, it’s the choice of IP. Although IP is good, the value of the IP itself and the degree of fit between the IP and the game may not be high. A good IP is either one that has a wide enough audience, so no matter what game it crosses over with, it can cover a part of the population. But this type of IP is expensive and everyone is scrambling for it. Not to mention the cost-effectiveness, the cooperation may not even be negotiated. The other is that its audience highly overlaps with a certain game, and the user similarity is extremely high, so the players will have a higher acceptance of the worldview, character settings, etc. It is not easy to have problems, and it may also achieve the effect of small cost and large income. The user research department can help the product conduct research on all these issues at an early stage.

When an intended IP has been selected:

① UE can conduct desk research to investigate the player characteristics and audience range of the target IP, and create a user persona of IP fans, helping to screen the fit between the IP and the game itself.

② On the other hand, it can also investigate what classic elements the IP itself has, and what are the most famous/most nostalgic events, to help determine the content suitable for crossover.

③ In addition, UE can also conduct research on existing players in the game to understand players’ awareness and acceptance of the IP, and avoid possible risks after the crossover. No matter what, it is very counterproductive for old players to disapprove of the crossover IP. Old players should at least have a neutral attitude towards the IP.

Of course, when no intended IP has been selected, UE can also conduct research to understand what IP players most want to crossover with, and how different IPs are favored by game players.

Secondly, after the crossover event has been launched, UE often comprehensively tracks the crossover effect through public opinion monitoring, questionnaire tracking, data analysis, telephone surveys, and other methods. For example, how do we know who are fan players and how do they feel about the game? And which part of the fans has a good conversion effect and can increase publicity, and which fans have a poor conversion effect? The user research department can tag players with fan labels and source labels when they enter the game, regularly track all data of these players in the game, and combine qualitative research methods to understand their true inner thoughts.

There are many other things that user research can do in IP crossovers, including but not limited to: new user acquisition effect prediction of the crossover, new fan player persona, fan retention analysis, crossover event analysis, external public opinion tracking, fan communication characteristics analysis… Of course, don’t forget that regular tracking and risk assessment of old players are very important.

In summary, IP crossover is both an opportunity and a risk. Only by truly doing user research well is it responsible for the game.

entry.title: When Players Say a Class is Too Weak, Is It Really Because the Damage is Too Low?
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

“Devs, this class is too weak, it’s basically a bottom-tier class, please buff it.” “Devs, the damage output of the XX class is too low, I don’t want to be a tickle monster anymore.” In players’ daily game experience feedback, feedback about class strength has always accounted for a high proportion.

Game designers are often very cautious about adjusting the skill values of classes, because adjusting one class will also affect other classes, and the balance of the entire game’s classes may be affected. Moreover, the strength of classes cannot be adjusted frequently. It is impossible to nerf one day, buff a little the next day, and then nerf again the day after. Therefore, when making decisions about class adjustments, it is necessary to rely on the analysis of massive game data, and it is definitely not “distribution according to noise”. So how do designers make decisions based on these “voices of the people” from players, and whether to adjust the strength of a certain class that players feedback?

This article will share with you the reasons why “players feedback that a certain class is too weak” discovered in previous class-related research. As well as the common adjustment ideas that designers have for some class strength problems.

First, let’s break down the process of a player experiencing a new class and forming an opinion on the strength of the class:

  1. Pre-experience Expectation Setting: Players have expectations for a class before playing.
  2. Inital Perceived Strength: Comparing play experience to initial expectations.
  3. Skill Usage Comprehension: Determining understanding and execution of skill usage.
  4. Attribute Growth & Allocation: Developing an understanding of class building.
  5. Actual Combat Strength: Gauging actual combat performance based on the above.

Many times, players and even researchers will be preconceived to think that the problem lies in the last step, that is, there is a problem with the numerical settings of the class itself, resulting in the output not being able to be hit or being easily killed. Therefore, suggestions such as increasing class damage are often given. But in fact, problems in any of the above steps will cause players to have a wrong judgment on the strength of the class. According to the breakdown of each process, we can divide the problem into the following 4 categories:

Problem Type 1: Disparity Experience Caused by Overly High Expectations / Deviation in Cognitive Strength of Class Role

This problem occurs in steps 1 and 2. The reason for the problem is often that the strength and output ability of the new class are described too strongly in the early class promotion, or the role is not clearly introduced, which will make players have too high expectations for the strength of this class before the experience. After the actual experience, it is found that the strength of the class is not as high as expected, and there is an obvious sense of disparity.

For example, Justice Online Mobile has a class called Yingling with 3 forms. The 3 forms are melee output, ranged output, and healing support. In the early promotion, the switching of the 3 states, as well as the characteristics of melee, ranged, burst output and healing, were emphasized. Before the experience, players easily think that this class is an all-round ACE class that can be melee, ranged output, heal, and buff. But in fact, these 3 forms cannot be switched freely. Due to the long CD, in a battle, it is expected to switch only 2-3 times. It is impossible for the player to switch to a healing state to heal themself at any time and then switch back to output. The design expectation of this class was never an all-round class. The advantage of this class is that it allows players to adapt to more scene needs and freely choose their preferred class.

Without understanding the actual positioning of the class, after the actual experience, players find that the output of this new class is not top-notch, and the support is not necessary, and the positioning is very awkward. So a lot of negative feedback appeared. This is a typical problem caused by excessive expectations and deviations in the cognitive strength of the class role.

For this type of problem, what needs to be adjusted is not the strength of the class, but to start with the player’s expectation management.

So how do we generally locate this type of problem? In addition to qualitative player feedback, our commonly used quantitative diagnostic method is to understand the player’s expected strength and actual experience strength through a questionnaire to see if there is an obvious gap between the two.

Problem Type 2: Misunderstanding of Class Skills or Misuse of Core Skill Rotation

This problem occurs in step 3. For example, the newly released Yantian class in Revelation M. To achieve one-shot headshot damage, you need to first stack bleeding layers with basic attacks. Each layer of bleeding can bring additional damage. The more damage layers, the higher the damage. Then use two damage-increasing skills, and then use sniper to deal massive damage. Some players just started playing and don’t know this kind of play style. They add two states when they meet and start sniping. The damage will be greatly reduced, and then feedback that Yantian is a tickle monster.

For this type of problem that causes players to think that the class is too weak, it is necessary to improve it by strengthening the guidance of class output methods. Sometimes designers will also actively simplify the output routine to reduce the player’s cognitive burden. For example, for classes that stack states, originally only two specific skills could be used to stack states, and now any output skill can be used to stack states, simplifying the output cycle. In this type of problem, in addition to the problem that the above output cycle is not correct, misunderstanding the core output skills is also a common situation.

For the diagnosis of this type of problem, the quantitative data we generally use is the frequency of player skill use in dungeons or PVP gameplay to see whether the player’s skill use is inconsistent with expectations, and whether the wrong skills are used. Some classes that need to apply statuses will also use status-related data to diagnose whether the player is correctly applying statuses.

Problem Type 3: Wrong Class Development Direction

This problem occurs in step 4. For example, the Yingling class in Justice Online Mobile mentioned above, if the main form is Yueming. In Yueming‘s core output cycle, immobilization is a very important part. One is because this control is brought by the core skill, and the other is that immobilization is needed to ensure that the output cycle is played smoothly. Then for players who play the Yueming form of Yingling, the immobilization attribute must be high. But in Justice Online Mobile, immobilization is not the mainstream control attribute, and generally people will not focus on it. Therefore, many players who feedback that Yueming‘s output is weak are found to have low immobilization. In addition to the above classes with clear attribute emphasis. Classes with different types of output methods will also have different attribute emphases. Burst-type output, stacking critical strikes and critical damage will have high returns, and can achieve one-shot kills, and critical strikes are guaranteed profits. Stable output type classes, stacking attack will have relatively higher returns, improving the overall output level. Therefore, if the core attributes of the class are not correct, it will also lead to the expected strength of the class not being able to be well exerted.

The solution to this type of problem is generally to guide ordinary players through official guides or guides from top players. And the attribute leaderboards in the game also play a certain guiding role. Ordinary players can also learn the core attributes of the class by viewing the attributes of top players on the leaderboards. Because of this, after the launch of a new class, players will be allowed to experience it for 1-2 weeks before they really start to adjust the strength. It is necessary to let players familiarize themselves with the skills and point allocation methods. If the class is strengthened based on the winning rate data of players’ experience in a few days. It is easy to appear that after players are familiar with the skills and improve their training level, the class strength increases by a level, and they have to face a nerf, which will bring a more negative experience.

For the diagnosis of this type of problem, you can directly pull out the attribute value data of players of each class, and you can intuitively see the attribute allocation emphasis of each class and whether it is correct.

Problem Type 4: Class Strength Problems/Output Environment Problems

This problem occurs in step 5. The problems in the previous steps are more problems of player understanding and cognition, rather than the real problem of class design itself. If the previous problems are ruled out, and the player can play the class routine and cultivate attributes as expected by the designer, and the class performance is still poor, then it is necessary to consider the problem of the class itself.

But even if it is the problem of the class itself, many times it is not simply solved by increasing skill damage.

Before the launch of a new class, designers will conduct a lot of tests, and generally there will not be too much difference in numerical values from expectations. But what is not easily covered by internal testing is: the complex and changeable battle situation in the gameplay, and various dungeons with different mechanisms. For example, in a 1v1 battle situation, when the situation is relatively simple, the output can easily play its own output cycle. But once it comes to team battles or 5v5, the output will face the situation of being focused by multiple opponents. Coupled with control, the output environment is very poor, and it is difficult to play the expected output. In addition, most of the designers are top players, and they are often prone to overestimate the player’s reaction time and operating level, designing an operation cycle that requires too high operations, resulting in the real situation after the official launch, players can’t use it, or in other words, in a real and changeable environment, this kind of operation cycle is difficult to use smoothly.

This type of problem is often not solved by simply increasing the damage value, but by optimizing the output environment or reducing the output operation. For example, for classes with many skill combos or requiring stacking states, this core output cycle is relatively long. In actual combat, it is easy to be interrupted, resulting in the output not being able to be played. This situation is generally improved by enhancing the super armor (cannot be interrupted and controlled during the output process) or enhancing the control (first control the opponent to ensure that their output is not easy to be interrupted). Or reduce the duration of stacking states, such as originally needing to stack 15 layers to deal high damage, reduced to stacking 10 layers.

For the diagnosis of this type of problem, you can look at the actual values of the class in the dungeon or PK to see whether the class performance meets expectations. Common indicators are: total output, DPS (output should have the appearance of output), damage taken, healing; number of kills (whether it has the demeanor of a main C), number of kills (survival environment). For example, to see whether the output of an output class is up to standard, in PK, the output and number of kills of the output class will be ranked among other classes to see if it meets the design expectations; in dungeons, DPS will be looked at. The DPS value can easily show whether there is a gap between the actual output capability and the expected output capability of the output class.

In summary, when a player feeds back that their class is too weak, it is not necessarily a problem with the class design itself. It is necessary to first judge whether the player has cognitive biases and is unfamiliar with class skills and attribute allocation. Only by finding the root of the problem can we “prescribe the right medicine”.

entry.title: Faithfulness, Expressiveness, and Elegance: Translation Design in Naraka: Bladepoint
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

In the depths of your mind, do you envision a dashing young man traveling the world with a sword? We may know about wuxia (武侠 - martial heroes) from the literary works of masters like Jin Yong (金庸) and Gu Long (古龙). Weaponry, martial arts, rare treasures, and love and hate are all things that people in the jianghu (江湖 - martial arts world) care about most.

In today’s rapidly developing technology, games, as a new form of literary expression, have entered the world stage. And Naraka: Bladepoint is one such authentic wuxia-style work, carrying the Chinese people’s innate pursuit of “freedom of the self” in the martial arts spirit, and conveying this spirit and culture to game lovers all over the world. So, for us, the first difficulty to overcome in overseas localization is how to translate the wuxia flavor in Naraka: Bladepoint authentically?

Faithfulness, Expressiveness, and Elegance (信达雅 - xìn dá yǎ)

The translation rules of “faithfulness,” “expressiveness,” and “elegance” were proposed by Yan Fu (严复), a prominent enlightenment thinker in late Qing Dynasty China. In the “Introduction to Translation” of Evolution and Ethics, he said: “There are three difficulties in translation: faithfulness, expressiveness, and elegance. It is already very difficult to achieve faithfulness! However, if it is faithful but not expressive, although it is translated, it is as if it is not translated, so expressiveness is still important.”

“Faithfulness” means that the meaning does not deviate from the original text, that is, the translation should be accurate, not deviate, not omit, and not add or subtract meaning at will; “expressiveness” means not being constrained by the original form, and the translation is smooth and clear; “elegance” means that the words used in the translation should be appropriate, pursuing the elegance and simplicity of the text itself.

In layman’s terms, the translation should conform to the characteristics of the Chinese language, pay attention to the integrity of a sentence, that is, content, structure, and style, that is, the accuracy of the content, the smoothness of the grammatical structure, and the literary grace of the language carrier. Taking Vietnamese localization as an example, the following will introduce how we design and adjust on the road of “faithfulness, expressiveness, and elegance”.

Faithfulness: Accuracy - The “Vast Sea” Case in Naraka: Bladepoint

Many terms in Naraka: Bladepoint use Chinese allusions, such as the “Vast Sea” (瀚海 - hàn hǎi) that we will mention next. The meaning of “Vast Sea” has changed drastically with the changes of history.

During the Han and Six Dynasties, “Vast Sea” was the name of a northern sea. During the reign of Emperor Wu of Han, Huo Qubing attacked the Xiongnu’s left territory, went out of Dai County for more than two thousand miles, and returned after reaching the Vast Sea. By the Tang Dynasty, this term was transformed into a general term for the vast areas north of the Gobi Desert on the Mongolian Plateau and its westward extension to the Junggar Basin. Gao Shi, a frontier poet of the Tang Dynasty, wrote in “Song of Yan”: “The lieutenant’s feather book flies to the Vast Sea, and the Chanyu’s hunting fire illuminates the Wolf Mountain.”

In the game, we also have related terms: “Wind of the Vast Sea*”. This is also a challenge for our translation team. Is this wind blowing from the sea? Or from the desert? In order to accurately translate the meaning of the term, we compared the art resources inside the game and confirmed that the term corresponds to Canaan’s desert-style skin. Combining with the meaning of the term, we gave an accurate translation.

 

Figure 1. Canaan - Desert Eagle

Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Note: This content is the translation result of the August 21 version, and the term has now been adjusted to “Desert Eagle”.

Expressiveness: Conveyance - The “Tachi” Case in Naraka: Bladepoint

Before the launch, we did not expect that the translation of tachi (太刀 - tài dāo, a type of Japanese sword) would trigger so many discussions among Vietnamese players. In the early stage, we directly translated tachi into “Thái Đao” (the Sino-Vietnamese word for tachi).

 

Figure 2. The Vietnamese term for tachi does exist

 

Figure 3. There are 18.5 million search results for searching “Thái Đao”

After the launch, we never expected that the translation of this word would become the focus of discussion in the community that day.

In the Vietnamese understanding, tachi is a sword. So players had a heated discussion about whether tachi is a “dao” (刀 - knife/sabre) or a “kiem” (剑 - sword). Since “太” and “泰” (Thai) are homophones in Sino-Vietnamese, new players raised new questions: Why is tachi from Thailand?

 

Figure 4. Tachi引发玩家无数讨论的太刀 (Tachi that sparked countless discussions among players)

At first, we were also nervous about this public opinion, fearing that players would be dissatisfied with our translation professionalism. But because Vietnamese is a modifier-head language structure, the grammatical confusion that “Thai knife” may cause is actually very small. In addition, “Thái” has the meaning of slender and narrow in Vietnamese. After discussing it on their own for a day, players expressed their recognition and understanding of our translation version.

In such a positive and active communication, we are very happy to have such a group of players in the community who care about the details of the game. As the saying goes, the more truth is debated, the clearer it becomes, and the same is true for translation. Whether it is for our localization colleagues or players, tachi has left a deep impression on our hearts.

Elegance: Beauty - The Wuxia Style Case in Naraka: Bladepoint

When novices first enter the game, we will be awakened by the Yin God as Ning Hongye, and then enter the novice teaching of climbing and collecting. The first few sentences in this stage are carefully designed. We adjusted the game translation content to a concise Gu Long style, using short sentences and imperative sentences, so that players can feel a chilling atmosphere as soon as they enter the game, instantly mobilizing the player’s adrenaline. Another advantage of this design is that it allows players to get clear guidance in the novice period, ensuring that information is delivered clearly and accurately.

 

Figure 5. Gu Long’s novels are wuxia classics

In addition, we also adjusted the translation style for different characters. For example, there are many differences in the style of writing in the background stories of Kurumi and Canaan. In Kurumi’s speech, we used a lot of exclamations and cute words to highlight the character’s innocence and cleverness.

 

Figure 6. Naraka: Bladepoint Hero: Tsuchimikado Kurumi

 

Figure 7. Kurumi’s tone of voice is clever and cute

Conclusion

A good translation text should be like a beautiful literary work, achieving the three points of “faithfulness”, “expressiveness” and “elegance”. If these three points can be achieved, this game will build a bridge for overseas players, remove the obstacles and barriers of language, and allow us to jointly feel this martial arts world.

entry.title: A Preliminary Study of Teaming Systems in Competitive Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

Do you remember how we started a multiplayer journey in the game? Sometimes it’s a team invitation from a powerful friend, sometimes it’s a teammate recruitment shout in the public channel, and sometimes it’s just a stranger we meet in the open world with the same goal… In most multiplayer games, the team system is often an important part of the game’s social composition and is closely related to the player’s game experience - good teammates will bring a refreshing and pleasant experience, and at the same time enhance the positive social interaction between players and may develop into new friend relationships, that is, to obtain the joy of the game through a good cooperation.

From the player’s point of view, the team system is a natural connection between the battle and friend systems. When we analyze the underlying logic of the team system from the perspective of game design, we may find some more interesting design constructs.

1. The Social Ecology of Games

First of all, what is the social ecology in the game? From the perspective of psychological design, the social ecology of the game is essentially a psychological need of players. In the classic Maslow’s hierarchy of needs, Maslow divides human needs from low to high into physiological needs, safety needs, social needs, esteem needs and self-actualization needs. Through a series of interactions such as environmental mapping and behavioral feedback in the game world, players can obtain a sense of belonging and self-esteem that transcends real time and space.

From the perspective of game design, the team system, friend system and battle matching system can be combined to build a basic game social ecosystem. A good social ecosystem design can bring higher player retention and a more stable social relationship cycle to the game, thereby improving the overall revenue of the game.

2. What is a Team System?

The team system is an important part of the game’s social ecosystem construction. It is closely related to the friend system and the battle matching system, two core systems.

The type of game and the characteristics of the core gameplay will also be reflected in the design of the team system. For example, some games pay more attention to matching cooperation (such as Overwatch), so its team system will pay more attention to functionality, while some games pay more attention to the fun of the gameplay (such as Warframe), so its team system will pay more attention to sociality and be more closely integrated with the friend system.

On the other hand, unlike random matching that directly enters the battle, the team system allows players to form or join a team according to specific needs, and there will be an adjustment and consensus process within the team, so that players have a greater sense of belonging in cooperative battles. It is a process of finding and recognizing each other, and sometimes it can also avoid the problem of inappropriate position selection caused by random matching, which is different from the fast game experience of directly pulling players into the team through matching.

In general, a good team system can promote player socialization and enhance the game experience of battle cooperation, which has an important positive impact on player retention.

Social-Based Teaming

At present, there are two main ways to team up in cooperative competitive games. One is to rely on the team-up method of friends, which is more social, but also more costly for players, because the team system limits the relationship between players and teammates to friends. The advantage is that the matching and cooperation experience between relatively familiar players is more stable and it is easy to enhance feelings; the disadvantage is that the cost of developing stranger friends is higher.

Quick Teaming

Another way is an independent team system, which allows players to quickly join a team with the same mission goals through some filtering conditions, which is slightly weaker in sociality but more convenient. The advantage is that the game experience of cooperation is smoother and faster, and the cost of getting to know stranger friends is lower; the disadvantage is that it is relatively more likely to find inappropriate teammates, which affects the game experience.

3. Application of Team System in Games

In practice, we will find that the team system in different games will be divided into two types of construction and classification: single-method teaming and composite-method teaming. This is because designers will build the team system according to the core gameplay of the game - games that focus on casual social gameplay will emphasize the sociality of teaming in the design, and such games can usually only be teamed up through friend invitations; on the other hand, games that focus on cooperative combat will pay more attention to the functionality of the team system in the design, and the priority is how to find the most suitable teammates for players. This team system is often composed of a combination of multiple methods.

Characteristics of Single-Method Team System

This teaming method completely relies on the friend system, and players can only form their own game team through friend invitations.

The advantage of this design is that it can better consolidate and promote the existing social relationship between players and friends, but the disadvantage is that it is more difficult to meet and develop new potential friends through team games.

《APEX》

The teaming function of APEX is nested in the battle matching system and relies on the friend system. It is a very typical single-method team system.

《Battlefield V》

Although the teaming function of Battlefield V is independent and permanently resident in the lower right corner of the game interface, it still relies on the friend system. It is also a very typical single-method team system.

Characteristics of Composite-Method Team System

In most game designs, social-based teaming and quick teaming are often combined to provide players with more diverse social choices, thereby improving the overall game experience.

《Overwatch》

Composite method teaming: social list invitation, recently matched teammates/opponents, independent team system

In Overwatch, players can form their own game team through three ways: friend list invitation, recently matched teammates/opponents, and independent team system. The entire team system is very complete, with both sociality and convenience.



《Harry Potter: Magic Awakened》

Composite method teaming: social list invitation, independent team system

The team system of the mobile game Harry Potter: Magic Awakened also adds diversified teaming methods. Players can not only team up with friends, but also find suitable powerful teammates through wizard mutual assistance when encountering difficult levels, which reduces the possibility of players getting stuck and also broadens the social channels of the game.


《Warframe》
