Composite method teaming: social list invitation, open world, public channel

Warframe is more biased towards MMO in the construction of the social system - players can not only invite friends from the list to team up, but also invite strangers in the public channel and the open world to team up. In addition, its designer added the “Recently Met People” module to the social interface to record other players who recently played dungeons with the player, which also has a certain positive significance for promoting social interaction.


4. Common Summary

In the design of the team interface, the main functions are composed of 6 interface elements: team information, team incentives, player invitation, game mode selection, team search, and filtering conditions. Different types of team system designs have different emphasis on presentation.

On the other hand, in terms of the packaging form of page design, there are currently two mainstream forms: scene-based design and modular design. Scene-based design can give players a more immersive game experience, while modular design makes players’ operations more efficient. Both methods have their own advantages and disadvantages. As a designer, it is also necessary to consider the degree of fit between the packaging form and the overall tone of the game in specific projects.

《Call of Duty》 Scene-Based Design Case

《APEX》 Modular Design Case

5. Conclusion

In the world of multiplayer games, the design method of the team system is closely related to the core gameplay. Games that focus on casual social interaction often have a closer connection between their team system and the friend system; while games that focus on cooperative combat have a closer connection between their team system and battle matching.

entry.title: Enhancing Player Attention - Emphasis Techniques
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Foreword

“Attention is the only portal of our mind, and everything in consciousness must pass through it.”
—— Ushinsky, a famous Russian educator and the founder of Russian educational psychology

Human attention is limited, and it is difficult for players to notice all the content of each interface in the game. How can we make the game more attractive and easier to get the attention of players? How can we make players pay more attention to the important content you want them to pay attention to? How can we allow players to avoid distractions during the game and get a better gaming experience? This article will introduce a way to enhance player attention - emphasis techniques.

I. What are Emphasis Techniques?

Emphasis techniques are methods to draw attention to a text area or image area. Emphasis techniques are very effective techniques to bring people’s attention to design elements.

Before delving into the problem, let’s first understand the characteristics of human memory and the principles of visual attention.

Memory Characteristics

Human memory is divided into short-term memory and long-term memory. Short-term memory automatically stores current information and is easy to retrieve, but its capacity is limited, so people can only maintain focused attention for a short time. When we perform a complex operation, if there are many restrictions and not enough clear guidance, it is easy to feel confused and irritable, not knowing how to continue, and the attention is interrupted.

Principles of Visual Attention

The area of the human eye that perceives visually only occupies a small part of the retina, which makes our visual ability very small and difficult to accommodate a lot of information at the same time. To keep the brain focused on something, there needs to be a clear goal. Once the human eye loses focus, it will lead to people’s attention being distracted and losing interest. Therefore, it becomes very necessary to help the brain organize basic element information when there is a large amount of visual information input. When facing exactly the same information, content, function, and interaction process, the different visual representations of elements will affect the efficiency, attention, and even understanding of information in the visual processing process.

Because of these characteristics, in order to enhance the player’s attention, it is necessary to make the presentation of information clear and definite, grab the player’s eyeballs in visual performance, make them easily capture the key information, and make a deep impression. Highlighting certain design elements through emphasis techniques aims to guide players to quickly obtain effective information, and allow players to pay attention to where you want them to pay attention. At the same time, it can also enhance the depth and layering of the game interface, thereby improving the player’s gaming experience.

II. What are the Emphasis Techniques?

  1. Bold/Italic/Underline

    If the designer wants to make the emphasized element look slightly different, they can consider making it bold, italic, or underlining it to emphasize topics, labels, titles, and small paragraphs of text. Using bold and thin together can well express the sense of hierarchy and convey the importance of the text. Bold is usually more popular because it brings little change, but it can clearly emphasize the target element. Italics also have little impact on the design and are also a very effective emphasis method. Sometimes it is easier to attract attention than bold, but italics are difficult to distinguish, and are very effective for special fonts. Underlining brings about great changes and violates the principle of easy identification, so it should be used as little as possible or not at all.

    In the Fall Guys game loading page, the title of the game play introduction is emphasized in bold and underlined. When there are multiple titles on the page, the hierarchy of the titles is distinguished to guide players to read the game rules under the title.

     

  1. Use Capital Letters

    Using capital letters can highlight the text you want players to notice. Uppercase and lowercase convey different feelings, which will affect readability, understandability, and usability. In a complex display area, using uppercase to emphasize labels or keywords will be very effective, which can enhance the sense of hierarchy and prevent small fonts from mixing with the background. Using capital letters is more effective when the font style cannot be adjusted, and the main text and title text can be clearly distinguished.

    In the settings page of CSGO, capital letters are used for the main title, detailed setting content, and reset button. When the page has more content and more levels, the use of capital letters distinguishes the primary and secondary content and highlights the key content.

     

  1. Use Different Colors

    Using different colors is a very effective emphasis technique. Color can attract attention, integrate elements, indicate meaning, and enhance aesthetics. There are three types of cone cells in the human retina, and these three types of cone cells are more sensitive to different wavelengths of color. Therefore, when people see different sensitive color domains at the same time, the eyes will feel a strong contrast. Using different colors can achieve the effect of emphasis. The stronger the color contrast, the more attention it can attract.

    Some colors are inherently more eye-catching than other colors. Red, blue, green, orange, and yellow feel from heavy to light. Warm colors can be used for foreground elements, and cool colors can be used for background elements. When matching elements, light gray is a safe color that will not compete with other colors. Light neutral tones can help us bring more visual effects. Of course, colors cannot be used without restriction. According to the number that people can recognize after a glance, the types of colors need to be limited to about five, and they should be used in conjunction with other emphasis techniques.

    Saturated colors are more interesting and vibrant, and can attract attention. Unsaturated dull colors will make people feel serious, and unsaturated bright colors usually make people feel friendly. When you need to highlight product performance and efficiency, you can use unsaturated colors. More saturated colors will attract more attention than unsaturated colors. If you want to use different saturated colors in combination, please be careful, because they will visually interfere with each other and increase eye fatigue.

    The stronger the brightness contrast, the more attention it can attract. Contrast will naturally attract people’s attention to an element. When an element contrasts with its surroundings, it will also appear visually heavier.

    The use of color contrast is common in games.

    In the start interface of Onmyoji Arena, the [Match] button is highlighted with a striking red color to distinguish the importance of the content by color, improve recognition efficiency, so that players can focus on the button at a glance, distinguish the primary and secondary levels from other content, attract players’ attention and also guide players’ choices.

     

In *Naraka: Bladepoint*, colors are used to distinguish the quality of loot piles and equipment. Blue piles have "normal quality" equipment and props, gold piles have a "highest quality" drop probability, green piles must have "soul jades", gold equipment is ultimate, purple is excellent, blue is good, and gray is ordinary. In combat scenarios with a large amount of information, color marking can help players quickly obtain information, and high-quality equipment is easy to stand out, and players can go to pick it up in a targeted manner.

 

  1. Reverse Type

    Reverse type refers to printing text or lines in intaglio to expose the white of the paper. It is a striking and eye-catching method. Using reverse type on a darker color block and not filling the image and text with any color can form a contrast, which can make the image and text appear more clearly. Reverse type is suitable for text, but not so much for images or shapes. It should be noted that although reverse type can attract people’s attention, the design scheme will also change significantly as a result, so it should not be overused.

     

---

*Without Reverse Type and With Reverse Type*

---

The interface of *Pokémon Quest* uses reverse type to highlight information, such as the dark background and white text of the level card. Due to the use of reverse type, its overall design style is also adapted to it.

 

  1. Blinking

    Blinking refers to letting an element switch back and forth between two different states. This method can effectively attract attention. When most of the elements on the page are static, users are more likely to be attracted by dynamic things. It should be noted that the blinking technique is only suitable for emphasizing those important things that require people to react to them immediately. Since blinking will affect identification and easily distract people, once the notification effect is achieved, the blinking should be turned off immediately.

    In the start interface of Fortnite, the design of the task button, if there is a new task, the button will keep blinking to attract players to click. After clicking to view, the blinking achieves the notification effect, and the button will return to its original state.

     

Tips:

The use of emphasis techniques also needs to be moderate. In a design work, the emphasized content should not exceed 10%. The percentage of emphasized elements in a work is inversely proportional to its effect. Emphasis techniques should be used sparingly and applied consistently throughout the design.

III. Conclusion

When players are introduced to a new game, the first impression is very important. To attract players’ attention, it is necessary to have clear information communication and a good visual experience. Emphasis techniques are an effective way to enhance player attention. Appropriately using emphasis techniques to organize information and guide the line of sight can make the game easier for players to get started, avoid wasting time, and reduce player churn caused by insufficient information communication, forming a better visual effect and gaining more attention.

References

  1. Visual Laws and Psychology in Game Design:

    https://www.gameres.com/705994.html

  2. Chai, Y., Hou, Y., Cao, G., & et al. Application of Visual Attention Mechanism in Game Screen Design[J]. Electronic Technology and Software Engineering, 2019, No.167(21):37-38.

  3. Visual Attention - The Root of Anatomical Design | Tencent CDC:

    https://cdc.tencent.com/2010/01/22/Visual Attention - The Root of Anatomical Design/

entry.title: The Secret to the Longevity of Popular Japanese Otome Mobile Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

The gameplay of Japanese female-oriented games (Otome Games) has now stabilized. According to Yano Research Institute, the market size of “female-oriented games” in Japan in 2015 was about 16.3 billion yen; it then fell slightly, maintaining at 15.5 billion yen in 2017. At the same time, the population of Japan in 2017 was about 130 million, the game population reached 68 million, of which mobile game players were about 54 million; in 2017, female mobile players in Japan accounted for 37.2%. Based on this, it is estimated that the ARPU value of Japanese female mobile players in the female-oriented game market is about 770 yen. The gameplay of female-oriented games is not limited to dress-up and story-watching, but also includes rhythm games, nurturing games, and other gameplay modes. Although the Japanese female-oriented mobile game market is booming, the fierce competition has also led to many mobile games experiencing a flash in the pan, ending service in less than half a year.

So why can some female-oriented mobile games be successfully operated for more than 5 years, while others end operations hastily? This article analyzes the reasons by compiling the Google Play and iOS store reviews of the long-lived and highly popular Japanese female-oriented games Ensemble Stars!! Basic and Ensemble Stars!! Music (Japanese name: あんさんぶるスターズ), and comparing them with the reviews of low-popularity and short-lived games such as DREAM!ing, I-Chu, and MakeS.

Demands of Japanese Female Users in Mobile Games

 

Figure 1: There are nearly 50 characters in “Ensemble Stars!! Music”

First: Character Building

Among character building, the most mentioned by female players is voice actors, followed by character design. The maturity of the Japanese voice actor market gives Japanese female-oriented mobile game characters a variety of voices. Taking Ensemble Stars!! as an example, more than 40 characters have their own unique voices. Whether it is the daily story dubbing or the singing at the concert, the voice actors give the paper figures the ability to speak and sing. The second is the character creation. Ensemble Stars!! focuses on idol cultivation. There are dozens of characters, but each character has its own unique character setting. The character design is exquisite and beautiful, and the characteristics of different groups are distinct. There is the traditional Japanese musical instrument group “Akatsuki” and the cute and compact style “Ra*bits” group. Although there are many characters, there is no sense of repetition and aesthetic fatigue.

 

Figure 2: “Akatsuki Group” and “Rabits Group”*

Second: Game Content

The second point that Japanese female players pay attention to is the content in the game, which is mainly divided into plot, gameplay, and events. The plot mainly revolves around the campus and idols, unfolding a youthful dream-chasing story. The characters in the game are full and vivid. Take Tenshouin Eichi in the game as an example: Tenshouin Eichi is a sickly character. He is gentle, smart, observant, and considerate of his companions, but he is also good at manipulating everything behind the scenes. The conflict between hope and despair in the plot creates a Shakespearean-like dramatic character transformation in the emotional growth of the characters, and the performance of diverse characters.

 

Animation 1: “Ensemble Stars!! 2’s Performance Animation”

Although it is a music game, Ensemble Stars!! Music has also achieved the greatest burden reduction. After clearing once, you can automatically play songs with one click, and at the same time you can enjoy the stage performance brought by the characters. From Basic to Music, the upgrade and update of the gameplay and the newly added characters have successfully captured the attention of old and new players. Not sticking to the existing gameplay and trying to innovate has created the history of Ensemble Stars!! dominating the female-oriented game charts.

Time-limited events that unfold with the timeline are also the focus of players’ attention. Ensemble Stars!! arranges limited-time events reasonably according to time. Valentine’s Day, White Day, June Bride, fireworks festivals, etc. are all popular events. During the event, players can draw characters who unlock limited costumes through the gacha pool and read event-limited stories.

 

Figure 3: Halloween Limited Card Face and 3D Model Wear

Third: Game Operation

Japanese female mobile game players will pour their emotions into their favorite virtual characters and become fans of a certain character. Therefore, a reasonable update speed operation will better grasp this group of fans with high game stickiness. In addition to limited-time events in the game, there are also welfare distributions, Twitter support, offline meetups, peripheral sales, cafe collaborations, and other activities. The large group of players and good retention, the prosperous development of game culture, are also conducive to the creation of game IP and the extension of game life.

Comparison of Keywords between Popular High-Popularity Mobile Games and Low-Popularity Mobile Games

Among the popular mobile games, the top three words mentioned most by players are: characters, story plot, and no microtransactions; the most mentioned dissatisfaction points by players in low-popularity mobile games are: poor optimization, operational problems, and forced microtransactions. For Ensemble Stars!!, the keywords for its praise are mainly: good publicity, wide audience, good reputation, unique and personalized plot and characters, simple gameplay, and you can play happily without microtransactions.

Therefore, in the Japanese female-oriented mobile game market, in order to achieve long-term game operation, at least the following points must be met:

  1. The game itself has a stable environment and good optimization

  2. Game content and update speed that will not make users feel bored

  3. You can enjoy the game without paying, and both paying players and non-paying players can get their own game pursuit goals in the game.

While doing the above three points, Ensemble Stars!! also maintained good publicity channels. In addition to the official stable publicity, old users also brought new players to the game, so the game has a long life.

entry.title: Scrum and Game Products
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Scrum, a concept applied in more and more fields, has now become a commonly used work management framework in various companies in the technology field, and game companies are no exception. Different from traditional project management, agile management uses an iterative approach to actively embrace changes and respond quickly to needs. How to build a more efficient team, how to speed up the product development process, and how to manage work schedules in an orderly manner are constantly being explored by every game product team.

1. What is Scrum?

“Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people, teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems.”

Scrum is a simple and easy-to-use framework for developing, delivering, and continuously supporting complex products. It is an incremental and iterative development process that helps teams and organizations break down complex problems to better produce work results.

Sprint

The entire development process consists of several short iteration cycles, and one iteration cycle is called a Sprint.

The length of a Sprint is generally controlled within one month, and the cycle needs to be fixed after it is determined. If the Sprint time is too long, the definition of what to build may change, the complexity may also increase, and the risk may increase. On the other hand, a fixed iteration cycle can help the team better review the work, discover problems, and make timely adjustments. Sprint achieves predictability by ensuring that progress towards goals is inspected and adapted at least once a month, while also limiting risk to one month’s cost. The entire Scrum team must create valuable and practical iterations in each Sprint. For games, the choice of Sprint cycle is a balance between development efficiency and response speed.

Product Backlog

The product backlog records the needs that the team needs to complete. Each Sprint needs to select the highest priority requirements for development. The selected requirements are discussed, analyzed, and estimated at the Sprint Planning Meeting to obtain a corresponding task list, called the Sprint backlog. These requirements must be delivered at the end of the Sprint. Usually, the Product Owner has the final say on the priority of the selected tasks.

Sprint Planning Meeting

A meeting to discuss and analyze requirements, and to select the highest priority requirements as the work content of the current Sprint.

Daily Scrum Meeting

A 15-minute daily meeting participated in by Developers in the team, usually held at the same time and place every day. If the PO and SM need to actively participate in the tasks of this Sprint, they also need to participate in the meeting. The purpose of the meeting is to advance progress, arrange the work for the next day/current day, and respond positively to existing problems.

Sprint Review Meeting

An informal meeting for each Sprint, where the team will present the product or work output, and evaluate and propose ideas for the presentation results. This meeting is centered around the product.

Sprint Retrospective Meeting

A review meeting at the end of each Sprint. Different from the Review, the meeting will discuss the personnel and team’s work in the current Sprint, discuss the problems existing in the current work status, and propose improvement suggestions and measures. This meeting is an important part of the Scrum framework and helps to build, deliver, and manage complex projects more effectively.

The simple Scrum process is as follows:

2. The Scrum Team

The Scrum team needs to have three necessary roles: a Scrum Master, a Product Owner (PO), and multiple Developers. Note that in this team, there are no branch teams or hierarchical relationships. The entire team focuses on the same goal, which is the Product Goal. Usually, a Scrum team needs to be controlled to a scale of no more than 10 people - small enough to maintain agility, and large enough to complete all important work in each Sprint.

Product Owner

Generally served by a producer, lead planner, or dedicated assistant, responsible for maximizing the value of the product and the work of the development team from the work of the Scrum team, and also responsible for effective Backlog management, including but not limited to:

  1. Establish and effectively communicate the Product Goal with the team;
  2. Create and clearly express each task in the Product Backlog;
  3. Reasonably prioritize the tasks in the Product Backlog;
  4. Ensure that the Product Backlog is open, transparent, clear, and can be fully understood by team members;
  5. Confirm the development of new features and the repair of BUGs.

Developers

A team composed of various personnel with different skills, spanning multiple positions, dedicated to completing various tasks in each Sprint. Taking games as an example, team members include but are not limited to:

  1. Planning, operations, programming, art, sound effects, testing, etc.;
  2. The development team is formed and authorized by the organization, and the team needs to be responsible for and manage their own work.

Scrum Master

Serves both the PO and the Developers, aiming to help the team provide solutions to problems during Scrum, remove obstacles, and let the team move in the right direction, acting as a coordinator, order maintainer, and manager. Therefore, it is generally served by a person in the team who is more prestigious and has deep experience. But different from the traditional PM, Developers are responsible for managing their own work, not supervised by the SM.

3. An Extension of a Scrum Team - SoS

As the game product progresses step by step, the members of the project team will continue to increase, and the team size will continue to increase. At this time, a Scrum team is obviously not enough to meet the needs. At this time, it is necessary to split the team and adopt the Scrum of Scrums framework.

SoS means that the Scrum Master of each team forms a small group to share the status of each team and respond to potential problems between teams in a timely manner. The SoS team lets all relevant personnel understand what is happening in other teams in the system, determines under what conditions teams need to help each other, determines under what conditions teams need to coordinate, and ensures that all personnel have the same understanding of a common product goal.

The SoS architecture diagram is as follows:

4. Game Products and Scrum

In the Internet era, change is the foundation of game survival. A game with a slow update frequency is likely to lose a large number of players in a short period of time. Chasing the ever-changing tastes of players, leading the new trend of the game circle, and creating higher gold-absorbing efficiency are all based on constant changes.

However, without planning and planning, too frequent changes are extremely unfriendly to software development - changes will lead to a lot of repetitive work, affect the development progress, or will have an impact on all completed work, bringing many unexpected jobs. The worst consequence is the internal contradictions caused by disputes over change issues, which affect the overall development progress of the product.

If classified according to whether the change requirements will have an impact on the current development work, it can be roughly divided into two categories: those that have a direct impact and those that do not have a direct impact. The former refers to the work that is being developed, tested, or processed by relevant developers, or that has entered the current iteration cycle to be processed. The latter is that the content related to this requirement is still in the planning stage and has not yet been sent to the developers. At this time, the change does not have a big impact on the current work. Most of the developers oppose the former. Therefore, the Scrum management model is very effective in this situation - with Sprint as a cycle, all work that is already in the current Sprint, whether it is being processed or to be completed, is not allowed to be changed. If it must be changed, then the current work can only be interrupted, the requirement can be removed from the development list, and after modification, it can be put into the next Sprint. If a modification requirement is put forward after the development is completed, it will be regarded as a new requirement, and it will also be scheduled in a future Sprint.

With the continuous increase in development costs, improving efficiency will become the key for game companies. Most companies can no longer afford the business models that will not be used in the end in game development, and they cannot wait until the end of the project to see if something is valuable. It is too late at that time, and the sunk cost will be very large. The main function of Scrum is to remove the bottleneck of wasting workload.

On the other hand, because Scrum emphasizes communication and collaboration between teams and rapid response, incorporating QA into the team is a win-win situation for developers and players, and the burden of QA will be reduced compared with the past, avoiding the situation of accumulation. In this way, every bug will be fixed in time, thereby increasing the speed of content development.

Of course, when a company or a team decides to adopt Scrum’s agile management method, it must also face some new challenges.

The top-down hierarchical management culture is transformed into a team-based iterative culture - the change of management model is difficult at the beginning. For the team that uses Scrum to develop products for the first time, how to play their roles well is a challenge, and it is also a major change to get used to reflecting and adjusting according to the short cycle of a Sprint.

From assigning and supervising work to self-management - Scrum encourages teams to self-manage. Under this soft management model, the spontaneity and self-discipline of each team member are particularly important, and there needs to be a common goal and a consistent understanding of it. This also requires the cooperation of PO and SM, especially SM, who needs to take the lead.

In summary, Scrum is only a framework in the final analysis. Different teams, different Scrum Masters, and different Product Owners should set goals and manage work according to their own and product actual conditions, and find the most suitable and balanced agile management model.

entry.title: Introduction to Data Desensitization Technology
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

With the advent of the big data era, data has become an important factor of production. For data controllers and data processors, how to maximize the value of data flow is the original intention and significance of data mining. However, the exposure of a series of information leakage incidents has made data security more and more widely concerned.

Data security plays an important role in the construction of a data warehouse. The leakage of private or sensitive data will cause serious damage to the property, reputation, personal safety, and legitimate interests of the data subject. Therefore, we need to strictly control access to the data in the warehouse. This requires classifying the sensitivity of the data itself into security levels. With the classification of data security levels, we can better manage data access control to protect data security.

But in the actual production process, the application scenarios will be more complex, and relying on access control alone, will be insufficient and other methods will be needed. Data desensitization is an effective method that can not only meet the needs of daily production, but also protect data security.

1. What is Data Desensitization?

Data desensitization refers to the transformation of certain sensitive information through desensitization rules to achieve reliable protection of sensitive and private data. In this way, the security level of the data itself can be downgraded, and the desensitized real data set can be safely used in development, testing, and other non-production environments, as well as in outsourcing or cloud computing environments.

But it should be noted that with the help of data desensitization technology, while erasing sensitive content in the data, it is also necessary to maintain the original data characteristics, business rules, and data correlation, to ensure that we will not be affected by desensitization in development, testing, and data analysis businesses, and to ensure the consistency and validity of data before and after desensitization.

2. Data Desensitization Strategies

Strategically, data desensitization is divided into Static Data Masking (SDM) and Dynamic Data Masking (DDM).

Static Data Desensitization

Static data desensitization is the “moving and simulated replacement” of data. The data is extracted for desensitization processing, and then distributed to downstream links for free access and read-write. The desensitized data is isolated from the production environment, meeting business needs and ensuring the security of the production database.

Static data desensitization is suitable for extracting data from the production environment, desensitizing it, and distributing it to scenarios such as testing, development, training, and data analysis. Sometimes we may need to copy the data from the production environment to the test and development libraries to troubleshoot problems or perform data analysis, but for security reasons, sensitive data cannot be stored in a non-production environment. In this case, sensitive data must be desensitized from the production environment before being used in a non-production environment. In this way, the desensitized data is isolated from the production environment, meeting business needs while ensuring the security of production data.

As shown in the figure above, the user’s real name, mobile phone number, ID number, and bank card number are desensitized by replacement, invalidation, scrambling, and symmetric encryption.

Dynamic Data Desensitization

Dynamic data desensitization performs desensitization processing in real time while accessing sensitive data. It can execute different desensitization schemes for different roles, different permissions, and different data types, thereby ensuring that the returned data is usable and secure.

Dynamic data desensitization is generally used in the production environment, because sometimes in different situations, different levels of desensitization processing are required for reading the same sensitive data. For example, different desensitization schemes may be executed for different roles and different permissions.

Differences in Technical Routes of Static Desensitization and Dynamic Desensitization

Static desensitization directly uses various desensitization algorithms such as masking, deformation, replacement, randomization, format-preserving encryption (FPE), and strong encryption algorithms (such as AES) to perform data masking disruption for different data types, and the desensitized data can be loaded into different environments according to user needs. Static desensitization can provide different loading methods such as file-to-file, file-to-database, database-to-database, and database-to-file. The exported data is stored in an external storage medium in a desensitized form, which actually changes the stored data content.

Dynamic desensitization accurately parses SQL statements to match desensitization conditions, such as: access IP, MAC, database user, client tool, operating system user, host name, time, number of affected rows, etc. After successful matching, it rewrites the query SQL or intercepts and protects the returned desensitized data to the application side, thereby achieving desensitization of sensitive data. In fact, the data stored in the production database has not changed.

3. Data Desensitization Solutions

The data desensitization system can define and write desensitization rules according to different business scenarios, and can perform data desensitization without landing for a certain sensitive field of a library table.

There are many ways to desensitize data, but no matter which method is used, it must be based on different application scenarios and follow the following two principles:

  • remain meaningful for application logic
  • sufficiently treated to avoid reverse engineer

Invalidation

The invalidation scheme processes the data to be desensitized by truncating, encrypting, hiding, etc. the data value of the field to desensitize the sensitive data and make it no longer valuable. Generally, special characters (*, etc.) are used to replace the true value. This method of hiding sensitive data is simple, but the disadvantage is that the user cannot know the format of the original data. If the user wants to obtain complete information, the user must be authorized to query. For example, if we replace the ID number with * to replace the real number, it becomes “220724 ****** 3523”, which is very simple.

Random Value

Random value replacement replaces letters with random letters, numbers with random numbers, and text with random text to change sensitive data. The advantage of this scheme is that it can retain the format of the original data to a certain extent, and this method is often imperceptible to users.

Data Replacement

Data replacement is similar to the previous invalidation method, except that special characters are not used for masking, but a set virtual value is used to replace the true value. For example, we set the mobile phone number to “13651300000”.

Symmetric Encryption

Symmetric encryption is a special reversible desensitization method. Sensitive data is encrypted through an encryption key and algorithm. The ciphertext format is consistent with the original data in logical rules, and the original data can be restored by decrypting the key. It is important to note the security of the key.

Average

The average scheme is often used in statistical scenarios. For numerical data, we first calculate their average value, and then make the desensitized value randomly distributed around the average value, thereby keeping the sum of the data unchanged.

Offset and Rounding

This method changes numerical data by random shifting. Offset and rounding ensure the approximate authenticity of the range while maintaining data security. It is closer to real data than the previous schemes and is of great significance in big data analysis scenarios. For example, the date field 2020-12-08 15:12:25 becomes 2018-01-02 15:00:00.

Data desensitization rules are often used in combination with multiple schemes in practical applications to achieve a higher level of security.

4. Conclusion

Whether it is static desensitization or dynamic desensitization, the ultimate goal is to prevent the abuse of private data within the organization and prevent private data from flowing out of the organization without desensitization. In the design and implementation of data desensitization schemes, it is more important to start from specific application scenarios for overall design, taking into account the important consideration dimension of data warehouse construction. The implementation of data desensitization can provide strong support for the promotion of organizational data security.

entry.title: The Core Experience of Action Role-Playing Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase))

APRG games, or Action Role-Playing Games, differ from typical RPGs in that they incorporate action elements, replacing the turn-based combat of RPGs with a more refined combat system. This enhances the gameplay in combat, attracting players who enjoy action games.

When discussing action games, it’s impossible to ignore the era of arcade dominance, when arcade halls were ubiquitous. It was during this time that most players were introduced to various action fighting games, such as Street Fighter, Cadillacs and Dinosaurs, and Knights of Valour. These classics became cherished childhood memories for many. Players, using joysticks and a few buttons, controlled characters to execute fantastic moves, captivating countless individuals. So, what experiences can players expect from ARPGs, which blend action and RPG elements?

 

Side-scrolling beat ‘em up 《Knights of the Round》

1. Action and Strike Feedback

In games featuring action elements, “strike feedback” (打击感 - dǎ jī gǎn) is a topic frequently discussed by players. Strike feedback originates from the game’s visual and auditory feedback to the player. Visual feedback includes animation, hit effects, hitstun, camera zoom and shake, as well as appropriate special effects and visible air disturbances. Auditory feedback requires appropriate sound effects, meaning sounds that match the materials colliding, with accurate sound source location and timing. For example, the sound of a sword hitting a rock should not be the sound of it hitting water. Failing to provide accurate auditory feedback significantly diminishes the player’s experience. The fluidity and coordination of moves in the game also affect the overall strike feedback. For instance, when a character moves, the limbs should bend in coordination with the steps. If the action designer has some martial arts foundation, they can better grasp the details of limb movements, providing players with more realistic visual feedback.

2. PVE: Character Progression (养成感 - yǎng chéng gǎn)

With the development of the gaming industry and advancements in game styles, pure action games have a shrinking player base. Action is increasingly becoming just one element within a game. Action games have a certain skill barrier; not all players can achieve feats like no-hit runs, as some skilled action game players do. Most players have average skill levels, and improving technically is a painful process with often weak feedback. Players need to learn from constant failures, which can accumulate negative emotions. This is why many players who bought Dark Souls 3 gave up before even defeating the first boss.

In early ACT games, there was no stat-based advantage, only a skill-based one. A player’s skill determined how far they could progress. However, ARPGs introduce stat progression. Characters can improve themselves by leveling up, acquiring better equipment and skills, or gaining various abilities. Defeating opponents might not strictly require these systems, but they make battles easier and faster, providing players with a sense of progression.

 

In 《NieR:Automata》, you can collect chips to enhance the protagonist.

The progression process is further amplified in online ARPGs. It leverages the player’s desire for constant improvement, encouraging them to invest time and effort in the game. By allowing players to win battles, or win more easily, a sense of becoming stronger is created, leading to satisfaction in the progression process. However, this progression needs to be balanced. If a player’s stats completely overwhelm the game’s enemies, making skill irrelevant, it will quickly diminish the game’s playability. Once players become unstoppable “lawnmowers,” the fun of the game will quickly disappear.

3. PVP: Game Theory (博弈 - bó yì)

Many ARPG online games include both PVE and PVP content, with PVP attracting a significant audience. While PVE emphasizes experiencing character progression and achieving victory, PVP emphasizes fair competition, where players triumph through strategic gameplay (博弈). The key difference is that players are facing real people, not AI. When discussing action PVP, many players might first think of combos. Indeed, stylish combos are a major source of enjoyment in PVP, but the core of PVP is actually game theory.

 

In 《Street Fighter V》 high-level matches, there are full of probing and Game Theory.

If a player practices an unbeatable combo that can instantly defeat an opponent upon a successful hit, but lacks strategic ability, they won’t be able to land the combo in actual combat. They’ll be crushed by players who might not even have mastered combos but are skilled in actual combat. Unlike traditional fighting games, ARPGs generally simplify skills into single button presses. Players don’t need to “input” complex commands to use skills; pressing a specific button executes the corresponding skill. This further reduces the difficulty of performing combos and amplifies the role of game theory in combat.

Game theory in PVP encompasses all actions taken by both sides to gain a more advantageous position. How to hit the enemy without being hit is the eternal challenge. Within the allotted time, the strategic interactions between players determine the victor. This includes controlling distance, predicting the opponent’s moves, baiting them into attacking, and so on – essentially, predicting the opponent’s predictions. In some online PVP battlegrounds, to ensure fairness, the game will implement balancing measures, reducing the influence of factors like player level, equipment, and other progression elements. However, these factors still play a role, giving high-spending players some room to exert their advantage.

4. Conclusion

Action elements provide players with the exhilarating thrill of combat. The progression system offers continuous feedback and a sense of satisfaction. PVP allows players to enjoy the strategic element of battling others. By mastering the key aspects of these elements, developers can capture the hearts of most ARPG players.

entry.title: Is What's Last the Least Important? A Brief Discussion on Serial Position Effect
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

Is the last thing the least important? The answer is NO.

When writing an article, the opening and closing paragraphs are often crucial. When holding an evening party, the most important programs are often arranged at the opening and the finale. The serial position effect describes such a memory phenomenon: when listing items, the elements at the very beginning and the very end are easier to remember than those in the middle.

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 was showcased in the finale of the 2020 NetEase Games 520 Conference

The finale of the 2012 London Olympics opening ceremony was a chorus of “Hey Jude”

What is the Serial Position Effect?

The serial position effect includes the primacy effect and the recency effect: the enhanced recall effect produced for items at the beginning position is called the primacy effect. The primacy effect occurs because the initial items on the list can be stored in long-term memory more effectively than later items; the enhanced recall effect produced for items at the end, the most recent, is called the recency effect, which is because the recent items are still in working memory and can be obtained more easily.

Human memory is divided into sensory (instantaneous memory), short-term memory, and long-term memory

The effect of the serial position effect is closely related to the speed at which items appear. When items appear quickly, the primacy effect is often less significant than the recency effect. This is because people do not have enough time to store the initial items in their memory for a long time, while the recent items are still in working memory and can be easily obtained. However, due to the timeliness of working memory, the recency effect is extremely susceptible to time and other information interference, losing its effectiveness. Therefore, when items appear slowly, the effect of the primacy effect is often more stable and free from interference. However, if the items do not appear one by one at one time, but have a longer interval between one of them, the recency effect often plays a greater role.

In addition, the primacy effect often makes it easier for people to form preconceived stereotypes: in five typical experiments, the adjectives ranked first had a greater impact on the overall impression. For example, the two sentences below: students who saw the first sentence had a more favorable impression of John than students who saw the second sentence.

  • John is intelligent, industrious, impulsive, critical, stubborn and jealous;
  • John is jealous, stubborn, critical, impulsive, industrious, and intelligent;

This stereotype will affect the subsequent information processing: this also reveals why an excellent opening CG and interaction, as the first impression, can play a foundational role in the player’s evaluation tone.

Application of Serial Position Effect in Game Interaction

In the specific game interaction interface, the primacy and recency can be found according to the attention priority of the interface. Based on the cognitive law of the serial position effect, the game behavior of players can be subtly guided.

Take activity tasks as an example. Often, the first pop-up information that players come into contact with when they open the game is the current game task/activity interface, guiding players to play the game according to the gameplay designed by the planner.

The task guidance during the game process utilizes the recency effect to provide players with real-time game guidance. When players don’t know what to do, it provides a quick way of thinking about the game.

The same applies to the content arrangement of the event page and the mall page. Often, limited-time events/main promotion packages/preferential packages are often placed at the beginning and end according to the attention priority. Such operations often make players choose the more time-sensitive/more popular/relatively more favorable package first.

Studies have shown that the serial position effect also has a certain impact on attribution. In combat games, the performance in the late stage is often considered by players to have a more decisive effect on the final result. At the same time, because of the recency effect, the effect of the end of the game is easier to remember than the effect of the middle part of the game, which will have an important impact on the player’s experience and evaluation. Therefore, the user experience in the final part is also crucial.

Conclusion

The serial position effect is very common in people’s daily life and cognitive behavior, and plays a subtle role in people’s decision-making, attribution, and evaluation. Relevant scholars also pointed out that when acquaintances interact, the recency effect plays a greater role; when interacting with strangers, the primacy effect plays a greater role. Reasonably using the cognitive law of the serial position effect according to the situation will help designers create a smoother user experience and obtain higher user evaluations.

entry.title: Considerations for Game Map Design
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

In some very early games, such as the three classic Western RPGs: Wizardry, Ultima, and Might and Magic, there were no maps. So for older generations of gamers, playing games might have required them to draw maps themselves with pen and paper. Without the guidance of a map, it was easy for players to get “lost” in the game. Players couldn’t remember the routes at all, which made the game more challenging.

 

《Might and Magic》

With the continuous development of hardware and software technology, all aspects of video games have been improved, and more and more game designers have begun to pay more attention to improving the gaming experience. For some games that require “maps”, the design of game maps has gradually become refined and distinctive. A good game map can bring players a lot of surprising experiences and also bring more diverse gameplay. For most video games, the player’s understanding of the overall world view of a game largely comes from their perception of the game space. Therefore, for games that require maps, it is crucial to enable players to read the map.

1. What is a Game Map?

A game map virtualizes a complete world. The existence of a map can, to a certain extent, present the world view of the entire game to players in a more intuitive form. All events, characters, and environments are developed on the basis of the map. Different sizes of game maps will be designed according to the world view and gameplay of different games. Maps are generally presented to players in the following forms:

A Complete 3D Modeled Scene

 

《Transport Fever 2》

In this type of map, the game side provides a limited 3D scene, and players need to explore in this 3D model world. Typical examples include planning simulation games such as Cities: Skylines and Transport Fever 2. The size of the map is the size of the world that players can customize. Players can customize a virtual world and还原(huányuán - restore) the real-world scene in equal proportions.

A UI Interface Displaying the World View

 

《GTA5》

 

《Conqueror’s Blade》

This type of map is generally presented in a relatively flat form, with various signs indicating different attributes appearing on the map, which may represent various locations, events, tasks, etc. In this type of map, players can understand their position and see the locations of different tasks as if they were standing in a god-like perspective, allowing players to clearly understand the direction of the destination they want to reach.

2. Maps and Functions of Different Types of Games

However, not all games need to have maps. Board games generally do not have maps, such as match-3 games like Candy Crush, and games like Arknights and Honkai Impact 3rd. The so-called “map” is actually a UI interface showing the game progress, generally a linear route, to tell the player which level they have reached. The “map” of this type of game does not essentially undertake the functions of “guiding” and “showing the world view” that a map should have. Apart from some elements related to the game itself that appear in the interface, it is essentially a level list display.

 

《Arknights》

In some side-scrolling games, their maps include the functions of “guiding” and “building the world view”. This type of map can also be directly jumped to, achieving the so-called “guiding” function, and to a certain extent, it also reflects the world view of the game, but it is closer to the above-mentioned “pseudo-map” and does not have a strong directional indication. It is more like a more complete UI interface.

 

《The Tale of Food》

 

《Mole’s World》

The maps of MOBA games mainly serve the functions of “guiding and marking positions”. In MOBA games that focus on competitive fun, the characteristics of the game determine that players will not spend much energy on exploring the map. Typical examples are Dota and LOL. Their map design ideas are relatively similar. Generally, the size of the map is relatively small, and the classic diagonal line form is adopted. Players start from the bases on two diagonal lines to PK. Games like Demigod and Bloodline Champions are based on three lanes and cross each other twice. The maps of MOBA games are limited by routes, so there is less room for development.

 

《LOL》

Open-world games have a high dependence on maps. The design of the game itself and the design of the map complement each other. The design of the map is to allow players to have a more immersive experience. The fun of the game is often presented in the process of players running around the map. Like The Legend of Zelda and Genshin Impact, the characters controlled by players can run and fly in the virtual world. Completing a task may require passing through many places. In this process, many hidden suspense in the map may be unlocked. Maps that are too small often cannot carry such a large world view, nor can they show the characteristics of the game itself. In FPS games, the map also has the function of “guiding”, which allows players to know the location of teammates and enemies. These games generally have large and small maps.

 

 

《The Legend of Zelda》

 

 

《Conqueror’s Blade》

Of course, there are also some games that cannot be completely classified, such as Dark Souls. Its map design is between the traditional open world and linear levels. It combines linear levels in an open, non-linear way. This cleverly utilizes the strengths of both, retaining the freedom in the open world and giving players a lot of space to explore, while retaining the storyline and quest line set by the game designer, better avoiding the misunderstanding of players being at a loss in the open world, making the overall design of the game still compact and ingenious.

 

《Dark Souls》

3. The Significance of the Existence of Small Maps

The above statements are basically large maps that can present the overall world view in various games. In many games, there are also auxiliary small maps. The main function of the small map is to provide immediate directions and feedback information. Often the position of the small map will exist in a certain corner of the screen, which is convenient for players to check immediately, but it should avoid interfering with the player’s vision as much as possible. Compared with the large map, the small map can help players quickly understand their position in the overall situation and the surrounding geographical environment during the game. In some game settings, you can also see information about resources and enemies. Especially for some games with larger sizes, more complexity, and greater difficulty, the absence of a small map will increase the difficulty of the game, and it is very unfriendly to some players who are “directionally challenged”, and they may not be able to advance the progress of the game for a long time.

Like some MOBA-type competitive games, since in many cases it is a team battle, there will generally be a small map in the game interface to provide a global view and better strengthen some communication with teammates. The setting of the small map reduces the difficulty for players to play the game. Players can quickly obtain some information without having to study the map in detail, remember the route, etc.

Of course, not all games require small maps. The gameplay attributes and needs of the game itself still need to be considered. Typical examples are many games by Hidetaka Miyazaki, such as Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice and Dark Souls. In order to cooperate with the needs of their own game themes and create a more immersive game experience, if a small map appears in the interface, it may destroy some of the game atmosphere. Without the guidance of a small map, players need to explore the route themselves and remember it, so this requires players to form their own imagination of the overall space.

 

《Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice》

There are also some games that will weaken the small map in the game. For example, Identity V only has a small map in the upper left corner of the screen that basically only indicates the direction of the character. It will not have a strong presence in the overall interface. The blurred information prompts also help to set off the horror atmosphere of the game itself.

 

《Identity V》

4. Conclusion

Sometimes the quality of a map determines whether players can be retained. It plays a key role in the game. Good game settings need to be matched with appropriate map sizes. Some world views are suitable for grand maps, and some world views are suitable for exquisite maps. Regarding whether to design a small map, in general, in games with greater difficulty and some highly competitive games, it is necessary to have a small map. The former is to lower the threshold of the game, and the latter is because the focus of the game itself is not on the map. In any case, whether there is a small map, whether it is directly displayed or needs to be called to appear on the screen, is closely related to the game’s world view, gameplay, and attributes. Different designs will attract different players. Only when players learn how to read a map can they better understand a game, and they may be interested in continuing the game.

entry.title: Players' Special Experiences in Rockstar Open World Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

“Rockstar Games” is a game development subsidiary of the game publisher Take-Two Interactive. Many players may not be familiar with this company, but they must be very familiar with their most famous games, the GTA series and the Red Dead Redemption series. This New York-based video game company can be said to have produced many of the most famous video games of the 21st century. Games like the GTA series or the Red Dead Redemption series basically put players in a carefully designed open world. Whether it’s the American West in the late 18th and early 20th centuries, Miami in the 1980s, or Los Angeles (called Los Santos) in the 21st century, players can experience American life and Western culture at a specific time under the setting consistent with the real world. This article will take the GTA series and the Red Dead Redemption series as examples to briefly discuss the unique experience that players can get under the open world system created by Rockstar.

 

Picture: The real “Los Santos” in GTA5

Walk into History from the Plot and Feel the Epitome of Culture

When talking about the setting of the plot and the background of the times in Rockstar games, it is inseparable from Dan Houser, one of the founders of R Star. He used to be the chief screenwriter of R Star (he resigned on March 11, 2020) and participated in writing the background settings of almost all GTA series and all Red Dead Redemption series games. He once said in an interview, “The game may be a historical novel, but it is not a historical work.” Historical novels often leave a very deep impression on the public about historical figures or important historical periods, such as the Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which we are familiar with.

So what kind of American history does Rockstar’s game want to present to everyone? It is not difficult for us to find that basically every Rockstar game highlights the importance of crime in modern American history. Take the most classic GTA: Vice City as an example, the background setting is based on Miami in the 1980s. In the game, the protagonist Tommy Vercetti, played by the player, was imprisoned for 15 years for murder. After being released from prison, he gained connections and capital through various violent activities, and eventually became a prominent figure in “Vice City” by operating illegal industries under the guise of legality. Such a setting not only makes players feel excited, but also allows players to get a glimpse of two major characteristics of modern American history: greedy capitalism and serious gun violence. In almost all games in the GTA series, the characters played by players will use guns to create a world for themselves. It can be said that gun violence is the first perception of players when they first enter the game. At the same time, players can get a close look at the dark side behind the glamorous image of business tycoons through the plot, and then perceive greedy capitalism.

Let’s take a look at Avery Carrington, a representative of the bourgeois upper class in GTA: Vice City, a successful real estate tycoon. In the game plot, the protagonist played by the player will be appreciated by him, and help him complete some special tasks to obtain high rewards. Special tasks include triggering gang wars between Cubans and Haitians to drive down房价 (fángjià - house prices), intimidating and murdering construction teams that refuse to sell land to him, etc. The greedy Avery Carrington will use any means to seek profit, and almost every generation of the GTA series will create some greedy business tycoon images for players, so that players can perceive the dark side behind capitalism while experiencing the plot. In real American history, Miami has always been a port for the drug trade. In the 1980s, the “War on Drugs” made the city full of blood and violence. Drug trafficking and gang wars were led by criminal gangs from Cuba, Haiti, Colombia and other South American places. In 1980 alone, there were 573 murders in the city, and 621 murders the following year. In GTA: Vice City, the various events that players encounter in the game are actually the epitome of various conflicts in society at that time, and the various characters they encounter are representatives of various classes and people from different countries at that time. The social conflicts and the historical culture of that specific period were all presented in the game in a condensed way. While giving players sufficient freedom, it also allows players who are willing to calm down and appreciate the plot to feel the unique characteristics of the society at that time.

 

Picture: Avery Carrington mission in GTA: Vice City

In-Depth Experience of Radio Stations

Each radio station in the GTA game, just like in real life, not only plays different types of music for players, but also features some call-in talk shows. In addition to the music itself, what many domestic players are likely to miss are the contents of some radio advertisements and call-in broadcasts. Today, let’s talk about how this part of the experience creates a more humorous, complete and real world for players.

Some NPC characters in the game often appear in the GTA series radio call-in programs. Such Easter egg settings not only make the characters in the game more plump, but also stimulate players’ stronger desire to explore in the open world game. The advertisements interspersed in the radio station also echo the unique personality of the GTA series games, which is based on satire and humor. GTA3 satirized the real lifestyle of Americans through advertisements on the game’s radio station. For example, a certain advertisement mentioned that a large company in the sports shoe industry used child labor, but Americans said they didn’t care. The game used this to satirize the real American society. GTA: Vice City also attempted to satirize the intellectual issues often discussed on NPR (National Public Radio) through the radio station VCPR. And the absurd spoof of GTA3‘s iconic radio talk show Chatterbox is one of the most memorable parts of the GTA series for foreign players. The content setting is basically a satirical commentary on American culture in the early 21st century. The talk show in the game will receive calls from people living in nearby areas. People can freely talk about anything they think of, and these contents will receive humorous comments from Lazlow (the radio host). For example, there was a call from a woman complaining about the negative impact of video games on children. The woman said, “Life is not like a game without a restart button.” The host Lazlow immediately replied, “Life doesn’t have one, but my hotline does,” and immediately hung up on the woman. American humorous answers like this abound in this show. This sudden “fun spoof” seems to make foreign players discover a “new continent”, making players involuntarily experience this novel and real radio style.

The radio stations in the GTA series not only add a basic entertainment function for players, but the above content is more to supplement a more complete and real world, so as to stimulate players’ stronger desire for autonomous exploration in the game. Ultimately, in open world games, the more content players perceive autonomously, the more fun they will get.

 

Picture: Players晒出 (shài chū - show off) their 20 favorite radio stations in the GTA series

Two-Way and Diverse Interactive Experience

Red Dead Redemption 2 is Rockstar’s latest game after GTA5. Rockstar tried to make the open world of Red Dead Redemption 2 more realistic, and to make all actions in the game meaningful for players. When a player has an argument with a game NPC, the game provides some different interaction options. The player can threaten with a gun, shoot, or tie up with a rope. The player may only need to aggressively draw a gun and point it at him, and the NPC will stop unnecessary quarrels, of course, it may also be exchanged for the other party to draw a gun in self-defense. Therefore, the level of player experience becomes no longer binary, not just “Do I hit him or not?”. This way of interacting with NPCs in the game also depends on other factors: the player’s appearance, smell, reputation, and dress, etc. For example, if the player is wearing a neat cowboy outfit, then the interaction of passers-by will be relatively friendly. On the contrary, if the player is unkempt and covered in blood, then other people in the game will not want to have anything to do with you at all, and may even be scared to flee for fear of their lives. If a player has recently participated in a bar brawl and done something bad, a complete stranger will yell at the player, reminding people around him that the player did something bad not long ago. In the game, players can greet, threaten, or rob everyone in the world, so any character the player sees in the world is a potential interaction. The player’s every move in the world will give corresponding feedback. In a disguised way, all the player’s in-game behaviors are meaningful. Therefore, through two-way and diverse interaction methods, players can better experience the state of the character in the game world, and at the same time, they can express and understand more, more delicate and real emotions in the game.

 

Picture: Potential interactions between players and NPCs in Red Dead Redemption 2

Conclusion

Rockstar has developed and published a series of games that record modern American history, enabling players to feel the unique characteristics of the society at that time and some characteristics of American culture in the setting of the plot and background. Whether it is the radio station talk in the GTA series or the diversified interactive experience in Red Dead Redemption 2, it is to create a more real world, so that players can understand and express more real and delicate emotions. As much as possible, make all the player’s in-game behaviors more meaningful, so as to stimulate the player’s stronger desire for autonomous exploration in the open world game.

entry.title: Focus Groups Are Not Simply a Summation of 1V1 Interviews
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

In user research, we often divide research methods into two categories: qualitative research and quantitative research. Qualitative research examines whether the research object has this or that attribute or characteristic, and whether there is a relationship between these attributes, through observation, experimentation, and analysis. Qualitative research consists of various methods such as interviews, observations, and case studies. Raw data includes interview records, photos, audio recordings, etc. The focus group that this article wants to introduce is a very classic method in qualitative research.

Previous articles have briefly introduced what a focus group is. Therefore, this article mainly compares focus groups with 1V1 interviews, analyzes the usage scenarios and advantages of focus groups. In addition, this article will also introduce how to apply focus groups and some tips for application.

I. Usage Scenarios of Focus Groups

A focus group, also known as a focus group interview, is a small group discussion where a trained moderator interacts with a group of representative users in an unstructured, natural way to gain in-depth understanding of relevant issues.

The question is, since focus groups also involve talking with users, why use focus groups instead of 1V1 interviews? When is it more appropriate to use focus groups instead of 1V1 in-depth interviews to collect user feedback in the form of interviews?

Here, this article summarizes three scenarios where focus groups are applicable:

  1. When user discussion is needed: In some cases, we want users to communicate, exchange, and discuss with each other to generate more ideas.
  2. Time constraints: 1V1 in-depth interviews often take a lot of time. When research is limited to a short period of time, focus groups that can include multiple users at the same time are superior to 1V1 interviews.
  3. Suitable for observation: When product, operations, and marketing want to observe user feedback during the research process and obtain first-hand information, focus groups can provide more information in a shorter time compared to 1V1 in-depth interviews.

II. Focus Groups VS 1V1 Interviews

By comparing focus groups and 1V1 interviews, which also involve interviews, we can more clearly understand the key points of focus groups.

Feature 1V1 Interview Focus Group
Subjects One interviewer and one user/interviewee Multiple participants in a discussion format
Selection Based on research objectives Based on research objectives; opposing viewpoints are not necessarily excluded
Interaction Interviewer-user interaction User-user interaction
Moderator Frequent communication and exchange Strong facilitation and control skills

Different Research Objects: 1V1 VS Multiple People

1V1 interviews, as the name suggests, use a model of one interviewer and one user/interviewee. Focus groups use the form of seminars to guide users to discuss, which is a multi-person format. The number of research objects varies according to different topics. Generally, larger focus groups require 8-12 participants, medium-sized focus groups generally have 6-8 people, and small groups have 4-6 people.

It should be noted here that the number of people in a focus group is more than that of a 1V1 interview, but it does not mean that conducting 6-8 1V1 interviews and conducting a 6-8 person focus group have the same effect. A focus group is not a superposition of 1V1 interviews.

Different Screening Criteria for Research Objects: Focusing on Research Objectives VS Not Caring About the Same Camp or Opposition Based on Research Objectives

In 1V1 interviews, we often screen users according to different test purposes. Commonly used screening indicators include age, gender, occupation, game experience, etc. Focus groups are no exception. The primary condition for screening is to focus on research objectives. However, focus groups do not exclude users with opposing views. That is, the users invited to the focus group may be a group of users with similar views, but users with opposing attitudes and views may be invited. Because, whether the views are similar or opposed, as long as effective communication and discussion can be generated.

Similar/opposite views can be used as subjects of focus groups, which further emphasizes that focus groups are not simply gathering 1V1 interview users for interviews, but selecting appropriate users around the research objectives to let them communicate.

Different Forms of Conversation: Interaction Between the Interviewer and the User VS Interaction Between Users

In 1V1 interviews, the interviewer and the user have a question-and-answer relationship, and the interviewer tries to inspire the user to express their views. In a focus group, the focus is on communication and interaction between users. Different from 1V1 in-depth interviews where users express their views individually, users in focus groups can compare their views with those of others, and further trigger attitudes of agreement/opposition, and continue to output views.

Compared with 1V1 interviews that focus on the interaction between the interviewer and the user, focus groups pay more attention to the interaction between users.

Different Roles of the Interviewer in the Test: Frequent Communication and Exchange VS Ability to Control the Scene

In 1V1 interviews, we hope that the interviewer can communicate and exchange with the user relatively frequently during the interview process, keenly perceive the user’s psychological changes, and explore the user’s true thoughts. In a focus group, the interviewer needs to have good control skills to encourage all participants to actively join the discussion of the topic. Do not deviate from the topic, do not cause quarrels, and ensure that the topic is not led by “opinion leaders”.

Therefore, compared with 1V1 interviews, the advantages of focus groups are:

  1. They can collect information and data from more users in a relatively short period of time, which is more “economical” than 1V1 in-depth interviews.
  2. They are more conducive to discovering user needs, attitudes, and reasons for attitudes: Thanks to group communication, users can have more inspiration and divergence when expressing their opinions, and the content generated can also obtain a direct comparison of attitudes on a topic through the collision of ideas between different users, which greatly enriches the views collected by researchers.

III. Application of Focus Groups and Small Tips

Having understood the usage scenarios and advantages of focus groups, how should focus groups be conducted? Are there any tips?

First, in the preparation stage before the implementation of the focus group, the following can be done:

Step Description
Determine Research Objectives Clearly define the goals and questions the focus group aims to address.
Develop Interview Questions Prepare open-ended questions that encourage discussion and exploration of the topic.
Recruit Users Select participants who meet the criteria and represent the target audience.
Choose Venue Select a comfortable and conducive environment for discussion.
Prepare Materials Gather necessary materials such as name tags, recording equipment, and any stimuli for the discussion.

In this preparation stage, there are many things worth noting. The most noteworthy thing is that when determining the interview questions, it is necessary to clarify that different questions should be raised at different stages:

  • Warm-up questions before the start: Do not involve privacy, hope to encourage everyone to discuss.
  • General questions: Start with the user’s life/work habits and guide them into the discussion.
  • In-depth questions: Deeply explore user needs.
  • Concluding questions: You can ask users to summarize and supplement the discussion content to ensure that the user’s expression is received.

In addition, recruiting users requires pre-establishing recruitment standards and the proportion of users of different types, choosing a venue requires cross-arranging seats for users with different backgrounds, and preparing materials including name tags, audio and video recording tools, etc., which will not be repeated.

In the implementation process after the preparation stage, there are the following links:

Step Description
Introduction Moderator introduces themselves, the purpose of the focus group, and ground rules.
Discussion Moderator guides the discussion using the prepared questions, encouraging all participants to contribute.
Observation Assistant observes and records user behavior, interactions, and key comments.
Wrap-up Moderator summarizes the discussion and thanks participants.

In the implementation phase, the overall discussion process requires assistants to observe and record user-related situations.

How to observe? It is necessary to observe the user’s attitude changes, the user’s product usage, and the user’s opposition. We can also use video recording to ensure the integrity of the video data with the user’s consent.

How to record? The user’s original words should be recorded verbatim, pay attention to the name and order of the speaker, and non-verbal behaviors should also be recorded. Here is also a small trick we use in the implementation process - sharing first-hand information using shared documents and other means. Why is this?
