In the research process, we often use a combination of various research methods, such as adding questionnaires to focus groups. Shared documents allow the interviewer to see the user’s answers for the first time, and guide the focus group based on the answers.

Focus groups are a commonly used qualitative research method, but the preparation and implementation process is somewhat complicated. Before we use it, we should clarify that we want to use focus groups instead of other methods, and what kind of information we want to obtain, so as not to complicate simple problems, and also to let focus groups play a greater role in suitable scenarios.

entry.title: Decrypting the Combat Experience of Idle Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

Idle games, when combined with combat gameplay, usually appear in the form of RPG games. They automatically collect resources, automatically fight, and even skip the battle process for one-click tower climbing. Without considering interactive animations and sound effects, idle games almost return the operating feel of combat to the era of chess games, abandoning the stimulation of dopamine and adrenaline in action battles. Players hardly need to operate to defeat enemies and win battles. Player actions seem to be marginalized. So, where does the pleasure of combat in idle games come from?

1. Combat Mechanism

Before answering this question, let’s talk about the combat mechanism of idle games. The purpose of the combat system design of idle games is mainly to verify the player’s growth, bring the fun of confrontation and social value, and cause empathy between the player and the character through combat. Like the battles of most RPG games, the battles of idle games also have rich combat mechanisms. Battles can be real-time, semi-real-time, or turn-based; players can control a single character or a team; characters have fixed positions or can move freely; the victory conditions of the game can rely on the numerical crushing of the cultivation system or the proficiency of the player’s operation… But before designing these rules, it is first necessary to clarify what kind of combat experience the game wants to bring. For example, A Mobile Immortal (一念逍遥) wants to express the realm of cultivators of different levels through combat. Its idle combat is not the team pushing tower of heroes, but借鉴《球球大作战》’s expression method shows the entire cultivation world, using the intuitive area comparison of large and small balls to show the qualitative change of the realm, bringing players the feeling of crushing and despising all beings. Fantastic Planet (妙奇星球) strives to create a relaxed and pleasant adventure atmosphere, and the combat is deliberately weakened. The single-line combat and the enemy design with weak offensive performance reduce the tension of the battle.

 

A Mobile Immortal Spirit World Combat

 

《Fantastic Planet》

2. Multi-dimensional Decision-making

From the perspective of process analysis, in the main line combat mode, the player’s behavior is generally to build a hero lineup before the battle, manually or automatically release hero skills during the battle, watch the battle process, succeed and harvest the spoils to continue the next level of battle, fail and adjust or strengthen the hero lineup; while the hero automatically fights, the game settles the battle data, and then presents the result. The player’s behavior is mainly concentrated on the pre-war lineup construction, and the development and results of the entire battle, various battle details, spoils, etc. are the results derived from the player’s decision-making lineup. From the perspective of the operation-feedback experience design principle, the player’s operating behavior is simplified, but the decision-making results are extremely strengthened.

Pre-battle Decision-making

Taking AFK Arena as an example, players choose 5 heroes from the existing heroes to form a combination for a 5v5 battle. The battle lineup is an unequal position of 2 in the front and 3 in the back, and the attack target selection follows the principle of the nearest priority within the range. After changing the character’s position, due to the difference in attributes, the total output and damage taken by the character will also change, thereby changing the entire battle situation. In the lineup decision-making, players need to consider the influencing factors of 5 dimensions, including front and rear, up and down positions, skill sets, racial restraint, racial bonuses, and cultivation level (proficiency) differences, and skill set matching. Players can adjust the position or replace the hero to form a clearance lineup.

 

《AFK Arena》 Main Line Combat

In order to optimize the player’s decision-making experience and minimize the difficulty and operating steps of decision-making, the hero selection interface of traditional idle combat games will show the scene of the two sides facing each other to render the atmosphere, express the sense of confrontation through a symmetrical layout, and at the same time display the combat power information of both sides, which is convenient for players to choose or upgrade heroes. Use quantified values to visually express the combat power of both sides, including the level, combat power, and total combat power of each character. Heroes are classified by attributes, sorted by level, and screened out commonly used formations or the strongest combat power to reduce the amount of thinking and operation of players. Explanations of the battle rules will be hidden by buttons, which is convenient for players to quickly understand the rules.

In-battle Decision-making

The player’s behavior during the battle is mainly to release character skills at the right time. Generally, players need to choose automatic or manual release. Some games directly remove the manual option and convert the skills into buffs, which simplifies the game process while saving art resources. In order to speed up the battle process, players can choose the playback speed of the battle animation. Manual combat is to manually select the timing of skill release. The skill cooldown is visualized graphically, and the character state changes after the cooldown to indicate that the skill is available.

 

《Idle Heroes》 Fully Automatic Idle, Skip Battles and Automatically Climb Towers

3. Combat Performance

Skill Performance

After the own character takes a certain amount of damage or after a period of cooling time, the highlighted character symbol indicates that the big move is ready. When clicking to release the big move, time is frozen, and the screen is focused by means of translucent masks, zooming in on the character, etc., to strengthen the visual performance and thus fully demonstrate the own combat power, Enhance positive operating feedback, the skill animation is not interrupted, ensuring the smooth release of our hero skills; while the enemy is treated differently, time is not frozen, and it is not highlighted, so as not to interrupt the player’s combat experience. The cutscene of the big move also makes the whole battle process more ups and downs, and players don’t have to just watch the hero fight.

The animation time of skill release is limited. This is the result of balancing a single performance and the idle combat experience. Because no matter how cool the animation is, it is difficult to bring continuous stimulation and freshness after repeated multiple times, but it destroys the game experience. Doomsday Crusader (拂晓的拾荒原), as a two-dimensional battle, has expressive advantages and good art resources, but the animation time of its skills is also strictly controlled, and the animation duration is less than 1 second after double-speed battle.

 

《Doomsday Crusader》 Character Skill Release

Number Pop-Up Strategy

The types of information carried by number pop-ups include damage values, healing values, critical damage, buffs, evasion kills, and other status information. In order for this information to be clearly conveyed, the design will use color, font size, font, appearance time, duration, speed and other characteristics to distinguish.

For the battle between two multi-hero camps, players generally cannot accept a large amount of numerical and status information in fast-paced battles, especially instant battles inevitably develop into melees. The number pop-ups in this type of game combat give up allowing players to accurately receive data, but reflect the battle situation through a large number of rapid number pop-ups, emphasizing the feedback output of our side, and achieving the role of combat to verify the player’s growth. For example, in AFK Arena, although it is an instant battle, the number pop-ups do not appear with the attack, but a turn-based strategy is adopted. The damage values taken by the whole field appear synchronously at a time point in an end time, reducing the chaos of the battle screen.

The slower-paced turn-based combat can better avoid the problem of chaotic numerical information. The damage output number pop-ups appear sequentially after the character attacks, and the position is fixed, and the player can clearly receive the information. The battle of controlling a single character presents less information, and players can accurately receive it, and the number pop-ups can be extremely exaggerated in value. A typical example is the Demon Suppressing Tower battle of A Mobile Immortal, which has an exaggerated unit of measurement after its data, exaggerating the value.

 

4. Combat Rhythm

Battle Duration

The battle duration of a single level of idle games is generally controlled within a short period of time, and the number of levels is large. This is because as a battle to verify growth, players get less experience in gameplay and can hardly tolerate a long period of boring waiting. The main purpose of the battle is to provide instant feedback, and numerous levels can provide multiple feedbacks at shorter intervals. This nature determines the fast pace of idle game battles. In addition to controlling the value of the life and output of both sides, the game can speed up the duration of a single game by simplifying decision-making steps and difficulty, doubling the speed of combat animation, shortening skill animation, and setting up automatic combat.

5. Summary

To output a combat experience that conforms to the game style in a short period of time, it requires the cooperation of game mechanics, visual effects performance, interaction design, etc. Clarify the content of the experience output, and then shorten the battle duration and operating steps, exaggerate and strengthen the audiovisual output, even if there are few operations and short time, it can also output the best audiovisual experience effect.

entry.title: Adding a Sense of Surprise to the Player Experience: Easter Egg Design in Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase))

Game design is an art, an art full of mystery. All artists will more or less give their works some small secrets, and game designers are no exception. These “little secrets” in the game are what we often call Easter eggs.

I. What are Easter Eggs?

Easter eggs are some interesting secrets hidden in the game that game makers deliberately leave for players during the game design process. They can be text messages, props, extra tasks, or other various strange designs. These seemingly irrelevant secret Easter eggs and hidden elements often play a key finishing touch.

Easter eggs are now almost standard in games. Developers are used to hiding things everywhere, and players can always find them all - as long as there are enough players of that game, nothing is impossible. Next, let’s count some interesting Easter eggs in the game.

The “Clay Figure” Item in Justice Online

Many Justice Online players will have the [Clay Figure] item. The item description says: Right-click me one hundred times and I will level you up. Many players clicked 100 times and did not level up. In fact, this is a prank Easter egg.

 

Easter Egg Design in Fantasy Westward Journey

The group of monks at the border of the Tang Dynasty, “Zhe Shi Monk, Ye Shi Monk, Hai Shi Monk”, actually means “This is a monk, that is also a monk, this is still a monk”.

 

The stone lion of the Tang Dynasty is the most majestic stone lion in the world

 

The words on the hat of Black Imp (Hei Wuchang) are “Catching you”, and the words on the hat of White Imp (Bai Wuchang) are “You’re here too”.

 

Easter Egg Design in A Chinese Ghost Story

At Qingqiu (359,267)(273,202), there is an NPC called Ferryman Wang (摆渡汪, Bǎidù Wāng, note the pun on “Wang” sounding like a dog’s bark). Clicking on him allows you to take the bamboo raft next to him, and there are interesting Easter eggs in the dialogue.

 

There is a stone tablet at Huangquan (250,89). After clicking on the stone tablet and offering a bouquet of flowers, fireworks and poems will appear.

 

II. Why Have Easter Eggs?

The earliest game Easter egg was designed by a programmer named Warren Robinett. Due to his dissatisfaction with the company Atari’s oppressive policies, he designed a hidden level in the game, which wrote Created By Warren Robinett. After this Easter egg was discovered, the company could no longer recall the game cartridges due to cost and public opinion. They could only make the best of a bad bargain. They let the existing products be, and told interested players that their future games would have such small secrets, just like Easter eggs, for players to find and enjoy.

In the early days, the graphics of games were extremely simple. If you wanted to make some “hidden content”, you could only directly manipulate the code. With the advancement of technology, Easter eggs have become an important part of the game today, and their forms are also diverse and changeable. So why should there be Easter eggs in games?

People need motivation to achieve certain needs, and some needs take precedence over others. This is what we most often call the five levels of needs: physiological, safety, social, esteem, and self-actualization. After satisfying the most basic deficiency needs, we step into the higher-level growth needs, that is, the satisfaction in the spiritual form.

 

Correspondingly, for games, it can be divided into four levels from low to high: functionality, reliability, usability, and pleasure. The top level, “pleasure”, includes the emotional needs in the theory of human needs.

Compared with other Internet products, games should pay more attention to the entire process and gradual experience of player experience.

The experience design of Internet products pays more attention to usability and needs to help users achieve their goals smoothly. For games, it is necessary to bring surprises to players and prevent them from playing the game in a rigid manner. An unchanging game will keep the player’s emotional fluctuations within a relatively stable range. A fun game will inevitably bring changes in the player’s experience. In other words, in addition to usability, the game experience must start from the player’s motivation and emotion. After ensuring the most basic usability, it is necessary to make players’ emotions change and try to add points in terms of pleasure.

And Easter eggs bring this kind of added surprise.

When players have expectations for the game, if the results during the experience far exceed expectations, players will have a strong sense of surprise. Making players’ seemingly impossible wishes come true also creates positive emotional experiences such as a sense of surprise. A sense of surprise is a particularly emotional element, and it is difficult for players to separate it when they experience the game.

Adding some relatively “clever” designs to the game will also make it easier for players to feel surprised. When the player is playing and then sees an Easter egg, they can’t help but laugh and say, “Oh, look at this designer.” Sometimes, such a small Easter egg may be enough to touch the player and make them resonate emotionally with the game.

For game designers, if they add some of their own elements when making a game, such as Easter eggs, then the designer will have a more personal connection with this game and will also be more attentive to it. It’s like it’s their own game, not just a development project they’re involved in. The same is true for players. As mentioned above, emotional resonance. As a player, when I find Easter eggs in a game, the game has a special meaning to me. I can feel the real traces left by the developers behind the scenes.

III. How to Design Easter Eggs

However, due to the hidden nature of Easter eggs, it is difficult to guarantee that players will definitely see these attempts at emotional resonance, which also creates great cost pressure. For a game, how to design Easter eggs becomes a problem.

From the perspective of user experience, the following factors need to be considered:

  1. Find the right time and place according to the type of game. It should not affect the main process, nor should it make users feel out of place or unable to find it.
  2. Pay attention to players to find design inspiration. Different players have different needs. Understand what players want and what are the extra points, so that the designed Easter eggs are valuable.

The current mainstream design methods include but are not limited to the following:

Homage: Developers use Easter eggs to pay tribute to classic games

Developers are originally game players. The game production process is actually a reproduction of the developers’ ideas, and the ideas themselves are largely derived from other games. Whether it is the game of the project team next door or the masterpiece of other companies, if these game experiences have more or less influenced the developers, it is also a good way to express respect by bringing some of their signs into the game.

Explore the game world and plot

Use Easter eggs to bury details throughout the game process, leaving them for players to discover and discuss. If the Easter eggs are designed properly, the player’s desire to explore can provide more online time for the game. In addition to spending time on the main line, players will also spend time exploring the game world. Once players find an Easter egg, they will feel that the game world is suddenly enlightened. To a certain extent, Easter eggs make the game world appear larger, encouraging players to explore carefully everywhere instead of taking a quick glance.

Unexpected interactions

This type of Easter egg usually does not follow the usual rules to bring an unexpected experience, making players exclaim “Can it be like this?”

It gives people an unexpected feeling, exceeding players’ expectations of the original content. Players will think, “Wow, there must be more of this kind of stuff,” and the game therefore appears to be richer.

Self-promotion of the game

The human touch and gameplay revealed in the Easter eggs are actually a promotion of the game itself. In layman’s terms, it is to make players feel the conscience of this game.

If the Easter egg is designed with enough depth, it will naturally drive operational interaction outside the game. Players may discuss various details in the game on online forums or offline, thereby generating unexpected promotional effects for the game.

Easter eggs are like chiseling carefully on a piece of marble without knowing whether anyone can observe these strokes, but a wonderful work of art has already been carefully crafted.

entry.title: Still Using Font Icons? Try Building an SVG Icon Library
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

I. Background

SVG is an image file format, the full name is Scalable Vector Graphics. It is a text file based on XML syntax. Most other image formats are based on pixel processing, so SVG does not distort like other image formats when enlarged.

Compared with PNG and JPEG images, SVG has a smaller size, stronger compressibility, and is scalable. It can be enlarged without losing image quality. It has an open standard and can be used to represent graphics, filters, animations, etc. It also has a very long history. It became a W3C standard in 2003, and mainstream browsers support SVG.

In practical work, SVG is very suitable for static image display, high-fidelity document viewing and printing, and other scenarios. Since SVG is described based on XML syntax, it is convenient to change the XML description, such as Path, Line, color, size, etc., to achieve the effect of changing SVG icons. Designers only need to produce one SVG image, which can be changed in size, color, animation, etc., and used in multiple places on the page.

II. Disadvantages of the icon-font Solution

IconFont is a well-known, powerful SVG open-source library with very rich icon content in China. In addition, there are some common open-source SVG libraries:

  • Font Awesome
  • Iconicons
  • css.gg
  • Featheroicons
  • Eva Icons
  • Heroicon
  • Bootstrap iconsl
  • Remix icons
  • …

These commonly used SVG open-source libraries have a very large SVG icon resource.

In the actual development process, the process of accessing and using these SVG resources is as follows:

 

This method has some disadvantages:

  • The operation steps are cumbersome. Every time the icon is updated, it is necessary to go through all the above processes again.
  • It is impossible to form a standard, and it cannot be reused between different projects. Projects can only be repeatedly copied; there is no entry to query the SVGs that the company already has.
  • It needs the help of a third-party website and is strongly dependent on the third-party websites mentioned above. There are security risks in uploading internal SVGs of the company.
  • The actual use is to package all icons into a font file and introduce them through class+css, which cannot be loaded on demand.

Based on these drawbacks, we would prefer to have an SVG component library with unified standards, reusability, independence from third-party websites, support for on-demand loading, and easier access, use, maintenance, and expansion.

III. Solution Research

SVG Sprite

Webpack svg-sprite-loader supports merging SVG files into an SVG sprite and loading them into an element with display: none. When using it, pass in the id of the icon to render the icon. This solution supports on-demand loading and packaging.

SVG To React

Webpack svg-react-loader supports directly requiring an SVG image. Users only need to simply configure webpack to use it directly.

Convert SVG to React Component

If the SVG Sprite and SVG To React solutions are placed in an independent component library, the business needs to configure the loader to process the files of node_modules. For these two methods, there are shortcomings in the ease of use of the component library.

Therefore, consider converting each independent SVG in the component library into a pure React component, rendering and returning the XML of the SVG, and passing in Props to change the SVG.

IV. Development Implementation

Re-sort the above solution ideas and clarify what to do:

  1. Create an independent SVG component library to store common SVG images
  2. Convert each SVG into an independent React Component
  3. Compile and build each React Component to support business on-demand introduction

We mainly introduce 2 and 3

Convert SVG to an Independent React Component

  • The main method used is the svgr open-source library

 

  • Configuring svgr is very simple, just specify the react template after svg conversion

 

  • You can get the converted React component

 

Compile and Build React Components into esm and cjs

The configuration of babel and tsconfig will not be introduced in detail here.

  • Use build:es to output each React Component to the es folder in esm format

 

  • Specify the component library access path

 

At this point, the independent svg library that supports on-demand loading has been built. After publishing the svg component library to the npm repository, it can be referenced in a very convenient and convenient way.

  • To add a new svg, just add the svg to the component library and execute the convert and build commands.

 

At the same time, you can also get all SVG components of the component library through import *, and render them to the online Demo document for real-time viewing.

 

V. Summary

  • svg is an image file format described based on xml syntax. The biggest advantage is that it does not distort when enlarged, and it is convenient to modify the size and color value. It is very suitable for static image display in actual work;
  • Companies often have their own common SVG Icons. Precipitating these SVG Icons into a component library can facilitate real-time access by designers, product managers, and developers;
  • The idea of building an SVG library is mainly reflected in converting SVG into an independent React Component, and then outputting the corresponding esm and cjs formats of the React Component;
  • The public SVG library can simplify the svg usage of icon font, and developers can easily change the svg; it can also unify and standardize the use and style of Icons in various products.

entry.title: Emotional Connection: How Games Capture Your Heart
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Introduction

Under the current social and technological conditions, especially with remote work during the pandemic, people have long accepted and recognized the communication method of “not being physically present together”. The virtual situation, also “not being physically present”, no longer gives people a false feeling. Instead, it is a situation with sufficient interaction capabilities and even can meet certain social needs. The “socialization” of games has become an obvious trend. Interactions within the game context (virtual character draws, appearance displays, ranking announcements, etc.) enhance players’ immersion in the virtual world and their self-identification in the game, thereby trusting the game world and generating a sense of dependence and companionship, thus achieving emotional connection.

I. Three Types of Emotional Connection

Self-Identity Based on Pursuing Difference

Let’s recall the scene of starting a new game for the first time. After entering the game context and accepting the rules, you will be given a specific value and informed of a clear evaluation system. As a result, the differences and stratification between you and other players are inevitable. Taking the card RPG mobile game Harry Potter: Magic Awakened as an example, under the battle mechanism, the sense of accomplishment brought by victory, the sense of conquest brought by duels, and even the sense of loss after failure will provide players with strong emotional energy, and rankings and tiers will also give players clear level differences, thereby enhancing players’ dependence and identification with this game context.

 

《Harry Potter: Magic Awakened》 Single-player Duel

A game often takes no more than 3 minutes. Frequent participation will strengthen the participant’s identification with their player identity, and then pursue their self-identification in this “small society”. After generating identity, pursuing differentiation becomes the player’s only choice. Drawing “legendary” level cards, obtaining better wands, card upgrades, costumes, etc., this pursuit of symbolic differences and instrumental purposes, in turn, creates players’ emotional connection with the game context.

Role Identity Based on Virtual Objects

Designers of nurturing games will reconstruct virtual characters in multiple ways. This beloved character often has a rich backstory and exquisite character art, and shows more or less affection for the role played by the player. Players will have a lot of shared experiences with virtual characters through their own perspective, or learn the “unknown” secrets of virtual characters from a bystander’s perspective that only the role played by the player knows. Strategies such as physical participation restrictions and CV dubbing in the game enhance the realism of virtual characters. The complete interaction ritual chain strengthens the player’s identification with the game context and virtual characters.

 

《Love and Producer》 Phone Recording Design

Games with elements of simulation, strategy, role-playing, and social interaction will create a high degree of mutual subjectivity between players and virtual characters through interaction with NPCs or the main storyline, enhancing players’ identification with the game context and virtual characters. In Animal Crossing: New Horizons, NPC residents are designed to have feelings. When players have not logged in to the game for a long time, the game world is also running smoothly. When the player logs in again, the NPC residents will also greet them like old friends in reality, thus further creating a sense of participation for the player that “in the process of playing the game, I feel that I am integrated with the people or things in the game”.

 

 

《Animal Crossing: New Horizons》 Interaction with NPCs After Logging in Again

Group Identity Based on Social Recognition

Whether it is pursuing unconventionality, identity tags, or investing emotions in virtual characters, what is implied is the player’s pursuit of a sense of identity and unity in real life. Some players start a new game and invest energy and resources because the game can be used as a social means to facilitate participants to integrate into different groups. When a game becomes popular, people who don’t know or haven’t played it are likely to become “social orphans”. There are also many players who obtain emotional support through the game experience to achieve a good state in real life and work.

II. Emotional Connection where Three Types Interact

Players first actively or passively participate in the game context due to personal preferences or social needs, and these three types of identification work independently or together. Driven by a sense of identity, players make virtual consumption in the game, and complete the reproduction of emotional connection in continuous participation. Players’ continuous participation in the game context is precisely the process of production and reproduction of three types of identification, and the three types of emotional connection are cause and effect in different specific situations.

In the MMORPG world, players enter and participate in game activities as virtual characters. The character is the incarnation of the player himself. When interacting in online games, players exist in virtual identities, have self-identification with the character, and have role-identification with other character images that promote the development of the plot. The exquisite graphics and rich plot design in MMORPG games have prompted players to interact with scenery screenshots and character selfie screenshots in the game, and even some players will make game content into video clips and post them on social media platforms to show other players their own stories in the game. Such short videos not only embody the player’s image in the game, but also derive a multi-faceted display of the player’s game skill level, game experience, and even economic capital investment. The more likes and comments, the more players can gain a sense of superiority in the game group, thus generating the reproduction of emotional connection.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Scene Atmosphere Creation

III. Conclusion

Games do not only attract players with storylines. What is more attractive than content and plot are emotional factors. In the process of being in the game, players can further have the desire to explore because of the stimulation of emotions such as joy, anger, sorrow, and happiness, and these emotional energies are also the deep purpose of players’ investment in the game. Only by achieving emotional connection and the reproduction of emotional connection can the game firmly grasp the user’s heart.

entry.title: Recommendation Systems: The MAB Problem and Bandit Algorithms
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

In recommendation systems, it is necessary to find a balance between exploration (exploring unknown areas) and exploitation (exploiting existing knowledge), which is the Exploit-Explore problem. Exploitation can be understood as recommending things that users are definitely interested in, while exploration can be understood as trying to discover users’ new interests. Otherwise, repeatedly recommending things that users are interested in will make users feel fatigued. However, constantly exploring new interests will inevitably affect the user’s click-through rate. Making trade-offs between exploration and exploitation is a challenge in developing recommendation systems.

I. The MAB Problem

In fact, the above problem can be abstracted as an MAB problem (Multi-armed bandit problem). As the name suggests, it originated in casinos. A gambler enters a casino and there are multiple slot machines. Each slot machine has a different probability of winning. How can the gambler learn the winning distribution of each machine and develop a strategy to maximize profit?

 

II. Bandit Algorithms

To solve this problem, you can try using Bandit algorithms. Bandit algorithms are actually a general term for a class of algorithms. The basic idea can be summarized in two points:

  1. For a choice, if the number of experiments is large enough and the return is greater, then we are more inclined to choose it, and vice versa.
  2. For a choice, if the number of experiments is too small to determine whether the choice is good or bad, then try it a few more times until its quality is determined.

III. Thompson Sampling Algorithm

Due to space limitations, this article only introduces a common Bandit algorithm: the Thompson sampling algorithm. Its principle is: in the candidate pool, the revenue generated by choosing each item follows a separate probability distribution. Each time a selection is made, a random number is generated from the probability distribution of each item. Finally, the item corresponding to the largest random number is recommended.

This probability distribution is the Beta distribution. Its probability distribution function is shown below:

 

  • The Beta distribution has two parameters, α and β, which determine the shape of the distribution curve:

    1. When α + β is larger, the curve will be narrower and the distribution will be more concentrated. Conversely, the curve will be wider and the distribution will be more dispersed.
    2. When α / (α + β) is larger, the center position of the distribution is closer to 1, and vice versa, it is closer to 0.

  • Applying this characteristic of the Beta distribution to the recommendation system, the number of times a user clicks on an item is regarded as the parameter α, and the number of times it is recommended but not clicked is regarded as the parameter β. Then there can be the following 3 situations:

    1. When α + β of an item is large enough (the number of times it has been recommended is large enough), its distribution will be very narrow, that is, we are already very sure of the return of recommending this item. At this time, the return generated according to the Beta distribution is close to its average return.
    2. When α + β of an item is large enough and α / (α + β) is larger (the number of times it has been recommended is large enough and the user’s click-through rate is very high), it means that its Beta distribution is narrow enough and closer to 1. Random numbers generated according to this distribution tend to be larger, and thus it is more likely to be recommended.
    3. When α + β of an item is very small (the number of times it has been recommended is very small), because the distribution curve it generates is very wide, it is possible to generate a larger random number, and thus be selected for recommendation. This plays the role of exploration.

IV. Summary

Bandit algorithms are a general term for a class of algorithms that can be used to solve the MAB problem of recommendation systems. In fact, it can also be used to solve the cold start problem, which is left for readers to think about. In addition to the Thompson sampling algorithm, common Bandit algorithms also include the UCB algorithm, the Epsilon-greedy algorithm, and others.

entry.title: What is the "Metaverse" in the Eyes of Game Developers?
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

“This is the Oasis, a whole virtual universe. The only limit here is your own imagination.” - Ready Player One

In 2018, the movie Ready Player One was released. Director Steven Spielberg presented an seemingly absurd yet fascinating world to the audience: when people put on VR glasses, they can enter this virtual world that contrasts sharply with the real world - this is the new world called “Oasis”. This virtual world has bustling cities and an independent economic system. You can be anyone and do anything. Even if you are a loser struggling on the fringes of society in reality. Take a leap, and you can still become a superhero in the “Oasis”.

Who would have thought that three years later, the “Metaverse,” based on Ready Player One, would become the hottest concept in the global investment circle. 2021 is clearly the “first year of the Metaverse”: Roblox, as the “first Metaverse stock”, was grandly listed, with a market value of over 40 billion US dollars, 10 times that of a year ago. Closely followed by Epic Games, the company that produced Fortnite, which raised 1 billion US dollars to develop its Metaverse business. Then Facebook changed its name to “Meta” and announced that it would transform into a Metaverse company within five years. In China, MetaApp, which is quite similar to Roblox, has also completed a C round of financing of up to 100 million US dollars, known as “the largest single financing for the Metaverse in China”. In addition, Nvidia, Tencent, ByteDance… from abroad to China, various giants have announced their Metaverse strategies. The Metaverse has become a battleground.

So Where Did the Metaverse Come From?

The Metaverse is not a new concept. In 1992, the famous American science fiction master Neal Stephenson described the Metaverse in his novel Snow Crash: “Put on headphones and goggles, find a connection terminal, and you can enter a virtual space simulated by a computer, parallel to the real world, in the form of a virtual avatar.”

In the book, Neal Stephenson describes a network world parallel to the real world, which is named “Metaverse” in the original English. It consists of two roots, Meta and Verse. Meta means “beyond” and verse means “universe”.

That’s right, Metaverse is the protagonist of our article today - the Metaverse.

People who often play games may scoff at this concept: “Virtual worlds, we have them all in our games.” Is the Metaverse a larger, more participatory MMORPG, a better-looking, more immersive VR world?

So, is the Metaverse that Everyone is Talking About Now Just a Virtual World in a Game?

Not really, or rather, not just.

In fact, Metaverse = MMORPG + Open-ended Tasks + Editable World + XR Entrance + AI Content Generation + Economic System + Social System + Avatar System + Decentralized Authentication System + Real-world Elements…

Roblox CEO Dave Baszucki proposed that the Metaverse should at least include the following eight elements: Identity, Friends, Immersive, Low Friction, Variety, Anywhere, Economy, and Civility.

  • Identity: You can have a virtual identity, regardless of your real-world identity. You can be the president or a beggar.
  • Friends: You can have real or AI friends, you can socialize, whether you know them in reality or not.
  • Immersive: You can be immersed in the experience of the Metaverse and ignore everything else.
  • Low Friction: Everything in the Metaverse happens synchronously, without asynchrony or latency, and the experience is perfect.
  • Variety: The Metaverse can provide rich and diverse content, including gameplay, props, etc.
  • Anywhere: You can log in to the Metaverse anytime, anywhere, without space restrictions.
  • Economy: Like any complex large-scale game, the Metaverse should have its own economic system.
  • Civility: People gather together to create a unique virtual civilization, a digital civilization.

Comparing this to games, we will find that even the most advanced computer games today cannot fully meet the requirements of the Metaverse.

  • Identity and Friends: Games can satisfy these two aspects. Players can create the characters they want, complete interactions with other players, and form social relationships.
  • Immersive, Low Latency: With current technology, it can barely be satisfied, but it is still far from the perfect experience (16K+ 720° high-definition images, 180Hz+ refresh rate, latency below 5ms).
  • Variety: A large number of content creators are needed to join and produce content, to make elements in the Metaverse, including gameplay, props, characters, scenes, etc., which we call UGC (User Generated Content). At present, it is still far away.
  • Anywhere: Depends on digital infrastructure and access methods. Cheap and easy-to-use access terminals can facilitate users to access the Metaverse anytime, anywhere.
  • Economy: Current games basically have economic systems, but they are very rudimentary. However, NFT (Non-Fungible Token) based on blockchain technology, due to its unique, non-replicable, and indivisible characteristics, can be used to record the production and transaction process of an item, thus providing a good authentication tool for property rights in the virtual world.
  • Civility: Currently, games can only be said to have formed a culture, and are far from forming a civilization.

Therefore, the Metaverse must not be a virtual world provided by a certain game. Games can at most attract many people, but it is difficult to attract most people in society. It can only become a social phenomenon, not a universe parallel to society.

Since the Metaverse is Not a Game, What is it?

Here, two practical schools holding different views of the Metaverse emerge.

One is the company represented by Roblox, which is committed to developing the Metaverse itself. Roblox, as the first company in the world to write the concept of the Metaverse into its IPO prospectus, is called the “first stock of the Metaverse”. This online creative game, played by more than half of the children in the United States, currently has nearly 200 million monthly active users. It allows users to use the platform’s tools to create 3D games or non-game experiences, and has the following key features:

  • Supports multiplayer online play, with a maximum of 100 people in a room, supporting social interaction.
  • The player’s image and decorations in Roblox can be used in different games on the platform and are interoperable.
  • The platform allows creators who upload games to earn the platform’s tokens, Robux.

So is the Metaverse a Platform About Games?

This is far from enough.

The Metaverse needs to attract users of all ages around the world, and also make users trust it enough, recognize that everything in it is valuable, and be willing to invest a lot of time and money in it, even work and life. It has the following three characteristics:

The Metaverse Must Be Able to Exist Forever

As long as civilization is not extinguished, the Metaverse will always exist. Just like the real world, users in the Metaverse can change, gameplay can change, and rules can also be adjusted, but the only thing that remains unchanged is that the world itself always exists. It is absolutely impossible for the bankruptcy of a certain company to affect the survival of the Metaverse. This is like the Internet upgrading from the internal network of American scientific research units, ARPANET, to the current Internet.

The Metaverse Must Be Decentralized

Just as we cannot judge which country is the center of the earth, a qualified Metaverse can have hot areas, and it can also have poverty and wealth, but it must not have only one center. If the right to interpret the rules of the Metaverse world can only belong to a certain company or a certain country, this is intolerable. To achieve this, there must be an open source shared protocol for accessing the Metaverse, similar to the HTTP protocol of the Internet.

The Metaverse Must Be Connected to Reality

The economic system in the Metaverse must be directly linked to the economic system of the real world. The influence generated by people’s identities in the Metaverse must be real, not illusory.

So let’s look at another point of view, companies led by Facebook and Microsoft that are preparing to provide services for the Metaverse in the future.

On October 29 this year, Zuckerberg described his vision for the Metaverse at Facebook’s Connect developer conference. Zuckerberg said: “I don’t think every company is building its own Metaverse, but all companies are building a part of the entire Metaverse, such as social platforms, tools for creators, e-commerce tools, and so on. The Metaverse is like the current Internet. No one says they are building their own Internet. We would say that we are producing experiences or infrastructure for the Internet. Here, the next generation of the Internet, this broader ecosystem, is called the Metaverse.”

To achieve such a Metaverse, Zuckerberg also mentioned two important characteristics:

Interoperability

This not only requires that the user’s virtual assets and image in the Metaverse can be used in any experience, but also requires that the Metaverse and the real world have interoperability. For example, using AR to see virtual things in reality, or using VR to buy real goods in a virtual store.

Portability

In addition to the computers, mobile phones, tablets, watches, etc. that we now use to access the Internet, there should also be portable VR/AR glasses in the future, which can allow us to enter a highly immersive virtual world more quickly. The interaction operation should be more intuitive than the current sliding screen, which requires technologies such as eye movement detection and gesture operation.

The idea that the Metaverse is the next generation of the mobile Internet seems to make the concept of the Metaverse less unrealistic.

So, What Exactly is the Metaverse?

The Metaverse does not yet have an authoritative definition, and different participants are constantly enriching its meaning in their own ways. Venture capitalist Matthew Ball defines the Metaverse he understands as follows:

“The Metaverse is a vast network of multiple real-time rendered 3D virtual worlds that collaborate and interoperate with each other. This network can allow an almost unlimited number of users to experience simultaneously and continuously, and can provide independent presence and data continuity. These data include identity, history, rights, objects, communication, and payment.”

This definition means that the most likely form of the Metaverse should be like the changes brought about by the mobile Internet. It is not to drag us directly from reality and turn us into Internet addicts. It is more like an extension of users’ needs in communication, entertainment, consumption, production, etc. in real life.

So, How Far Are We From the Metaverse Now?

Let’s see what the giants are doing: :)

  • Nvidia is making its own 3D collaborative creation platform.
  • Omniverse wants to make an operating system for the Metaverse.
  • Epic Games raised $1 billion to support the future development of the Metaverse (of which $200 million was invested by Sony).
  • Facebook changed its name to Meta and announced that it would transform the company into a Metaverse company within five years.
  • Microsoft launched the mixed reality platform Microsoft Mesh and integrated it into its chat and conference application Microsoft Teams to build the Metaverse.
  • Sony launched Dreams Universe, where you can create 3D games, make videos, and share them to the UGC community.
  • Samsung developed Relumino Glass VR glasses and launched the “Artificial Human” project.

NetEase Side:

At the third quarter earnings conference call for fiscal year 2021, Ding Lei answered questions about the Metaverse layout and said: “We may be the fastest to run when the gun fires.”

The following is a transcript of NetEase’s third quarter 2021 earnings conference call:

Nomura Securities analyst Jialong Shi: A question about the concept of the Metaverse. Recently, many domestic and foreign companies, including game companies, have expressed their intention to invest in this field, so I would like to ask the management how they view the future growth opportunities brought by the Metaverse to the game industry? Can you reveal NetEase’s layout plan in the Metaverse?

Ding Lei: The Metaverse is indeed a very popular concept, but frankly speaking, no one has touched the Metaverse yet. One thing I can say with certainty is that NetEase is ready at all levels of technology and planning. We know how to do rule design and technology reserves, so you don’t have to worry. When the Metaverse comes, we won’t be unprepared. We may be the fastest to run when the gun fires. I can only answer this way.

It seems that the giants are indeed investing in or promoting the underlying technology research required by the Metaverse.

While We Have Unlimited Expectations and Aspirations for the Metaverse, We Still Need to Remain Rational.

Any new technology mostly follows the Gartner Hype Cycle. The Metaverse’s development will not be done overnight.

So, What Does the Metaverse Have to Do with Me?

The concept of the Metaverse seems illusory, but in fact it has gradually begun to penetrate our lives. The formation of the Metaverse will enable the coexistence of virtual life and real life, two universes, and people’s lifestyles in the Metaverse may be completely different from those in real life.

  • Culture: During the epidemic last year, UCB University of California, Berkeley held a graduation ceremony in Minecraft. The scenes and elements built in the game were almost identical to those in real UCB. The character images of various graduate representatives participated in the game at the same time to hold the ceremony. To a certain extent, it has brought a unique presentation to the cause of education and culture.
  • Social: In Animal Crossing, players can freely design their own islands, presenting the concept of UGC in the Metaverse. Before the US presidential election, when the epidemic was at its peak, the Biden team used the Animal Crossing platform to create Biden Island to canvass for himself. To a certain extent, it allows players to establish intersections with Mr. President in the virtual world, and connects people who may never meet in the real world.
  • Shopping: Boson Protocol, as an infrastructure project for blockchain protocols, recently purchased a piece of land on the virtual reality platform Decentraland for $704,000, aiming to build a shopping mall for global brands on this land. It connects one end to Decentraland and the other end to various retail stores in the real world, establishing a connection between the Metaverse and the real world. In Animal Crossing, there are senior players in the game who have created Nookazon - the Animal Crossing version of Amazon, which is convenient for players to buy and sell items in the game. Various highly free gameplay and heavy social attributes have all promoted the development of the Metaverse ecology.
  • Entertainment: At the end of last year, Rap singer Lil Nas X held a concert on Roblox, and this year singer Travis Scott also held a solo concert on Fortnite, attracting the online attention of 44 million users. Nas used this sentence to describe his experience: “I can have my fans running around in space, while I’m flying in a spaceship.”
  • Games: As the current battleground for capital and technology, playability is the winning factor. Looking at the current game industry, some games have initially played a part of the concept of the Metaverse, just like Animal Crossing with creative content and social attributes. As for Zelda, because his game territory is quite large, it has built an open world component to a certain extent. Like Roblox, Fortnite, Minecraft, as professional game development teams, their playability provided by the game is also recognized by the industry, and it also provides impetus for the sustainable development of the game. There are also blockchain games Decentraland, Sandbox, Alice, etc. These games are all moving towards the decentralized infinite game - the Metaverse.

The Metaverse is an Extension of User Needs, Not an Escape from the Real World

The outbreak of the new crown epidemic in the past two years has accelerated the virtualization of society, making people’s online life a normal state from a short-term exception, a parallel world from a supplement to the real world, and making people realize that the virtual is not false, let alone insignificant. 2020 has clearly become the tipping point for the virtualization of human society. In the future Metaverse, people will change a mode to work, live, and entertain. It will give birth to new 3D user-generated content, which is more attractive than short videos; there will be new ways of socializing, which are more convenient and easy to use than instant messaging software; of course, it will also create more difficult life troubles and political problems… Human real life will migrate to the virtual world on a large scale, and human beings will become amphibious species of reality and numbers. Russian President Putin believes that: “The possibilities brought by the ‘Metaverse’ should be used to break through the limitations of distance, help communication and learning, rather than an escape from the real world.”

The experience felt in the Metaverse, whether physical or digital - is real. In a virtual place we may be more real, we may be more comfortable or more creative than in the real world, this is the power of the parallel virtual experience. Just like the classic line in the movie Ready Player One:

“This is the Oasis, a whole virtual universe. The only limit here is your own imagination.”

entry.title: Why is the Translation of 'Elden Ring' So Controversial: The Importance of a Bridge Language
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

2022 can be said to be a year of great games. Among them, Elden Ring, produced by FromSoftware, the developer of the Souls series, at the end of February this year, made many Tarnished revel. The Souls-like gameplay that makes people love and hate it, the rich weapon combat system, the fragmented narrative, the huge Western fantasy open world, and the shocking story worldview have swept the major game review websites and is arguably the ceiling of current open-world games.

So, for such a 3A masterpiece with a huge worldview and complex game mechanics, what is the localization like? Why is the translation so controversial and criticized by players? This article will take you on a journey through Elden Ring from a game localization perspective, through case analysis.

1. “The Chinese Translation is a Bit Strange” - Katakana Hell

Elden Ring has the grandest story background in the history of Souls games, thanks to the amazing imagination and creative skills of George R.R. Martin, the author of A Song of Ice and Fire. Martin built a magical world full of human entanglements, anxiety, and turmoil for this game. However, it is precisely this A Song of Ice and Fire style story framework that has brought huge challenges to the localization of the game, especially since the developer of the game is from Japan. In Japanese translation, if you encounter words that you don’t know how to translate, Japanese will use katakana for direct transliteration. In Elden Ring, we often see such a shadow. Although this form of translation is correct and does save a lot of trouble, can it really give players a good experience?

Case 1: “Limgrave” in the Novice Village is Actually a Cemetery

Limgrave is the name of the first area where you are born, that is, the novice village. Just looking at the Chinese name, it is not difficult to imagine that it is a transliteration.

In fact, the English version of Limgrave is called “Limgrave”, and the Japanese version is “リムグレイブ”.

Grave, corresponding to the Japanese グレイブ, means graveyard/cemetery. Then the preceding Lim- is a homophone often used in Western writing to write names and place names. So what does Lim- refer to? There are two theories.

The first is that the boss of the Limgrave area is called “Godrick the Grafted”. His ability is to graft the limbs of others onto himself, so it can be associated that the Lim- here refers to Limb, meaning limb/extremity. So Limgrave means limb grave, the graveyard of limbs.

Another theory is this. The Lim here is a katakana transliteration of the Japanese “リム”, which actually refers to Rim. And Rim means border, edge, boundary, derived from the Old English rima. Then Limgrave means Rimgrave, border graveyard. It just so happens that the name of a dungeon next to the birthplace in the game is called the “Fringefolk Hero’s Grave”.

Which theory do you agree with? However, no matter which theory is correct, Limgrave is not a good place, it refers to the meaning of a cemetery, but players who have just come out of the novice village can’t see this meaning at all.

Case 2: What Kind of Castle is Stormveil Castle?

Let’s take a look at “Stormveil”, which has been criticized by players countless times.

I believe that many friends with good English will think of “Stonewell” or “Stonewall” when they see this name.

But in fact, “Stormveil” in the English text is “Stormveil”, which is surprising. Although this name is very “Ice and Fire”, the sudden transliteration is really puzzling against the backdrop of names such as “Storm’s End” and “Stormhill”.

The preceding Storm means storm.

But what about Veil? Veil means veil in English, which means to cover up. If you have to translate it, Stormveil Castle can be translated into Stormveil Castle. Huh? Isn’t it strange?

Let’s look at the Japanese text - “ストームヴィル城”. The katakana of the first half of the Japanese “ストーム” is Storm, but does the remaining “ヴィル” mean Veil?

Of course not.

Here we checked the translation and found that “ヴィル” actually means Ville, which refers to city, urban area, town, and is a French word;

The katakana corresponding to Veil is “ベール”, which is different from the original Japanese.

At this point, everyone should also understand that “Stormveil” is actually Stormville, meaning storm city.

The “Stormveil” here should be a direct katakana transliteration of Japanese. If you translate the English Stormveil, then the Chinese should also be Stormveil Castle, which is obviously not the case here. However, no matter which language is used as the bridge language for translation, “Stormveil” has lost the original prestige of Stormville.

2. Is the Original Text in the Game English or Japanese?

According to the analysis of the above cases, we can determine that the Chinese was translated from Japanese as the bridge language, so it also fell into katakana hell. But is the source language of the game English or Japanese?

Although the official introduction mentioned that George R.R. Martin contributed a huge background worldview setting to Elden Ring, Martin mainly participated in the outline of the game legend, and the story after the player starts the game is still handled by FromSoftware’s local Japanese team.

Then we speculate that English is just the language used by George R.R. Martin during the creation period of the game development. Due to the background of most Japanese members of the production team, the style of most of the text in the game will be closer to the habits of Japanese culture, so it is possible that Japanese is the real source language of the game. The story framework created by George R.R. Martin in English directly transliterates untranslatable words into katakana during the translation into Japanese, and then uses Japanese as the bridge language to start localization in various languages. And some of the English we see in the game is also translated from Japanese. Stormveil Castle is an example, let alone Chinese.

3. Conclusion: The Choice of Localization Bridge Language

Elden Ring successfully creates a magnificent open world without losing the Souls flavor at all. Its scale is amazing, and the length of the story is also admirable. The story created by George R.R. Martin is imaginative and intoxicating.

But in terms of localization, the worldview of Elden Ring conveys a Western fantasy style. If the background of the creative language is respected, and English is used as the source language instead of Japanese, which is mainly Oriental, will the quality of Chinese localization be improved?

From the perspective of most current game studios and publishers, English is still preferred as the bridge language for localization. The most important reason is that based on the global universality of English, using English as the bridge language can find more experienced game translators.

From the perspective of the developer FromSoftware, the scale of the development team is not very large. If Japanese is used as the source language of the game for localized development, it can save a lot of development time and cost. Moreover, various translation errors that also appear in previous Souls games can also be seen. It can be seen that the developer’s priority for localization quality is not so high, and it also exposes that FromSoftware has always had some localization problems.

In short, no matter what language is used as the bridge language, the most important thing is to accurately convey the meaning that the game itself wants to express through different languages. Before localization, you should first understand the meaning of the original text, and the translation should be understandable, and the meaning should be conveyed correctly. This is the most important thing, rather than falling into “katakana hell”.

Easter Egg: Why is Elden Ring Called “Old Man’s Ring” in Chinese?

Elden is very similar to Elder in English, and the meaning of Elder includes “elder”. Another very famous game, The Elder Scrolls, is nicknamed Old Scroll because of its English name “The elder scrolls”, so there is a similar nickname here in Elden Ring. The meaning of the word Ring is ring or ring. The producer of the game has explained that the ring in the game name does not mean ring, but refers to a circle. Therefore, the combination of the two has the alias of “Old Man’s Ring”.

entry.title: Players are Wildly Sharing this Word Puzzle Game, What Did it Do Right?
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Earlier this year, Wordle sparked a puzzle craze on overseas social media. Those familiar with it should not be strangers to the screen-filling pictures composed of green, yellow, and gray squares. Even now, if you type “Wordle” into a search engine, a Google dynamic icon in Wordle’s classic gray, yellow, and green color scheme will appear, which shows how popular Wordle is. However, this sharing that looks like Morse code, and playing it is like an educational English learning word puzzle game, why did it become popular, making overseas players enjoy it and check in every day?

1. What is Wordle? How to play?

To put it bluntly, Wordle is a crossword puzzle game that is updated daily. The player’s only goal each day is to guess a five-letter word within six attempts. The entire game interface is simple and intuitive, consisting of a 5×6 square array; the game rules are also relatively simple. After the player enters the guess, the game will mark each letter square with a color to indicate the accuracy of the current guess:

  • Gray: Indicates that the letter is not in the answer at all.
  • Yellow: Indicates that the letter is in the answer, but at the wrong position.
  • Green: Indicates that the letter is in the answer and at the correct position.

Players continue to try based on the hints obtained from each guess, narrowing down the scope of the answer until they guess the answer correctly or use up all six attempts. After the game, players will be provided with a statistical data, showing the accuracy rate of each step, the number of consecutive days of playing, and the countdown to the next round; at the same time, the player’s game interface will be generated into a corresponding color layout of the emoji square matrix, and the player can click the “share” button to copy and share to various social media platforms.

2. Why is Wordle Popular?

Many readers may be thinking after seeing the above introduction: “Isn’t this just a traditional crossword puzzle game? How did it become popular?” “These rules are also old-fashioned, isn’t the number guessing game in Xuan-Yuan Sword: Scar of Sky exactly the same as this Wordle?”

So, the gameplay is not new, and the core is more like education than entertainment, why is it popular? Why are players willing to participate in the game every day and actively share it on social media?

Wordle actually has a “story”. The game was born out of a love story. The game’s creator, Josh Wardle, is a software engineer. His girlfriend loves to play crossword puzzles. Wardle developed this game for his girlfriend. It is said that “Wordle” is a pun combining his last name and the game theme “Word”. In 2021, Wardle accidentally sent the game to a family group chat. The game was unexpectedly popular, making Wardle feel the game’s potential for dissemination, and only then did he share the game online at the end of the year. As of January this year, the number of players challenging Wordle every day has reached 2 million.

If you carefully examine the core setting of Wordle, it is not difficult to find that it represents a classic paradigm for the success of casual games: simple rules, easy gameplay, with many attributes that promote dissemination, and can spread to all social media that people can access. Not only that, compared with almost all casual games now thinking about how to make users stay longer, how to actively or passively share socially, Wordle does the opposite, using the setting of providing the same question to all players every day + a simple, intuitive and special sharing method, explaining what “less is more” means.

First of all, Wordle only updates one question a day. In fact, word puzzles, or casual games in general, are not considered to have high replayability, and this artificially created scarcity enhances the player’s desire to challenge and their anticipation, like “hunger marketing”, making players who successfully challenge feel satisfied, and making players who fail to challenge feel concerned. If several hundred levels are set up like in ordinary casual games, players may easily feel bored due to a large amount of homogeneous content in a short period of time. However, the setting of one question per day makes the content fresh for players every day, and it only takes three to five minutes to complete a round, making it easier to form a daily check-in habit. In addition, this setting also makes the game inherently topical, making it easy to expand the game’s voice through word of mouth. Many tweets with #dailyWordleClub on Twitter also prove this point. According to Twitter’s data statistics, in January this year alone, there were 1.3 million tweets related to Wordle in the UK, and the amount of chat interaction increased by 16 times.

Secondly, all players share a puzzle every day. Doing the same question as everyone else obviously amplifies the player’s sense of accomplishment on social platforms. Many people will compare with family and friends, “I guessed it in 3 tries, you used 4 tries or didn’t guess it, I’m better than you, at least luckier than you”. This sense of accomplishment of “what others don’t have, I have, and what others have, I have better” is greater than the sense of accomplishment of simply guessing the answer, and the player’s satisfaction can last longer.

Then there is Wordle‘s sharing function, which is relatively cleverly designed: using color blocks to refer to the game results. Due to the different problem-solving processes, each player can get a completely different three-color picture for sharing. This cryptic sharing is highly recognizable, easy to arouse the curiosity of uninitiated players, and can also allow players to communicate game progress and share “answering experience” with each other while avoiding spoilers. Moreover, the shared picture can also show how many times the player used to guess the answer today. Coupled with the rule of one word per day, players will feel a trace of invisible competition in sharing, and secretly compete in terms of IQ or luck.

This relatively unique way of sharing has been creatively diversified by players. From sharing solutions, to different art-styles (like Pixel Art), and other creative outlets (like Drawing, or Embroidery).

3. Can a Chinese Version of Wordle be Successful?

Later, as Wordle spread to the Chinese community, some people began to discuss the possibility of a Chinese version of Wordle. The one that stands out is Handou, which is in the form of “guessing idioms”. Players first guess the tone order of the four-character idiom, and then guess the first letter of the pinyin after guessing correctly. In addition, some people have proposed that strokes, Cangjie pinyin, etc. can be used as guessing targets.

Although a Chinese replica version has appeared, due to the significant differences between English and Chinese characters, the difficulty of Handou has increased invisibly. English words are only composed of 26 English letters, so the correctness of inputting letters has become the only criterion for Wordle. The composition of Chinese characters is particularly complex, which can be spelled out by pinyin or composed of radicals. Therefore, even if radicals are used as additional hints, the difficulty of the game is significantly increased, making some players choose to stay away.

Secondly, as a derivative of Wordle, Handou has become a Chinese version of it. Although there are slight differences in rules, there is no substantial innovation in game content and gameplay. This makes it difficult for Chinese users who have experienced Wordle to maintain continuous attention to Handou. In addition, there are also Sweardle, Lewdle, Nerdle, and Globle, which are derivatives of Wordle. The increase of these “same old thing” homogenous games makes it more difficult for Handou to stand out.

Back to Wordle itself, the game was a smash hit, but it is now slowly disappearing from the public eye, which seems to be the inevitable fate of casual H5 games. The reason is that the single game mode is a pain point that they cannot solve. For most players, the freshness when they first come into contact will gradually decrease over time, until they finally choose to quit. But we cannot deny the initial success of the game. Wordle allows players to feel the original intention of the game: shareability, pleasantness, and competitiveness. This is what players want to see, and it is also what game developers and operators should think about and insist on.

entry.title: What Do Players of "Buy-to-Play Otome Games" Really Like?
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Unlike other action-oriented buy-to-play games that pursue a sense of excitement, most buy-to-play otome mobile games are in AVG (Adventure Game) format, and some game systems have even been simplified to “audiobooks.” It seems more accurate to describe the gaming experience as “reading an e-book” rather than “playing a game.” However, even though the system has been simplified to an e-book, and the golden age of around 2011 has passed, buy-to-play otome games still have stable sales both domestically and internationally. Some people will definitely ask: “Why do these players spend 600 yuan to buy a game that lacks a sense of game operation and is similar to an e-book mode?” This article will analyze the purchasing factors of buy-to-play otome game players.

1. Exquisite Art Style

Compared with other games, standalone otome games often have higher-quality character art, with a delicate and exquisite style. Buy-to-play players often pay attention to the NPC characters in the game from head to toe, from outerwear to accessories. Whether it is Western fantasy, steampunk, or historical drama, popular otome games often have handsome character designs and excellent artwork. Buy-to-play games often create a complete game world for players, where each character will satisfy the aesthetic fantasies of general women, representing the highest aesthetic level of players. In addition, many players also have their own requirements for the exquisiteness of the game UI: the color scheme should be tasteful, and the font should be beautiful and easy to distinguish.

Many game companies are also aware of this demand from players and have put a lot of effort into the iterative update of art style. Many large game manufacturers have even cultivated special artists for buy-to-play otome games. Looking at the current buy-to-play otome games, we can feel that the characters tend to be beautiful, from hair design to clothing matching, all have been carefully designed; not only that, the UI design also incorporates the color elements that female players like, and incorporates the game elements that female players like.

 

The fantasy game “Cendrillon palikA” and the vampire-themed “DIABOLIK LOVER” have very exquisite character designs.

 

The game UI of “Cendrillon palikA” uses a lot of dreamy pink and purple elements, which has been well received by players.

2. Luxurious Voice Actors

In addition to exquisite graphics, another feature of the standard configuration of buy-to-play otome games is the full voice-over system. In the absence of gameplay, the voice acting of voice actors is one of the players’ gaming experience points, so the current voice acting market for buy-to-play otome games is also becoming increasingly competitive. Players require that the voice should fit the character itself, and they also require that this voice actor needs to have a certain popularity and have certain achievements in the industry.

Unlike many luxurious voice actors in China, whose voices tend to be uniformly “seductive,” Japanese male voice actors often tend to have more diverse voice acting styles due to their large number and the great differences in players’ preferences. Whether it is a refreshing boy, a mysterious person who is both righteous and evil, or a noble royal family, you will always find well-known voice actors who fit the character setting to cooperate. In the game, a fitting voice can bring players a more immersive enjoyment.

 

Otome games often have quite luxurious voice actor lineups, and many voice actors have millions of fans.

 

Many players of standalone otome games will give the game a good review because of the superb performance of the voice actors.

3. Character Designs That Match Their Own Aesthetics

The number of capturable characters in a buy-to-play single-price otome game is not very large, generally maintaining a level of around 6. However, the personalities of the characters are often individual and distinct. For example, a game will never have two presidents, nor will it have two characters with hidden darkness. Attributes such as sharp-tongued, tsundere, and natural will often appear reasonably and be integrated into a game. Players will always find their favorite object in the game. Many game manufacturers even release FD sequels in works other than the main story. In FD, they will add capturable game objects to attract fans of the character designs of Subs (non-capturable NPCs) in the main story to purchase and experience the game.

 

In the buy-to-play otome game “Psychedelica of the Black Butterfly,” the character designs of the capturable objects do not overlap.

4. Powerful Script

The script is half the battle of a buy-to-play otome game. With the assistance of voice acting and art, the scriptwriter needs to show players a unique worldview. Buy-to-play otome games often have a huge amount of text, often requiring players to spend 50 hours to complete the game. Many otome games will hire professional light novel writers or professional writers to create the script, and the game will have different manifestations due to the personal style of the scriptwriter. Buy-to-play standalone games include not only relatively close-to-life script frameworks such as “Stardom 2” and “Tokimeki Memorial Girl’s Side,” but also script worlds with bizarre plots such as Hyakki Yagyō (Night Parade of One Hundred Demons), vampire families, or Snow White dark fairy tales. Whether you are a fan of realism or a fan of fairy tales and legends, you can experience the fun of the game in buy-to-play otome games.

It is precisely because buy-to-play otome games are infinitely close to the e-book mode that the script will largely determine the player’s experience. If a game’s script has flaws, such as unclear logic or an anticlimactic ending, then players will rate the work lower. On the contrary, among a group of beautiful men and women, games with strong and reasonable scripts often become classics and white moonlight in the hearts of players.

 

Players of buy-to-play otome games will make decisive evaluations of works based on the script.

5. Communication with Like-Minded People

Around 2010, the main forum for female-oriented games, Yume100, had a large number of female-oriented game enthusiasts. The forum had very advanced and detailed classifications: otome games/yuri games/BL, all ages/non-all ages were reasonably divided; in addition to game resources, the forum also had players’ clearance thoughts, drama resources, and the latest event information. It can be said that, with a membership to [Yume100], you could get the most advanced information on Japanese female-oriented games. Because the website’s server is small and has high requirements for capacity, registering as a member of [Yume100] requires layers of review, and being rejected is also commonplace.

 

In the Q&A of Zhihu: “How to evaluate the female-oriented forum Yume100?”, some respondents said that they had been rejected three times in a row.

In addition to the high membership threshold, replying to content such as “up” and “thank you” on other forum pages is almost impossible on [Yume100].
