Thai keyboard

 

Japanese keyboard

 

Korean keyboard

In the years that QWERTY has dominated the market, many people have also tried to improve the keyboard layout. After all, the design of the QWERTY keyboard is not perfect. When using it, the left hand undertakes 14% more workload than the right hand (no wonder the author’s left hand always aches faintly when typing), and the usage rate of the middle row of letters is only 32%.

The most famous of these new keyboards is the Dvorak, born in 1936, and named after its designer, August Dvorak. The Dvorak keyboard reconsiders the frequency of English letters. All vowels are listed on the left and commonly used consonants are listed on the right, assigning 56% of the typing load to the right hand. It also utilizes the middle row that QWERTY abandoned, making the usage rate reach 70%.

 

Comparison of the usage rate of the three rows of Dvorak keyboard and QWERTY keyboard

3. Keyboard Localized User Game Experience Design

For players who use the QWERTY keyboard, using WASD to represent up, down, left, and right movement is already the default. But after learning the knowledge points above, we will find something is wrong. It is too unreasonable to require players who use minor language keyboards to adapt to WASD! We have compiled the following keyboard localization experience design solutions:

Players Manually Reset Keyboard Keys

Fortunately, most games today support user-defined keys in the key settings. Not only can minor language players adjust the key settings that best suit their keyboard layout, but some professional e-sports players or players who pursue higher skills can also adjust a set of personal optimal key combinations. For example, overseas players can set appropriate keys through custom keys when playing Naraka: Bladepoint. This degree of freedom has solved the problem of conflicting keyboard layouts to a certain extent, but just like Dvorak’s improvement to QWERTY, the improvement of the keyboard world has never stopped, and game designers are also seeking an optimal solution.

 

Naraka: Bladepoint Supports Custom Keys

Read the Input Method Once Before Starting the Game to Confirm Key Settings

Some manufacturers have adopted a silent strategy, allowing players to automatically adjust key settings without additional operations. The game either reads the input method once before starting, and the keys automatically adapt to the current keyboard settings, so you can play happily the moment you start the game. The key settings of APEX adopt this solution.

 

Correct Key Settings in Real Time According to the System Input Method

Or the game changes the key settings in real time according to the system input method after starting, no matter how many languages you want to switch in the game, it can meet your needs.

Although it saves users the trouble of additional operations, this method may also make some players suddenly find that their keys are “out of order” during passionate play. (Next time you encounter this situation, you can check if you accidentally switched the input method.)

In-Game “Key Reset” Button Adjustment

In order to avoid this ghostly attack and allow users to confirm that they need to switch key settings, game designers have introduced another one-button strategy. The game can change the language at the automatic installation to change the key settings. Or the player can go to the “Settings” page and select “Key Reset” after starting the game. This method is currently the most common method on the market. The feedback is timely and the purpose is clearer.

 

Overwatch key settings are linked to the game settings text language in Battle.net

Whether it is to automatically change key settings for users or to provide options to change key settings, it is to convey a message to every niche player in today’s increasingly diverse world: their needs are seen, faced, and met.

entry.title: You May Not Know There Are So Many Intricacies in Game Localization for Overseas Markets
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

1. Overview of Game Localization

With the continuous development of technology, the ways people choose to spend their leisure time have also greatly increased. Today, digital games (i.e., various games designed and developed using digital technology and implemented on digital devices) have many followers almost all over the world, and they no longer belong only to the language and culture in which they are released. Thanks to game localization, many games have been translated into other languages to reach more players.

Through game localization translation, the game is fully adapted to the culture of the target language and is driven by the history and stories of that culture. Game translation is constantly evolving in this field and has become more important with the increase of e-sports enthusiasts, but it can only achieve its main purpose when it is carried out by qualified and experienced translators.

 

2. General Characteristics of Game Localization

After games entered our lives with the production of computers and mobile phones, they also created a huge global market. Especially in terms of text translation, professional language talents are needed, so the concept of game localization has emerged. An important reason why professional language talents are needed is that each game has a unique structure, special terminology, and scenarios. Localization can transform special terms and “introduced” things to match the local cultural background, eliminate cultural barriers brought by “introduced” products, and ultimately meet the needs of local customers and realize the market value of products.

Localization mainly includes two basic aspects, one is text translation, and the other is cultural exchange beyond text translation. Cultural exchange includes language, culture, customs, and habits. Localization is equal to text translation plus cultural adaptation. Localization has a certain degree of adaptation and redesign space for the translated text. While making the translation close to the original text, it can also reflect the distinctive cultural characteristics of the region.

In the game League of Legends, the English names of Rakan and Xayah are “The Charmer” and “The Rebel”, respectively. In the Chinese server, “The Charmer” is translated as “幻翎” (Huàn Líng). “幻” (Huàn) corresponds to the literal translation of the English title, and “翎” (Líng) refers to a type of feather, which matches the appearance characteristics of the hero. “The Rebel” is translated as “逆羽” (Nì Yǔ). “逆” (Nì) reflects the hero’s rebelliousness, and “羽” (Yǔ) means “feather”, the weapon used by the hero. “翎” (Líng) and “羽” (Yǔ) correspond to each other, and “洛” (Luò) and “霞” (Xiá) are taken from Wang Bo’s “Preface to the Pavilion of Prince Teng” - “落霞与孤鹜齐飞，秋水共长天一色” (Falling rosy clouds fly together with a lone wild duck, and the autumn water shares the same color with the vast sky). Through flexible translation, the communicative purpose is achieved without affecting the player’s gaming experience.

3. Skills to Master for Game Localization

Every game contains a variety of dialogues, songs, literary texts, word games, and references to the source culture. When all these elements cannot be fully translated into the target language, the gaming experience is negatively affected. To avoid this negative situation, you should first be familiar with different types of text when localizing games. At the same time, it is extremely important to keep up with the constantly changing game terminology. It is equally important that the localization team understands the trends that are rapidly spreading among players and the ever-changing and evolving technology. Especially in online games involving many players, the player community creates their own jargon, an online language.

For example, in the game Naraka: Bladepoint, developed by NetEase’s 24 Entertainment and supported by Leihuo UX, the game takes place on an island called “Morus Isle” (聚窟洲 - Jù Kū Zhōu), which has complex terrain, cliffs, and ravines, with bamboo forests, ancient cities, shipwrecks, and ancient temples. When localizing the game, the first thing to do is to understand and master the knowledge related to “Wuxia” (武侠) and “Wuxia games”. Secondly, it is necessary to consider how to translate terms such as “Parry” (振刀 - Zhèn Dāo), “Special Souljade” (特殊魂玉 - Tè Shū Hún Yù), “Attribute Souljade” (属性魂玉 - Shǔ Xìng Hún Yù), and “Worship” (祭拜 - Jì Bài) in a way that conforms to the local customs of the players, using some easy-to-understand words to help players better understand the game.

Naraka: Bladepoint has been localized into 14 languages worldwide. In addition to the popular markets such as Japan, South Korea, and Southeast Asia, the Turkish market is also a new attempt. In the process of game localization in the Middle East market, more consideration should be given to the local customs and religious background. In the game, players have a task that needs to be completed through worship. However, most countries in the Middle East believe in Islam, so it is necessary to use words like worship more cautiously. Instead, the content of worship in the game is changed to “prayer” (祷告 - Dǎo Gào), which is more in line with the local cultural and religious background.

 

4. Game Localization in the Turkish Market

As a place where Eastern and Western cultures meet, Turkey has a relatively high acceptance of mainstream games currently on the market. The mobile Internet has developed rapidly in the Middle East in recent years, especially Turkey, which is the largest mobile game market in the Middle East, accounting for nearly 40% of the market size of the entire Middle East. At the same time, Turkey is also the game market with the most demographic dividend in the Middle East. Its total population exceeds the total number of all individual European countries, and more than one-third of the population are gamers. According to statistics, Turkey’s gaming industry is moving towards an average annual revenue of $1 billion.

 

Currently, the revenue of the Turkish mobile game market is showing a continuous upward trend. Take November 2021 as an example. The total revenue of mobile games on both Google Play and App Store in Turkey was 2.5 times that of the same period in 2020, which is equivalent to the total revenue of Brazil and Chile. However, the revenue of Southeast Asia and Latin America, which are popular in the traditional mobile game market, is not as good as that of Turkey. The revenue growth in the past two years was only 50.5% and 27.6%, respectively, which is enough to show Turkey’s potential as an opportunity market.

However, a major difficulty in publishing games in Turkey is localization. The vast majority of Turkish players speak Turkish. However, Turkish is not as widely spoken as English. Currently, there are very few schools in China that offer Turkish language courses. Therefore, once you choose to enter the Turkish market, a major problem is a large and heavy localization problem.

 

Speaking of the localization of Turkish games, the first thing to understand is the preferences of Turkish players and the historical background of Turkey. In terms of best-selling, FPS/TPS and SLG are the main types of games that Turkish players pay for. At the same time, SLG is also the main source of payment in the entire Middle East market. Among the games that have gone overseas to Turkey, products from domestic manufacturers such as PUBG MOBILE, Pasha Fencer, Game of Sultans, Mobile Legends: Bang Bang, and Rise of Kingdoms: Lost Crusade account for 30%.

 

For the localization of the Turkish market, language is only the first step. In addition to text, what games need more is to break down cultural, religious, and humanistic barriers. For example, Game of Sultans and The Great Ottoman, although these two games are not mainstream in terms of themes, they are indeed refined products that deeply cultivate the Turkish market. The games’ restoration of the historical background and cultural details of the Ottoman Empire in Turkey has made them widely popular in the Turkish market.

Therefore, the premise of localization is not only basic language, but more importantly, to find the cultural “base”. In addition to pan-culture, for historical themes such as the Ottoman Empire, after receiving good feedback in Turkey, it can also be extended to surrounding areas with similar cultural groups, such as the Middle East. However, it should be noted that religious elements should still be considered when localizing Turkish products. The mainstream religion in Turkey is Islam. Although most Turks belong to the more moderate Sunni sect, it is still necessary to be more cautious about some taboos of Muslims, and avoid the appearance of pigs and other religious elements.

5. Conclusion

It is impossible to localize a multilingual game without a localization team that has fully mastered it. It is very important to translate the expressions in localized games into the target language with the same enthusiasm and sincerity. Therefore, translating games requires constantly summarizing game terminology and learning new terminology knowledge, rather than relying solely on a comprehensive dictionary.

entry.title: Emotional Experiences Brought by NPC Interaction in RPG Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

A survey in the book “How Games Move Us: Emotion by Design” pointed out that when asked “What moments in games make you want to cry?”, the vast majority of players answered that it was when facing the death of an NPC who fought alongside the player. As an object of emotional projection for players in the game, NPCs are one of the main sources of emotional experience for players in the game. The interaction between NPCs and players is particularly important in story-focused RPG games. So how do NPCs bring players a profound and three-dimensional emotional experience through interaction with players in RPG games?

1. Credible NPCs - Meeting Player Expectations

First of all, the appearance of NPCs in the game needs to meet the player’s expectations. If the behavior of the NPC and the interaction with the player are in line with the player’s expectations of the character’s inner and psychology, the NPC is credible. Such an NPC gives a lifelike feeling, even if the player knows that the facts are not so. Credibility must be consistent with the player’s expectations in order to create a high-quality, credible NPC. These expectations can be divided into three levels from the perspective of psychology: physics, biology, and psychology.

From a physics perspective, players expect animated and non-animated objects to follow what physicists call “naive physics”, which involves our everyday understanding of how the physical world works. For example, the movement of NPCs has a trajectory and does not appear out of thin air; NPCs are affected by factors such as weight and inertia, and will collide with each other rather than penetrate each other, and so on. These most basic rules that conform to the operation of objects in the physical world need to meet the original expectations of players. The magical creatures that resemble jellyfish in Sky: Children of the Light line up in the air to form a path that helps players move forward; the NPC Robin in Harry Potter: Magic Awakened, although walking around the library at will, will immediately turn around when the player touches her. These all conform to the basic rules of the physical world.

 

Magical Creatures Paving the Way for Players in “Sky: Children of the Light”

 

NPC Robin in “Harry Potter: Magic Awakened”

From a biological point of view, the real creatures that appear in the game world bring us a lot of “original” expectations. When players interact with other creatures, whether they are new creatures created in the game or portrayals of real creatures, our “original” expectations will evaluate these creatures. Psychologists call the results of these expectations “naive biology”. In the production of game NPC creatures, it should conform to people’s most basic expectations of the biological system. For example, in Cyberpunk 2077, the interaction with pets, the feedback behaviors generated by players in the process of interacting with pets are based on the reactions of real creatures after being stroked and patted.

 

Lizard in Cyberpunk 2077

Psychological expectations are called “theory of mind”, which refers to the “naive theory” that everyone has to understand each other. However, it is very difficult to make all artificial characters in the game pass the Turing test. In order to meet the players’ naive expectations for artificial characters, game social interaction can respond accordingly. Starting from GTA, the game has a corresponding feedback design for NPCs to players. For example, when players enter a new scene, enter someone’s field of vision, or do something that attracts their attention, players can get corresponding feedback, such as the attention, greetings, complaints, and abuse of passers-by NPCs. In this way, the player’s game experience in this scene will be more vivid and interesting.

 

Interaction between Players and Passers-by NPCs in “GTA 5”

The NPC behavior in Red Dead Redemption 2 is even richer. When a player walks into a room, the NPCs in the space will lock their eyes on the player, and even actively interact and talk with the player. The reactions of NPCs of different characters will also be different, such as the attention of guests, people standing waving to the player, greetings from the bar waiter, etc. These all realistically simulate the scene where people suddenly break into a space in life and attract the attention of passers-by, so the player’s emotional experience will be better.

 

《Red Dead Redemption 2》

2. NPC Character Background - Promoting the Story

Unique and Individual Characters

NPCs are like friends in the game world. They have different personalities, introverted or extroverted, stubborn or open, stingy or friendly. Personalized and distinctive NPC shaping can bring players a vivid game experience and make the game world come alive.

Cassandra in the mobile game Harry Potter: Magic Awakened will say in a slightly contemptuous and mocking tone: “You’re dressed just right for you—ordinary enough”, making players want to change into new clothes. Cassandra’s spicy and arrogant princess-like character makes people instantly think of the difficult classmates they would meet in school.

 

Cassandra from Harry Potter: Magic Awakened

Or Xia Yan in the mobile game Revelation. Players will get Xia Yan’s help when they first enter the game. As an NPC, Xia Yan witnessed the player’s growth in the game. She always looks at you with a smile and tells you what the next step of the task is in the gentlest tone, like a caring older sister of the player in the world of Revelation. Players always think of good things happening when they see her, and there is a sense of intimacy. NPCs like this with unique personalities can bring players a more three-dimensional game experience, as if they are in a parallel world, and NPCs are the people we can also meet in this world.

 

 

Novice Guide NPC Xia Yan in Mobile Game “Revelation”

The Depth of “Evil”

In RPG games that pay more attention to the story, the emotional interaction between villain NPCs and players is often more deeply rooted in people’s hearts. The “evil” of villains often stems from the tragic stories behind the NPCs, allowing players to understand their “evil” and create emotional connections with the NPCs. Arthas in Warcraft, the human prince with a superior background, pulled out the cursed sword under the lure of the dreadlord Mal’Ganis in order to defend his homeland. Under the impact of strong revenge, he gradually moved towards darkness and became a death knight who believed in darkness. Finally, he was killed under the attack of several coalition forces. Arthas is a tragic villain in ancient Greece and one of the most classic villain NPCs.

 

Arthas Menethil

Connection with the Player’s Subconscious

What kind of characters do players want to punish in the game? The materialized monsters in the player’s subconscious, the most typical are the zombie NPCs in shooting games. They are villain NPCs that disrupt world peace and disrupt players’ task plans. In terms of appearance, they are monsters that look like humans, so in the player’s subconscious, killing zombies will have the same sense of accomplishment as “killing” real players, but at the same time, there is no guilt like “killing” real players. The Wujian Abyss mode of Naraka: Bladepoint is a typical case. In this mode, players become heroes who fall into the Wujian Abyss, and they “kill” the zombies in the chaotic abyss, bringing players a lot of pleasure.

 

Naraka: Bladepoint’s Wujian Abyss Mode

3. NPC AI Design - Creating a Real Experience

Interacting with Players and Assisting Players in Completing Tasks

The most common function of NPCs is to help players complete tasks and act as players’ partners, friends, and even teachers in the game. Fighting side-by-side with players is the most direct way to generate emotional experience with players. For example, Pu Songling in A Chinese Ghost Story Online serves as the player’s “guide” throughout the novice guidance process of the game, playing a great role in helping players quickly participate in the game and promoting the development of the story.

 

Pu Songling in “A Chinese Ghost Story Online”

NPCs that Interact with the Scene

In order to create a more realistic game experience for players, the interaction between NPCs and elements in the scene also needs to be perfect. Even if it does not directly interact with the player, the self-interaction of NPCs with the scene can create a more vivid game environment for the player, so that the player will not feel bored and lonely even in a single-player game. In The Sims, after the player chooses to interact with an NPC, the NPC will form its own actions according to the scene. For example, sit down on a nearby chair or lie down on the bed.

 

The Sims 4

Have Their Own Goals

Arthas in Warcraft, as a big villain, made sacrifices to protect his homeland, and embarked on the dark path after being devoured by the soul. In the game, an NPC with a mission is more dynamic and real than an NPC that simply guides players to complete tasks.

 

4. NPC Behavior - Strengthening Emotional Experience

Protection

“Sense of responsibility” is an emotional experience that other traditional media cannot bring to the audience except for games. When the choice is given to the player, a sense of responsibility arises. Because the game background and game mechanics are easy to create a sense of heroism, the protective relationship is a relationship between the player’s avatar and the NPC that often appears in the game.

A very famous example is the game ICO, which uses a simple mechanism of holding the girl’s hand by pressing R1 to play the game. The girl can help the player cooperate to open doors and so on in some aspects. The girl is also very fragile, so much so that the player is very worried about losing her. Holding her hand means that the player is with the girl, and no matter what the situation, the player can protect the girl from harm. Through the extremely simple mechanism of “holding hands”, all the emotions and warmth in the game are created. This kind of emotion and healing do not need words and plot pictures to express. Through the interaction between the player and the NPC, the player forms a profound emotional experience.

 

ICO Player Interacting with the Girl

Cooperation

In recent years, games in which players and NPCs are dominated by cooperative relationships are also increasing. This cooperative interaction can usually be promoted through the game plot, thereby strengthening the player’s emotional experience. Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons tells the story of two brothers who embark on an adventure to save their seriously ill father. Both brothers are controlled by one player. They cross obstacles, meet allies, save people and save themselves along the way. The NPC giant in the game is very powerful and looks fierce, much like the big BOSS in the game. But the giant always wears a crying expression when he appears, because the giant has lost his wife and expects the protagonist brothers to help him rescue his wife. To this end, the giant and the two brothers reach a cooperation. The giant provides a lot of help to the player during the adventure, such as using his arms to build a bridge for the protagonist brothers, and the two brothers played by the player help the giant rescue his wife.

 

The Giant in “Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons”

Competition

As a special NPC in the game, the enemy and the competitive relationship formed by interacting with the player can also trigger the player’s emotional experience after being designed. In A Chinese Ghost Story Online, through the promotion of plot tasks, the game helps players deeply understand the events that happened in the village and the love story told in the game background, allowing players to accept challenges and defeat one NPC after another. In this process, players not only have a high sense of participation, but also cultivate a stronger role for themselves and obtain rich equipment, thus bringing players a high emotional experience.

 

Story Quest: Long Wumu in “A Chinese Ghost Story Online”

 

Story Quest: Nie Xiaoqian in “A Chinese Ghost Story Online”

5. Summary

The term NPC reveals that they mostly appear in narrative games. As the objects of players’ emotional projection, they are the key to narrative games to tell good stories and improve players’ emotional experience. For example, in RPG games, the relationship between NPCs and players is presented through dialogue or narration, and the word “relationship” is often the key word for emotional experience related to NPCs. Through the three perspectives of biology, physics, and psychology, credible and high-quality NPC characters that meet players’ expectations can be established; at the same time, shaping the complete personality and background of NPCs can allow NPCs to interact with players and scenes in the game and witness the growth process of players; finally, taking the behavior of NPCs as the outlet for players to strengthen their emotional experience, establishing relationships such as “protection”, “cooperation”, and “competition” in the process of tasks, creating diverse and profound emotional experiences for players in the game.

entry.title: Immortality or Change? The Dilemma and Breakthrough of French Localization
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

On May 30, 2022, the French government officially announced a major reform of the expression and use of video game terminology, stipulating the prohibition of English game terminology and requiring state public officials to take the lead in using pure French game terminology in their work to protect the purity of the French language.

The French Ministry of Culture stated that, given that the French e-sports field has been occupied by English, causing “understanding barriers” for non-gamers in France, banning English game terms will help facilitate the daily communication of the French people. In fact, French people or those who understand the development of French language and culture may already be indifferent, because the French official circles have taken many similar actions in the name of “French purity” in recent years, but the results have always been minimal. Behind such policies, it is not entirely the will of the French government, and the participation of the famous Académie française and the “Immortals” is indispensable.

1. The Immortals and Generation Z

Government intervention in the use of language is not an uncommon event: since the birth of French, France has used the power of the state and government to intervene in the use of standard language for hundreds of years. The Académie française is the oldest and most prestigious academic authority in France, composed of 40 academicians, who are appointed for life and are called “Immortals”. The main task of the Académie française is to standardize the French language and protect various arts. The “Immortals” work to maintain the clarity and purity of French in development and change. They not only compile dictionaries, but also achieve this goal by making suggestions and participating in various committees.

(The people in formal dress in the picture are academicians of the Académie française, i.e. “Immortals”)

In 1975, France passed the “Act on Maintaining the Purity of French”, stipulating that the use of explicitly prohibited English words would be fined. In 1994, the “Law on the Use of French” was passed, prohibiting the use of foreign languages in public advertisements and radio and television programs (except for foreign language programs), and violators would be heavily fined. At the same time, the law also stipulates that all new French words must be explained and approved by the Académie française and published in the official gazette before they can be used.

Comparison of English and French terminology proposed by the authorities

Nevertheless, the power of English has conquered cities and territories in countries around the world along with the development trend of the macro economy, and France, as a cultural power, has not been spared: in February 2022, the Académie française stated that French is undergoing “degeneration”. The reason is that the use of English words has become a habit among young people of Generation Z in France. This generation is deeply influenced by the Internet, instant messaging, mobile phones, computers and other technological products, and the community relations and values brought about by technological development have deeply affected their self-identity.

While American technology and entertainment companies are leading the global trend, they have also subtly introduced the core pronouns of their respective fields into the languages of different countries. This kind of invasion first made the French directly copy English, such as “hashtag”, “cloud computing”, “big data” and other words, which are already commonly used words in the daily expression of the French people. Then, the French were forced to graft flowers and trees, and speak English in a French way, such as “bugger / buguer”, is the reader familiar? Add a French suffix to the English word “bug” and English becomes French. Finally, there is another type of English word, which belongs to “blossoming inside the wall and fragrant outside the wall”. For the “Customiser” used by many French network platforms, everyone must be familiar with it - a variant of the English word “Customize”, but in fact, many French people themselves may not be clear that this English word originated from the Old French word “Custume”.

2. Why Does the French Government Go to Great Lengths?

Behind all relevant news is a huge industrial chain - the cultural and creative industries have long become one of the important pillar industries of the French national economy, and the French government has played a vital role in the development of the digital publishing industry and the e-sports industry. Taking the direct income of the French cultural and creative industry in 2013 as an example, compared horizontally with other major production areas in France, the turnover of the cultural and creative industry has exceeded that of the automobile industry (60.4 billion euros) and the luxury goods industry (52.5 billion euros), approaching the communications industry (66.2 billion euros) and the chemical industry (68.7 billion euros). In other words, the cultural and creative industries play an important role in enhancing France’s international competitiveness and influence. The results of the “France Macroeconomic Imbalance Report” of the European Commission released in 2014 showed that video games have the most amazing high growth rate (72%) among all French cultural industries. From a consumption perspective, the cultural consumption habits of the French have undergone tremendous changes: the average daily time spent on the Internet, watching TV, listening to music, playing games, going to theaters, reading newspapers and other cultural and entertainment activities is about 9 hours.

In 2021, the total sales of the French video game market reached 5.6 billion euros, an increase of 1.6% compared with 2020. SELL, the French organization that provides the market annual report, that is, Le Syndicat des Éditeurs de Logiciels de Loisirs (created in 1995 and composed of giant companies specializing in publishing in the field of video games), pointed out that the number of French video games has increased by 13.5% in the past two years, and 2020 was also a record year for the French market.

In 2021, the combined sales of PC and console games were 24 million units, and the sales of accessories for these two platforms increased by 11%, reaching 480 million euros. During these years, the French market was still dominated by digital sales, and 82% of software sales were digital sales through PCs, consoles, and mobile devices.

From the data in 2021, PC game sales showed an upward trend, increasing by 5% year-on-year, reaching 1.4 billion euros, while console and mobile games increased by 1% and decreased by 1% respectively, and the development momentum remained relatively stable. In 2021, the console accounted for 49% of the total French market, with sales of 2.7 billion euros, the highest level since 2008. In the same year, more than 2.37 million consoles were sold in the entire French market, and the potential of the French console game market cannot be ignored. Among them, whether it is the console game market or the PC game market, action games occupy a dominant position in the French market.

Today, the French video game market has moved from niche to mainstream. The French government promulgated the “Loi pour une République numérique” (Digital Republic Law) in 2016, officially recognizing the independent status of e-sports and its practitioners, and constantly planning relevant regulations to ensure the rapid and steady development of the French e-sports industry. After Paris successfully won the right to host the 2024 Olympic Games, the French Olympic Organizing Committee stated that it was considering including e-sports in the Olympic Games.

3. French Localization from AAA Games

It is better to say that the French government is mending the fence after the sheep are lost, than meddling in other’s affairs – a sense of crisis is driving the government, so it has to maintain its market in the form of decrees. The source of this crisis is English. In the trend of economic globalization, English is no longer an ordinary language, but a convention, a carrier, and a component of market value. French has been affected at all levels.

Passive and Active

In video games, the word “matching” frequently used in most multiplayer games does not have a perfect substitute in French, and can only be borrowed from English “Matchmaking” (as shown below) - not because of the lack of ability of localization staff, even the games under Ubisoft (a long-established French game company) use this method.

So, how to deal with proper nouns that have accurate French alternatives? As shown in the figure below, “FRIEND PASS” refers to a pass function. If one of your friends has purchased the game, the other party can invite you to play the game for an unlimited time. “FRIEND PASS” is literally translated as “friend pass”, and accurate alternative expressions can be found in French, but the Ubisoft localization team still uses a purely English expression. In fact, it is not difficult for us to speculate that in terms of this commercially related term, the localization team chose to tap the market value first. Here, as an important component of promoting market value, English has stronger universality than French, that is, this localization processing method can facilitate players’ understanding to the greatest extent, thereby promoting consumer behavior.

Ubisoft’s AAA masterpiece “Ghost Recon Breakpoint” released in 2019 game matching interface

Ouroboros Paradox

The French localization of Naraka: Bladepoint is also affected by the entanglement between English and French. For example, for the description of a hero’s skill in Naraka: Bladepoint.

Chinese: “迦南的绝学” (Jia Nan’s ultimate skill)

English: “Matari’s unique ultimate”

French: “Ultime unique de Matari”

Without understanding French grammar and composition, it is easy for everyone to see that French actually achieves a “perfect” correspondence with English in form, but the word order is different. In fact, French players have feedback that “(French word unique) would make people think that Canaan has only one unique skill.” (The hero actually has three optional skills). That is, excessive reference to English text, or excessive procedural mechanical correspondence, ignoring the specific effect of French localization transplantation, will cause certain confusion to players.

So, where is the root of such problems? We still have to trace back to the language evolution of French and English. The English word unique comes from the French unique, and the French word comes from the Latin unicus. This situation is very common between the two languages. Now, a confusing thing has happened: for market and procedural considerations, French localization must refer to English content, but English is derived from French and other European languages at the source. Among them, small differences will inevitably have a huge impact. Therefore, French localization needs to be more cautious, starting from the player experience at all levels, obtaining real feedback from French players in a timely manner, and constantly testing the actual effect of localization.

4. Conclusion

According to the French government, “streamer” should be changed to “joueur-animateur en direct”; “E-sports” should be changed to “jeu vidéo de compétition” - we don’t need to fully understand these languages to clearly see that this is advocating that the French people make their lives more “complicated”. The expansion of English influence and radiation in the world is not news, but its specific effect on the development trend of specific languages is worthy of our in-depth analysis. The changes brought about by this cultural interaction not only herald difficulties, but also symbolize breakthroughs - whether French can be rejuvenated and re-lead the direction of cultural output while actively and passively integrating with English is still worthy of our attention. Only by grasping the latest trends and changes can the results of localization attract players to the greatest extent and develop the potential of the local market.

Leihuo UX’s mission is to help Leihuo game products achieve commercial and reputational success through our work, and to promote the innovation of the game industry’s research and development process through our practices. For the global localization department, not only must the work of this department reach the industry-leading level, but also in-depth research on players and markets in related fields must be carried out. Only in this way can we make a greater contribution to the realization of the vision of Leihuo UX!
