In fact, we can also classify players according to their in-game level, school and other game-related data after the questionnaire is collected, to understand the situation of players of different levels/schools filling out the questionnaire.

4. Common Indicators in Cross-Analysis

There are two common indicators in cross-analysis: row/column percentage and TGI index.

Row/Column Percentage

Still taking the cross-analysis of “gender × satisfaction” as an example:

Very Dissat. Relatively Dissat. Neutral Relatively Sat. Very Satisfied
Male 15 25 25 20 10
Female 0 0 5 45 55

Row percentage refers to the number of samples crossed by two variables / the number of samples in the corresponding row, which reflects the difference in data on the column variable based on the row variable as the main variable (the difference in satisfaction between men and women in the example).

Very Dissat. Relatively Dissat. Neutral Relatively Sat. Very Satisfied
Male 15.8% 26.3% 26.3% 21.1% 10.5%
Female 0.0% 0.0% 4.8% 42.9% 52.4%

Column percentage refers to the number of samples crossed by two variables / the number of samples in the corresponding column, which reflects the difference in data on the row variable based on the different column variables (the difference in gender of players with different satisfaction levels in the example).

Very Dissat. Relatively Dissat. Neutral Relatively Sat. Very Satisfied
Male 100.0% 100.0% 83.3% 30.8% 15.4%
Female 0.0% 0.0% 16.7% 69.2% 84.6%

When analyzing and calculating, choosing row percentage or column percentage mainly depends on whether the indicator has practical significance. In the crossing of some variables, both row/column percentages have certain explanatory significance, but in the crossing of some variables, only one indicator is meaningful. As in the above case, the row percentage indicator reflects the difference in player satisfaction under gender differences, while the column percentage indicator has no practical significance.

TGI Index

TGI stands for Target Group Index, which reflects the strength/weakness of the target group within a specific range. TGI = the proportion of the target group with a certain characteristic / the proportion of the total population with the same characteristic * 100%.

When TGI = 100%, it indicates that there is no difference between a certain characteristic group and the overall population;

When TGI > 100%, it indicates that the group characteristics are stronger than the overall performance, and increase with the increase of the number;

When TGI < 100%, it indicates that the group characteristics are weaker than the overall performance.

Taking the cross-analysis of “gender × media channel” as an example, the questionnaire asks players which platform they use more often, a short video platform or a live broadcast platform, and the results are as follows:

 

At this time, whether from the overall perspective or from the perspective of gender, players use the short video platform more often. Is this all the information we can get? The TGI results provide another piece of information:

Gender Short Video Platform TGI Live Broadcast Platform TGI
Male 86% 143%
Female 113% 62%

Take 86% as an example, it is obtained by dividing 60% of male players choosing the short video platform by 70% of overall players choosing the short video platform. The TGI index tells us that, relative to the overall population, male players use live broadcast platforms more often, and female players use short video platforms more often. The TGI index reflects the preference of a certain group relative to the overall population, which provides another piece of information.

5. Summary

In fact, there are many scenarios where we can use cross-analysis in the analysis process. Many people know what cross-analysis is, but don’t know how to use it in specific scenarios, especially in game data analysis. Therefore, after briefly introducing cross-analysis, this article uses “Simpson’s Paradox” to intuitively demonstrate the significance of cross-analysis, and then summarizes the commonly used player classification methods for cross-analysis in game user research, and finally introduces the practical indicators of cross-analysis.

In addition to cross-analysis, there are many other ways to analyze questionnaires. In analyzing questionnaires, not only being limited to statistics of questionnaire question results can make the questionnaire play a greater role.

entry.title: The Historic Moment When India's Population Surpassed China! An Exploration of the Indian Gaming Market!
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Recently, India’s population exceeded 1.415 billion, surpassing China’s census figure of 1.412 billion (2021 census), making it the most populous country in the world.

India’s total land area is about 2.97 million square kilometers, only 30% of China’s. It is quite remarkable how India has achieved great economic growth in recent years, supporting a population of over 1.4 billion on its land. Fortunately, India has vast arable land, which it has developed into a world-class agricultural power. With the gradually developing economic conditions, the Indian people’s demand for entertainment and culture is becoming increasingly apparent.

Economic development has led to the rapid spread of communications and mobile terminals in the country. In the first quarter of 2021, smartphone shipments in India increased by 23% to reach 38 million units; the overall smartphone penetration rate was 36.7%, with a user base of at least 502 million people. Although high-end models have not yet become mainstream, the Indian smartphone market has witnessed tremendous development in the past 5-6 years, one manifestation of which is that the RAM of mobile phones has increased at least 5 times compared with before, making the overall operating speed much faster.

 

Figure: Changes in the proportion of TOP smartphone manufacturers in India

Thanks to the rapid development of the smartphone industry and the low-cost system of 4G networks and data plans, many mobile phone users naturally began to come into contact with mobile games and become mobile game players. This article will mainly analyze the rapidly developing Indian game market in recent years from three aspects: the overall market, game players, and industry trends.

1. Overall Market

“Fast Speed, Large Space”

According to a report on the Indian investment industry released by BCG and Sequoia Capital, in 2019 and 2020, the total Indian game market experienced a compound annual growth rate of at least 37% and 39%, and maintained a very good upward momentum. Its growth rate exceeded most of India’s media and culture sub-sectors, such as social media, video, and so on.

 

Figure: Analysis of Sub-modules of the Indian Entertainment Industry

We know that China surpassed the United States in 2020 to become the world’s largest game market. China and the United States have also occupied more than 40% of the global game market for many years. In India, according to 2020 data, the total revenue of the country’s game market accounted for only about 1% of the global market, and there is still huge room for growth. Especially in mobile games, the revenue of the Indian mobile game market exceeded 1.5 billion US dollars in 2020. Combined with its compound annual growth rate of at least 30%, this number is expected to exceed 5 billion US dollars by 2025.

 

Figure: Comparison of Game Markets in China, the United States, and India

If we turn our attention to the perspective of game commercialization, we can find that the Indian mobile game market is still in a very preliminary stage of development. Take PUBG Mobile as an example. The game’s downloads in the Indian market account for more than 25% of the global data, but the total revenue only accounts for less than 5%. It seems that the overall growth space is huge. Why? High downloads, increased smartphone penetration, and advancements in terminal device performance all indicate that there are many Indians who can play games and who will play games, but they are still in the initial stage in terms of commercialization. By conducting more in-depth analysis of the Indian player group and doing more localization in terms of gameplay and art design, I believe there will be more opportunities waiting to be discovered. One piece of data also shows a clue, that is, from 2017 to 2020, at least 5-6 new mobile games will break into the TOP20 of the revenue list every year, which also means that the entire mobile game revenue TOP list is undergoing changes every year, and new opportunities and innovative categories are constantly emerging.

2. Player Situation

“Many Mobile Game Players, Complex Types”

As an emerging game market, the Indian game market has developed tremendously with the popularization of smartphones. However, this also brings a result, that is, in India, the revenue brought by the mobile game market may account for more than 90% of the entire Indian game market. This data is a very astonishing proportion compared to China and the United States. Even in China, where the PC game market is shrinking severely, the proportion of revenue from mobile games is 76%, and this data is even smaller in the US market. According to a survey, 90% of Indian game players also said that they prefer mobile games and are not inclined to PC and console games. This is a relatively obvious characteristic of Indian game players.

In addition, due to the continuous increase of players in the Indian game market, and the market in the country has experienced a leap-forward development, this has brought a very significant feature to the entire game industry. In China, whether it is game players or game developers, they start with simple and easy-to-use games, or games with relatively simple system structures, and gradually transition to the development and experience of more difficult and complex games. There is a very obvious learning curve in this. For the Indian game market and players, this learning curve is extremely steep. Since the rapid popularization of smartphones in the country in 2016, it has been accompanied by a large number of excellent and complex mobile games imported from abroad. Most players have been exposed to games with complex systems, diverse gameplay, and very high completion from the beginning.

Driven by the rapid development of the global mobile game industry in recent years, combined with the slower development speed of local Indian developers, the demand of game players in the country has gradually reached a point where it cannot be continuously met. More and more players are beginning to pursue more unique and novel games. This can also be seen from the fact that 5-6 games in the TOP20 revenue list change every year.

At the same time, more and more Indian players are gradually developing into players with strong social attributes. This part of the players accounts for about half of all players. They prefer to play games with their friends or family, and regard games as a way of socializing. This feature can also be seen relatively clearly among Chinese mobile game players. Especially when some team games become popular, the social attributes of these games become very powerful. The demand of the Indian game market and player groups is also developing in this direction.

Specifically, players in the Indian market can be divided into the following categories: Try-and-See, Immersed, Game Enjoyers, Social, Status Seekers, and Hedonistic.

 

Figure: Six Types of Players in the Indian Mobile Game Market

How to understand these player classifications in the Indian game market? Let’s take a look at the explanations:

(1) Try-and-See: These players like to use games to pass the boring time, and at the same time are very unwilling to miss various updates. The game types they prefer include casual games, board games and other light games, and they also have the shortest weekly game time.
(2) Immersed: These Indian players prefer games such as adventure games and casual games. They usually enjoy and immerse themselves in personal alone time. If they can play games during this time, they will be relatively satisfied.
(3) Game Enjoyers: These players enjoy several of their favorite games very much. These games are often mainly medium-to-heavy games, but their game time will not be too long.
(4) Social: Obviously, the characteristics of these players are prominent, that is, they will regard games as a social channel or means, and achieve the purpose of interacting with friends by playing games. So they basically don’t play games alone, but team up with friends, whether friends are online or offline.
(5) Status Seekers: Because gambling games are allowed in India, these players are relatively special. They are keen to achieve the purpose of making money in the game.
(6) Hedonistic: Most of these players are heavy game lovers. They will invest a lot of time every week, and often team up with online friends to play.

3. Investment Trends and Company Analysis

“A Lot of Financing, Funds are Coming”

BCG data shows that there were only 25 game developers in the Indian market in 2010, and by 2020, this number has achieved more than 10 times growth, with the number of game developers reaching more than 275. Some well-known European and American game manufacturers, including EA, Ubisoft, Zynga, etc., established branches in India in the early years, which also helped the Indian game development industry make significant progress to a certain extent. At the same time, many foreign game companies choose to publish games in India, which also indirectly promotes the prosperity of the Indian game development industry.

 

Figure: Changes in the Number of Developers in the Indian Game Industry

On the other hand, many investment companies or the strategic departments of game giants have already taken a fancy to the Indian game market and have carried out a large number of investment and financing businesses in the market in the past 2-3 years. Data shows that from August 2020 to January 2021, in less than half a year, investment from all over the world in the Indian game industry reached 544 million US dollars.

The above is some analysis of the current situation of the Indian game market. We will also continue to track and analyze emerging markets including India, Brazil, the Middle East and other regions. Stay tuned!

entry.title: How do Japanese Text-Based Mystery Games Create an Immersive World of Deduction?
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Many fans of mystery games are fascinated by the worlds of deduction created by Japanese text-based mystery games. This article mainly introduces how Japanese text-based mystery games use the element of “closed circle” to create a satisfying world of deduction for players.

Japanese mystery adventure games are a game genre with regional cultural characteristics. Although relatively niche, they have many excellent works. From doujin circles to large game companies, from Kamaitachi no Yoru to Umineko When They Cry and The House in Fata Morgana, Japanese text-based mystery games attract players from all over the world with their unique charm. Emphasizing atmosphere creation, character development, and a compelling storyline are the essence of Japanese text-based mystery adventure games. The key to adventure games lies in player engagement and experience. Pure text games often lack interactive elements, making it difficult for players to immerse themselves in the game. In order to give players an immersive gaming experience, Japanese text-based mystery games pay more attention to atmosphere creation to enhance the player’s sense of immersion and involvement. Therefore, this article will summarize a common technique used in Japanese text-based mystery games to create atmosphere and analyze how this type of text game uses the “closed circle” element to enable players to participate in the plot and successfully empathize.

1. Background Setting

The “Closed Circle” Trope (aka And Then There Were None, or “Locked-Room Mystery)

The most common setting in Japanese indie text-based mystery games is the “Closed Circle” setting (also known as the “isolated island” setting), a concept that first appeared in Agatha Christie’s novel And Then There Were None. Because the story of And Then There Were None takes place on an isolated island, the “Closed Circle” setting is also known as the “isolated island” setting. This setting was re-created and reached its peak in Japan. Nowadays, many Japanese indie AVG games reflect the setting of “Closed Circle”. A “Closed Circle” is an isolated predicament caused by natural or man-made factors, in which all the characters are gathered in a relatively closed environment and cannot temporarily contact the outside world. In an environment where everyone cannot leave, bizarre incidents of people being killed one after another occur, and the murderer is hidden among these people. In text-based mystery games, players often need to play the role of an investigator, searching for clues and making deductions while the number of survivors decreases.

2. Practical Application

Japanese Mystery Games Umineko When They Cry & Return to Shironagasu Island

Umineko When They Cry is an indie text-based mystery game produced by the Japanese doujin circle 07th Expansion. The game has typical “Closed Circle” elements such as “an isolated island in a storm” and “a mansion”. (The following text is partly from the game’s website story introduction) The game story takes place on a small island called Rokkenjima. This is the location of the Ushiromiya family, a wealthy family. Every year on the first weekend of October, family members go to the island to attend a family meeting. On October 4, 1986, the family head Kinzo Ushiromiya was seriously ill, and the meeting was temporarily hosted by his eldest son Krauss. The other children were arguing over the division of the inheritance. Kinzo in the study completely disdained his vulture-like children and closed the door to concentrate on studying mysterious black magic. The grandchildren ignored the open and secret struggles between their parents and got along very harmoniously. There were also five servants in the house, three of whom were favored by the family head, and two of whom had met the family… Due to the typhoon, Rokkenjima became an isolated island cut off from the outside world. Two days later, when the typhoon subsided, the police boarded the island and saw only a horrific scene. Afterwards, someone found a letter hoping to solve the truth of the witch’s murder, making the incident a mystery that no one could solve for many years. What happened on the island during the two days when it was isolated from the world? Was it a witch’s murder or a human crime? As a suspenseful mystery work, Umineko When They Cry hopes that players will have fun in the process of reasoning. The player’s first goal is to solve the mystery of the “Closed Circle” murder on Rokkenjima and identify who the culprit is.

 

Rokkenjima, the island where the mansion in the game is located

 

The closed mansion on a stormy night where the family tragedy in the game occurred

The indie mystery game Return to Shironagasu Island, made by one person, also uses similar Closed Circle elements. The mansion “Ruisseau Sec” that the protagonist sneaks into to investigate is located on Shironagasu Island, where even the GPS positioning system fails. The game starts with a mysterious invitation to an unknown island, Shironagasu Island, in a wealthy man’s will. The protagonist of the game, Sen Ikeda, who owns a detective agency in New York, and a mysterious girl with supernatural powers, Neneko Izumozaki, board Shironagasu Island together. Many incredible things happened on Shironagasu Island, and the two also experienced multiple bizarre murders. What kind of mystery is hidden on the mysterious Shironagasu Island? The player-controlled protagonist needs to find various clues on the isolated island of Shironagasu, solve the puzzles, and then escape safely from this cursed island.

 

The story takes place on an isolated island

 

The location where the murder occurred is a fortress-like closed detached villa

3. Function

Instincts Under the Isolated Island Predicament

As an interactive medium, games have their own advantages in presenting the “Closed Circle” environment compared to novels or film and television works: players can play an important role in the scene and participate in the mystery-solving of the murder. In the “Closed Circle” setting, the characters in the closed space will be under the special pressure of “coexisting with unknown dangers” and “being isolated and helpless”. The trapped people in the game will start to panic, become anxious, distrust each other, and even gradually make various irrational behaviors. The protagonist controlled by the player will always be or temporarily be in a state of powerlessness.

Human survival instincts and fear of the unknown make players pay attention to the protagonist’s survival at all times - because they may encounter unknown dangers at any time. They don’t know what dangers lie ahead or what will happen next, and this coincides with the human psychology of innate fear of unknown things and survival instincts. In mystery games, players never know who the murderer is until the last moment. The setting of “the murderer is by my side in a closed space, but I can’t escape” can successfully awaken the player’s nervousness and fear, making the player feel as if they are experiencing it themselves, fearing the unknown.

Many “Closed Circle” games value the atmosphere of the entire game process more than the final ending of solving the case and finding out the true identity of the murderer. Usually, Japanese mystery games are set to have multiple endings, giving players more room for divergent thinking at the end. Many Japanese text-based mystery games also add innovative settings such as item discovery and use, countdowns, or reincarnation, parallel worlds, or superpowers to the Closed Circle setting, which makes closed-circle mystery-solving more interesting.

Because the “Closed Circle” setting has a good rendering effect on the game atmosphere, it has been increasingly used in domestic games of the same type in recent years. The Chinese indie game Misty Summer also uses the same technique, setting the murder in a mountaintop villa. The protagonist needs to spend 7 days in a mountaintop villa isolated from the outside world and find the truth of the story. Standing on the same starting line as the characters in the story, solving puzzles in a closed environment, and interacting while reading, “Closed Circle” games are often accompanied by cleverly designed “logic” and touching “plot”. Therefore, this type of game has become a paradise for reasoning enthusiasts.

 

The background setting of the Chinese mystery game Misty Summer uses the same background rendering method

4. User Experience

In Puzzles that Coexist with the Plot, “I” am the Protagonist

Many classic “isolated island survival” text-based mystery games have received rave reviews. Taking Return to Shironagasu Island as an example, there are a total of 1660 reviews on the Steam page, of which 1615 are positive, with a positive rate of up to 97.2%. Most players praised the “Closed Circle” setting, the interlocking plot, and the immersive experience in the game.

 

 

 

Some positive reviews of Return to Shironagasu Island on Steam

Classic Japanese text-based mystery games like Return to Shironagasu Island have a full story. From the beginning, development, climax, and end of the story, each part is naturally integrated and connected, with rich and appropriate character performances. No part is too thin, and no segment is too long. For text adventure mystery games, the requirements for operation are almost zero. On the basis of abandoning the original operational gameplay of the game, text adventure mystery games pay more attention to psychological interactive gameplay. Players become the protagonists of the novel, immersed in the complete game atmosphere, shedding tears for the death of friends in the game, and trembling with excitement for their avatar, the “protagonist”, finally escaping from the isolated island, as if they had experienced all this in reality. These feedbacks are a true reflection of the player’s emotional involvement. Many players will play through a good game multiple times, and each time they will have a different emotional experience. There is a saying circulating in this circle: “First playthrough, initial contact; second playthrough, watch the plot; third playthrough, dig into the details; fourth playthrough, all achievements; fifth, sixth, seventh, and eighth playthroughs, specifically for nostalgia.” This is the unique charm of text adventure mystery games that attracts players.

entry.title: The Survival Status of Out-of-Circle Players: Starting from the Popularity of 'Elden Ring'
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

“Elden Ring”, developed by FromSoftware, caused a craze at the beginning of this year. The influx of a large number of out-of-circle players has made the game’s player base complex and ambiguous. Can these players, who are not the target audience of “Elden Ring”, really stay in the game after experiencing it? If so, how did they stay? Out of the professional habit of a user researcher, the author has come into deep contact with players to get a glimpse of the survival status of this group of out-of-circle players.

1. The Out-of-Circle “Elden Ring”

On February 25, 2022, the gaming community experienced a carnival. The name of this carnival was “Elden Ring”.

Winning the TGA’s Most Anticipated Game award for two consecutive years, the player test version before the official release, and the high media score of 97 all made this game the “white moonlight” in the hearts of many game players. The game’s performance after its launch also lived up to expectations. Despite encountering optimization problems, just a few days after its launch, the peak number of online players on Steam reached nearly 900,000, reaching the seventh highest peak in the history of Steam online player count, far exceeding its predecessors “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice” and “Dark Souls 3”.

 

As of 2022.3.7, comparison of the peak number of players in the Soul series games, data source: SteamDB

The extent to which “Elden Ring” has gone out of the circle is even greater than that of “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice” last time.

The term “out-of-circle” was originally used mostly in the entertainment industry, generally referring to a person or work breaking through its original small circle and being accepted and recognized by more people. Now, the “out-of-circle” of “Elden Ring” means the same thing - the original Soul series players often stayed within their own community, especially in the early years of “Demon’s Souls”, “Dark Souls 1”, and “Dark Souls 2”, where there were very few players. Even for the later best-selling “Dark Souls 3”, due to the ban on domestic live broadcast platforms, it was only a niche masterpiece in the eyes of passers-by. Against this background, Soul series players formed their own unique small circle and circle culture. However, this small circle has been gradually broken by live broadcasts and short videos in recent years. A large number of cloud players and new players converted from cloud players have poured in, making Soul series games gradually move to a larger stage. And “Elden Ring” is undoubtedly the center of attention.

There are many reasons for the “out-of-circle” of “Elden Ring”, including the game’s own design, long-term publicity and build-up, and the differentiation provided due to game homogeneity in the industry. We can also pay attention to the long-term, short-term, beneficial, and unfavorable impacts that this “out-of-circle” has brought to Elden Ring. However, out of the professional habit of user research, I am more curious about the new players brought about by the “out-of-circle” of “Elden Ring”. They have never been exposed to or at least have never played Soul series games themselves before, and their understanding of this type of game is largely limited to impressions such as “difficult”, “dark”, and “suffering”. Their reasons for buying the game may be to follow the trend, to try something new, or to be very confident in their own operational skills and want to challenge this so-called game that makes clumsy players quit.

In the following text, we may as well call these players “out-of-circle players” - although they are essentially new players, this time the new players have exceeded the normal player turnover rhythm of the game. A large number of casual players, MMO players, MOBA players and other types of players, and even players who may have never played games before, have poured into this party, making the entire game player group a mixed bag. It is difficult for us to truly understand what these players are like. Everyone’s reasons for joining the party are different, and players’ preferences often vary from person to person. However, we can always see some commonalities of these players from some cases. Coincidentally, I have several such out-of-circle players around me. From them, we may be able to see the current survival status of out-of-circle players in “Elden Ring”, making the fog surrounding the out-of-circle players a little clearer.

2. Case 1: The Clumsy “Spiderman” Ring

“Spiderman” (pseudonym) is my best friend.

The year before last, when I was fighting fiercely with Isshin Ashina in “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice”, “Spiderman” let me experience what it’s like to be a live streamer for the first time. He watched me almost all the way through “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice”, and I didn’t hesitate to share my real-time tactics and understanding of the game during the game - although these didn’t seem to have much effect. My experience sharing didn’t help him get started better. He was still flustered when facing the first BOSS. After being defeated by the BOSS several times without taking damage, he put down the controller helplessly and chose to complete the game via watching others play.

But in fact, I can totally understand “Spiderman”. As a 9-to-6 office worker in the online education industry, he has to prepare lesson plans and teaching plans when he goes to work, and after work and on weekends, he has to turn on the camera and diligently irrigate the flowers of the motherland. His free time is scarce and fragmented. He was even preparing lesson plans on New Year’s Eve: when we were joking in a WeChat video call, he was wearing pajamas, with messy hair like a bird’s nest, writing hard on the computer, as if he had just woken up. If it weren’t for Jia Ling’s voice on TV being too recognizable, I would have even thought it was still early morning.

Games are not a necessity for “Spiderman”, nor are they his only entertainment activity. They are more like a theme or direction for him to seek entertainment - he doesn’t necessarily have to play them himself. The gossip and memes of the professional player circle, the live broadcasts of major games, and the wonderful game clips on Douyin (TikTok) are what really attract him. He hasn’t played many games of LOL, but he can accurately name the skills and ultimate moves of each hero in each LPL game; he hasn’t played “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice” much, but he knows the skills of the BOSSes in “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice” like the back of his hand; he has fewer than 30 games in his own Steam library, and the total game time is less than 100 hours, but he seems to be a seasoned game master.

“Spiderman” is very clear about the reason why he can’t play games: “Poor reaction, can’t judge the moves. I can only run around, and the attack is inefficient, which is very frustrating.” He also tried to look at guides, but “it’s useless, there’s no way to cheese it.” But knowing is one thing, and he still enjoys buying some games that he can’t beat, such as “Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice”, “Monster Hunter”, and this time’s “Elden Ring”.

He seems to be confident in his gaming skills, as if he has forgotten his painful experience in Sekiro: “It’s an open world, you can leave the BOSS alone for now, and then go back to fight it after leveling up.”

“And if you can’t beat it, you can just refund it.”

Then, his words came true. From launch to refund, “Spiderman” spent a total of 0.8 hours.

 

“Spiderman”‘s recent play history, “Elden Ring” is forever stuck at 0.8 hours

When I asked “Spiderman” about the reason for pre-ordering “Elden Ring”, he replied to me in 0.1 seconds on WeChat:

“Following the trend.” Then he spent another 30 seconds giving the second reason: “The media reviews are very high.”

According to him, many of his colleagues and classmates around him have bought “Elden Ring”, but few of them have stayed. The difficulty of the game not only discouraged him, but also discouraged a large circle of friends around him.

What’s interesting is that even though he has been discouraged time and time again, “Spiderman” has not shown a strong aversion to Soulslike games. He has always had a considerable degree of goodwill towards the game, which comes from the game’s fragmented narrative, riddle-like plot, and bizarre worldview.

He bluntly stated that when the next Soulslike game comes out, he will still consider pre-ordering it–

“I always feel like I can do it. I bought ‘Sekiro’. I’m a collector, I don’t have to play it, but I have to have it.”

“Of course, it would be better if there was dynamic difficulty.”

I seemed to see the pure and simple smile of this northern man through the phone screen.

h2>3. Case 2: The Amazing “Captain Marvel”

Through “Spiderman”, I felt that I had figured out the survival status of this group of out-of-circle players, but the case from “Captain Marvel” (pseudonym) gave me some new insights into this group of players.

The “out-of-circle” effect of “Elden Ring” on “Captain Marvel” actually came from some very accidental factors. According to her, it mainly came from three aspects. The first is the overwhelming sharing of “Elden Ring” seen in her Moments, the second is the public opinion bombardment of high-scoring media (“I feel like I’m missing out if I don’t play it”), and the third is the game promotion pictures that she accidentally saw, which looked sunny, with beautiful scenery, and seemed like a paradise. If the first point represents following the trend and professional instinct (like me, “Captain Marvel” also belongs to the user experience department), the second point represents game quality and public opinion publicity, and the third point is a real personal preference - “I don’t really like the dark style of Dark Souls. This time, the promotional pictures of ‘Elden Ring’ are not so dark. The overworld looks quite ‘sunny’.”

But “luring them in” is one thing, whether they can play it or not is another. After all, in my impression, “Captain Marvel” is not a fan of Soulslike games. The game she played the most before was actually an MMO game. According to my observations, I can reasonably believe that the label “action game klutz” is very suitable for her.

And her real gaming experience did prove this.

“After being abused in ‘Elden Ring’ for a day, I quit the game and realized how beautiful the world is.” This was her first-day evaluation of “Elden Ring”.

During the first day, she didn’t dare to fight the BOSS at all, just ran around to open up the map. After opening 8 maps, she was still carrying the novice’s broken shield and broken sword. Finally, she looked at related videos and guides online and decided to give up her current class and choose the more powerful and easy-to-use mage class. These series of operations, which are incomprehensible to veteran Soulslike players, very realistically reflect the game path of out-of-circle players represented by her in the game.

Just when I thought this was another sad story of discouragement, the situation seemed to be a little different.

After restarting the game as a mage, her game path became smooth again. With the help of guides, she not only successfully walked out of the novice dungeon, but also defeated one or two small BOSSes, and temporarily survived safely in this game.

“Captain Marvel”‘s “retention” in “Elden Ring” is largely due to her own “alternative” pursuits and playstyles in the game. When she played “The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild” before, she was obsessed with opening up the map everywhere, unlocking shrines one by one according to the guides (but not completing the shrines), and then heading to the next shrine. In “Naraka: Bladepoint”, she rarely plays ranked matches. She has no interest in practicing her skills, but she is very fond of costumes and character customization. This “alternative” is reflected in “Elden Ring” as: she doesn’t like to challenge difficult BOSSes like ordinary players, but prefers to collect strange equipment, weapons and spells. “Elden Bling”, indeed.

With the expectation of these contents, “Captain Marvel” has, to a certain extent, overcome those uncomfortable experiences (the gloomy dungeons, the instant-killing small monsters), and has become a retained player of “Elden Ring”.

h2>4. Some Thoughts on Out-of-Circle and Out-of-Circle Players

“Seeing a falling leaf, one knows autumn is coming; seeing a leopard’s spot, one can see the whole leopard.”

There are actually many cases like “Spiderman” and “Captain Marvel”, but most of them are not around me, so I can only get a glimpse of the survival status of these players from the bits and pieces on the Internet.

“Following the trend” is often the main reason why these players choose to try the game. It’s just that the specific forms may be different for different players. “Spiderman” comes from daily communication with classmates and colleagues, while “Captain Marvel” comes from the “unpaid promotion” of social platforms. We can also imagine that some players come from QQ groups or WeChat groups of other games. For example, a certain “Naraka: Bladepoint” player suddenly pops up in his small group: I’m stuck on a BOSS, is there any other Elden Ring player who can help me?

The “out-of-circle” of Elden Ring is also due to the game’s good publicity and promotion on another level. Some of these promotions are deliberately done by the publisher or developer, such as the game’s early trials, cooperation with the famous fantasy writer George R.R. Martin, epic promotional CGs, etc., while others come from the praise of the media and players, which is a chain reaction brought about by the quality of the game. The high score of 97 is rare in recent years, and there is a feeling of “you’ll miss out if you don’t play it, you have to try it even if you just want to taste it”. Finally, the viral spread of live broadcasts and short videos has also well reached these non-game players who may not usually pay attention to game information. Some obvious evidence is that some of my friends who never play games and only watch Douyin (TikTok) occasionally ask me what kind of game this is.

From the cases of “Spiderman” and “Captain Marvel”, we can actually see another clue that made them “out-of-circle”, that is, the game itself is releasing some signals to welcome new players. Concerns about difficulty are dispelled by the setting of leveling up, the brighter and more open overworld provides a buffer for some “claustrophobic” players, the open world design also attracts more players who like to explore, and the cooperation with George R.R. Martin has also attracted a group of fans of Western fantasy plots to a certain extent.

Behind Elden Ring’s strong fan-drawing speed, we also have to admit that a large part of out-of-circle players are like my “Spiderman” friend, who found a game that is not suitable for them in the blind trend. Judging from the completion rate of Steam achievements, most players haven’t even met the novice BOSS in the game before choosing to end it hastily.

 

Steam “Elden Ring” global achievement completion rate, one-third of players did not pass the first BOSS

The retention of out-of-circle players is always an epic problem facing out-of-circle games. Because it involves two issues at the same time, one is the question of “whether there is”, and the other is the question of “whether it is enough”.

We cannot expect all players to be the target audience of the game, and after trying the game, they will be pleasantly surprised to find that this game is exactly what they want, and become addicted to it. Those out-of-circle players who have successfully stayed are more like “Captain Marvel”, who have found their own unique preferences and goals in the game, regardless of whether these goals are the core highlights of the game. The existence of these goals and preferences allows them to accept to a certain extent, or actively seek some ways to overcome the negative experiences brought about by the game. The existence or absence of a goal is the question of “whether there is”.

Player retention is often a process of game between the game’s attraction points and pain points for them. Whether the attraction point is strong enough is the question of “whether it is enough”. “Spiderman”‘s departure was because he couldn’t solve the problem of being clumsy, and the attraction of the worldview and plot to him was diluted by short videos and live broadcasts; “Captain Marvel” chose to stay because her goals in the game were strong enough (“Elden Bling”), and she also found a good way to solve the difficulty problem (looking at guides). The departure and stay of every player are all like this.

From this point of view, if you want to keep my “Spiderman” friend, you may really need to wait until the day when the game has dynamic difficulty, or the short video platform disappears overnight. It’s just that I don’t think this day will ever come.

entry.title: Are Voice Actors All Monsters? Unveiling the Voice Acting of *Naraka: Bladepoint*
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

Games can immerse us in another world, providing completely different experiences and adding more entertainment to our original work and life. With the rapid development of the game market, players’ requirements for game quality are getting higher and higher, and they have increasingly higher standards in terms of plot, graphics, sound, and sense of immersion. This article will explore the importance of game voice acting and how to enhance the player’s game experience through good voice acting.

1. The Importance of Localized Voice Acting in Games

When you open a game, the most attractive things are the graphics, the character voices, and the feel of the controls. When players interact deeply with the game content using the characters in the game, the graphics and voice acting can instantly bring the players into the game world. Sound is the most perceptible element besides the graphics. As an important factor to enhance the player’s sense of immersion, game voice acting can shape the character’s personality in a variety of ways, while giving the character unique marks and emotional expressions, enhancing the fullness of the game character and the on-site experience.

In 2021, the multiplayer competitive game Naraka: Bladepoint, produced by NetEase’s 24 Entertainment, reached a peak of 121,513 online players on the first day of its global public beta on Steam. So far, global sales have exceeded 10 million copies, and it is sought after and loved by many players at home and abroad. Analyzing the reasons for the success of Naraka: Bladepoint overseas, it can be seen that the game features that attract players and localization that meets the national conditions of various countries are indispensable. Among them, localized voice acting and lip-sync matching can provide players with a stronger sense of immersion and engagement.

 

2. Why is Japanese Voice Acting Popular with Players?

Players around the world generally accept Japanese voice acting more than other languages. Why is this?

First of all, Japan has a large number of anime works, which makes its voice actor market relatively mature and standardized, and the whole process service is relatively complete and convenient. The level of Japanese voice actors is often the quality benchmark of the industry. Even if you don’t understand the language, you can still perceive all the subtle expressions, such as emotion, rhythm, and tone. With actions, even if you don’t understand Japanese dialogue, you still won’t be affected by understanding, so many players like to listen to Japanese voice acting even if they don’t understand Japanese.

Secondly, there are a large number of target groups around the world who like two-dimensional games, and they generally have a high acceptance of Japanese. I believe that most players who like to play two-dimensional style games are familiar with Japanese two-dimensional culture, and have a lot of contact with Japanese anime and games. Therefore, sometimes they are more accustomed to listening to Japanese voice acting than their native language.

In addition, some players also have their favorite Japanese voice actors. These Japanese voice actors can be promoted as highlights of the game, and can also increase the popularity of the game, which is a win-win for game manufacturers.

Here is a story about the voice acting of a very popular hero in Naraka: Bladepoint.

Before the launch of the new hero Wuchen, Japanese players on social media accounts such as Twitter had very high calls for Hanae Natsuki. For netizens who are familiar with the two-dimensional field, they must have heard of the name of this popular voice actor. For example, the protagonist of the popular anime Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba, Kamado Tanjiro, and many other characters are voiced by him. Therefore, considering the high matching degree between Hanae and Wuchen, and in order to meet the needs of players to the greatest extent, the official decided to invite Hanae Natsuki to voice the role of Wuchen.

Whether it is the outstanding character design or the powerful ultimate skills, Wuchen has a very high appeal, and the discussion among Chinese and foreign players is good. On this basis, Wuchen’s voice is very outstanding, making this character widely welcomed by players, especially in the Japanese server, so that many domestic players want to transfer to the Japanese server to play.

 

Coincidentally, Hanae Natsuki himself is a well-known fan of Naraka: Bladepoint. He has broadcast live games with his friend Ono Kensho many times, and there are many netizens watching on the external network. He has also used his love to promote the game for free many times. Before Hanae was invited by the official, his other voice actor friend Ishikawa Kaito successfully got the Japanese voice acting of the hero Yueshan in Naraka: Bladepoint. Hanae Natsuki also started the “comment mode” with great interest during the live broadcast, and expressed that he was very envious and hoped that he could have the opportunity.

When we invited him, he happened to be busy with the voice acting of other anime at that time, but as soon as he heard that it was the game Naraka: Bladepoint, he immediately said that even if he had to work overtime on his days off, he would be Wuchen’s voice actor. In fact, it was not only him who was happy about the success of this cooperation, but the fans were also very happy, because Hanae Natsuki’s voice acting was indeed very exciting, and he perfectly interpreted Wuchen’s style. Many Japanese players said that they started to play the game because of Hanae’s voice acting. There are also many domestic netizens who are begging the official to add a voice adjustment function in the game.

 

3. Why is the Voice Acting of Excellent Games Excellent?

First of all, the voice acting of mature games has a very complete voice acting process, from script localization and polishing, voice actor selection (on-site casting), voice actor appointment schedule, inviting directors, planning and localization teams to observe and supervise online, to audio QA, etc., there are very strict quality controls.

 

The excellent voice acting is very strict when selecting voice actors, because good voice acting quality control can make players feel that the game is more fun. When choosing voice actors, many game companies will hire celebrities to do the voice acting, but can celebrity voice acting really improve the sense of immersion and game quality?

In fact, when we choose voice actors, the most important thing is not necessarily the popularity of the voice actor, but the fit between the character style and the voice actor. Does the voice actor’s voice and timbre match the character’s personality? Can it well reflect the character’s personality traits? In the game Naraka: Bladepoint, there are more than 10 heroes on the stage, and the age, personality and image of each character are completely different. The personalities of these heroes need to be embodied through appearance and sound. Therefore, when conducting localized voice acting, we pay the most attention to the degree of adaptation. If on this basis, the voice actor has both the characteristics of large traffic and explosive points, and can cooperate with marketing and publicity activities, that is the most perfect.

So what is the actual selection process like? The voice actors of the main game characters of Naraka: Bladepoint are selected through the script of the characters actually appearing in the game. When casting, two or more voice actors are allowed to voice the same role, and then the voice actor who best fits the role is selected. Compared with casting from an existing voice actor resource pool, this method may require relatively more time and cost. The voice actors of Naraka: Bladepoint have up to 3 interviews for each game character. When choosing voice actors, not only should we pay attention to the voice actor’s intonation, timbre, voice line, and acting style, but also consider the treatment of the ending of the word under the background of that era. For example, when doing Japanese voice acting, if it is a samurai’s line, the words will be adjusted according to the background of the time, and some ancient expressions will be used to reflect the era at that time, and at the same time, the ending of the speech will be adjusted to fit the world view. Similar processing is also required for Korean voice acting.

 

Japanese voice actor for Naraka: Bladepoint hero Takeda Nobutada: Tomokazu Sugita

During the epidemic, because we could not supervise the studio on-site, we adopted a remote meeting that could share sound and script at the same time for online observation. During voice acting, we will invite colleagues from the planning, audio, and localization teams to check together. Very ideal results were achieved through systematic preparation beforehand. Although colleagues from the planning and audio groups may not understand the foreign language, they can give guidance on the character’s voice and timbre. Before recording, colleagues from the localization team will discuss the controversial content in the translated script, and sometimes they will work hard to find more natural and appropriate expressions. At the recording site, the localization colleagues will also control the voice actor’s interpretation of the lines, as well as the matching degree of the voice recording with the environment, character design, and line atmosphere, so as to improve the expressiveness of each word and each line.

 

After the audio recording is completed, there is one last step, which is the quality test (QA) of the audio. QA testers are the final quality controllers before the game works are presented to players. Our QA is responsible for identifying all critical issues, such as compliance, audio errors, CERO regulations (applicable to Japan) issues, and any issues related to the culture of the overseas region, to ensure that the launched product is free of any risks.

4. Precautions for Voice Acting and Processing in Naraka: Bladepoint

Game voice acting is a professional project in which voice actors use their voices and words to portray and create various vivid character images with distinct personalities in front of the microphone. In this process, it is necessary to have an in-depth understanding of voice acting work and skills, and to create good works and improve the quality of voice acting in accordance with the artistic laws of voice acting work.

What is Breathiness and How to Deal with It

Friends who are new to voice acting usually unconsciously ignore “breathiness”. They always think that voice acting mainly matches the dialogue, staring with wide eyes to find the lip shape, and dare not miss a single sentence or word. As a result, they do not notice the breath sound naturally produced by the actor when speaking. Sometimes, although the dialogue dubbed by the voice actor is very accurate, because the breath sound is lost, the dialogue sounds unnatural, and even feels stiff. Even if you already feel that you are very involved in the emotion, you still can’t feel the due atmosphere and tone. Some actors even like to speak with stuttering movements or breathy voices because of their personal performance habits, which makes the dubbing inaccurate.

In fact, “breath sound” is a very important part of voice acting. All the necessary breath sounds must be present, but none of the unnecessary breath sounds should be present.

How should we deal with “unnecessary breath sounds”?

First of all, when dubbing the dialogue, if the voice actor cannot use the “dantian” and only pronounces in the way of speaking normally, it is not only difficult to accurately match the mouth, but also easy to produce the sound of their own breathing, which is a noise and is to be NG.

Secondly, in the recording studio, you must always keep quiet and slow breathing, otherwise the sensitive microphone will pick up the sound of breathing like a bellows, which is naturally not allowed.

Finally, the breath sounds made in cooperation with the actor’s actions, such as chasing and running, carrying heavy objects, fighting, getting angry, etc., must clearly show the distance, time, space and other conditions on the screen, and more importantly, match the lip shape. Too much is also an “unnecessary breath sound”.

As an extremely critical part of voice acting, the rhythm of breath stop and continuation, length, strength, and tightness can all express the psychological rhythm of the character. In addition, “sound is produced when breath moves”, so “sound” is inseparable from breathing. The breathing matched with different words in different states is not the same, but there is no doubt that breath is a necessary condition for voice acting. Slight changes in mouth shape, breath sound resonance position, certain changes and control of the vocal cords and throat, and adjustment of tone, timbre and voice quality can all produce a voice different from your own. Coupled with the imitation of language style, it is not difficult to create a voice completely different from your own and become a new character role.

Voice acting needs to do a good job in the three aspects of emotion, voice, and breath, namely “emotion, voice, and breath”. Breath moves with emotion, and sound comes out with emotion. Breath is born from emotion and melts into sound. Voice actors should use their voices to interpret and interpret the characters, giving them souls and vitality; they should also convey information and communicate emotions with listeners. Therefore, in order to better convey emotions and ideas, voice actors need to have emotional color in their language. The perfect combination and flexible use of “emotion, voice, and breath” can improve the unity of freedom and controllability of voice acting, and present the spiritual connotation of the work itself to the greatest extent.

Misunderstandings Caused by the McGurk Effect

The ears and eyes are our windows to observe the world. The ears “hear” things, and the eyes “see” things. They seem to be working independently and unconnected, but in fact they are connected. But many people don’t know that hearing and vision can also interfere with each other.

In the 1970s, in order to explore whether vision affects people’s speech perception, that is, whether vision affects hearing, psychologists Harry McGurk and John MacDonald of the University of Surrey in the United Kingdom did such an experiment: They found some adults to watch a video, in which the person’s lips made the sound of “ga”, but the dubbed sound was “ba”. As a result, 98% of the subjects said they heard the sound of “da”. This is caused by the mismatch between dubbing and lip shape. More precisely, it is due to the combined effect of vision and hearing, creating a third sound that does not exist - the “da” sound, which is the McGurk effect. What if it’s the other way around? The person in the video makes the sound of “ba” with their lips, but it is dubbed with “ga”. As a result, about 54% of the subjects heard “gabga” or “bagba”, and the McGurk effect is also obvious.

 

The McGurk effect shows that when the information received by vision and the information received by hearing are inconsistent, the intervention of visual information will affect the expression of auditory information, causing people to hear the wrong third sound.

How does Naraka: Bladepoint eliminate the McGurk effect through AI?

In Naraka: Bladepoint, in order to eliminate the McGurk effect, we adjust the character’s lip shape through AI to make it consistent with the character’s lines. So how do we do it?

This is achieved by integrating AI technology to simplify complexity, based on algorithm automatic generation, successfully simplifying the original time-consuming and labor-intensive problem into content that can be perfectly output in a few days. This greatly saves labor costs and time costs, making the impossible possible. In addition to automatic adaptation, there is also a multi-language audio inspection function, which uses machines to ensure the accuracy of lip shapes. In addition, the lip-sync prediction controller data and batch replacement of lip-sync animation further improve the speed of outputting adapted lip-sync. This technology has been applied to multiple language versions of Naraka: Bladepoint and will continue to be applied to other overseas games.

5. Summary

Allowing players around the world to find happiness in the games they develop may be the dream of every game producer. With the improvement of global distribution channels and the maturity of technology, more and more games choose to be released globally. In the process of global distribution, game localization voice acting has become a very critical link. In order to allow players from different cultural backgrounds and different languages to understand the game well, voice acting needs to be as close as possible to the character positioning, lip movements, and story background in the game, with the intention of providing a more immersive game experience for global players.

entry.title: Avatar Design from the Perspective of Game Social Interaction
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

With the rise of the metaverse, concepts such as virtual avatars and virtual social interaction have also become popular terms. In fact, avatars and virtual social interaction are not new concepts in games.

The word “avatar” comes from Sanskrit and means “a god appearing on earth in physical form.” In games, players are the “gods” who control the fate of their characters.

Thanks to the innate emotional talent of human beings, we can always easily “project” our physical and psychological conditions onto other things. The construction and identification of avatars in games are often a mapping of players’ self-awareness or desires. This strong personal characteristic is the basis for establishing social interactions and attracting others. Conversely, social interaction stems from players’ needs for emotion and belonging, and is an external manifestation of players’ higher-level psychological needs. Therefore, this mapping relationship will also have corresponding requirements for the design of the avatar. This article will explore the design possibilities of virtual avatars from the perspective of players’ psychological needs.

1. The Origin of Social Interaction: Self-Empowerment and Avatar Identification

Game social interaction stems from players’ pursuit of a sense of identity and belonging. In order to meet this demand, the primary task is to enhance players’ empowerment and identification with their avatars.

  • Self-empowerment: Believing that you have the power to control your own life.

  • Avatar identification: A psychological phenomenon in which an individual’s self-perception changes temporarily during the process of using and experiencing a game avatar, and the emotional and cognitive connection with the avatar is strengthened.

Ideal Avatar: Giving Players the Freedom of Character Customization

“An ideal avatar carries the player’s aesthetics, taste, and personal pursuits.”

Similar to social interaction in our real lives, our first impression of a person is often based on their physical characteristics, such as height, weight, skin color, hairstyle, etc., and then we further understand their identity, occupation, interests, and other aspects.

In games, how can players have the same emotional experience with virtual character images as in real social interactions, as opposed to ordinary NPCs? Sufficient identity recognition is essential. When the player’s identity characteristics are fully recognized, the player’s social window is truly opened. For example, the most basic: name, gender, identity, skills, dynamics, social relationship information, and so on.

 

Diagram: Four types of information for avatar construction and mapping

As shown in the figure above, we can divide the information that players give to virtual characters into four categories. Among them, basic information, characteristic information, and image design often give players the freedom to design themselves, encouraging players to create identity characteristics, and allowing players to gradually establish familiarity and ownership of the avatar.

In MMO games such as Revelation Mobile, the first thing players perceive is the character creation system, which allows players to immediately immerse themselves in character design.

 

Diagram: Revelation Mobile character creation interface

Character customization is also a major gameplay element, but not all players have proficient character customization skills. Many games, in order to allow players to experience more fun in character customization, will refine the operation of character customization, enrich the styles of different face shapes and makeup, and ensure that the characters created by players can satisfy themselves. Naraka: Bladepoint has hundreds of character customization materials, allowing players to create their favorite styles and shapes as they wish. Some players even have great ideas and create many funny images.

 

*Diagram: 《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Character Display.

 

Diagram: 《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Character Customization System

In addition, in the process of image design, surrounding elements such as environment and props can also be used to present personal interests and tastes, which not only enhances the personal attributes of the player’s character, but also provides a basis for the extensibility of design and the sustainability of social interaction in the game.

 

*Diagram: 《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Character Display Surrounding Elements.

 

Diagram: 《Revelation Mobile》 Character Display Surrounding Elements

Blank Avatar: Giving Players the Freedom of Character Imagination

“Simple images make it easy for players to project their identities.”

Unlike ideal avatars, blank avatars prefer relatively symbolic characters. American cartoonist Scott McCloud put forward an interesting point in his book “Understanding Comics”: the fewer details a character has, the more likely the reader is to project himself into that character. When players combine a symbolic character with a meticulously described world, they can generate a strong sense of immersion.

In Sky: Children of the Light, the player’s avatar often appears in a minimalist form. The game enhances the player’s sense of immersion through the design of the environment and sound. The blank space of imagination and the atmosphere rendering of the environment—this strong contrast enhances the player’s self-empowerment and identification with the avatar, ignoring the difference between the “avatar character” and themselves.

 

Diagram: Game “Sky: Children of the Light”

2. The Process of Social Interaction: Self-Presentation and Group Identification

Frontstage Self-Presentation

“Frontstage” refers to the part of an individual’s performance that regularly defines the situation for the observer in a general and fixed way. The frontstage is where the avatar is concentrated, and it is the self-presentation where self-characteristics match character characteristics.

Players can present themselves through interactive designs in the game, enrich the character characteristics of the avatar, and attract the attention and recognition of other players.

Avatar Interaction Design

  • Daily interaction: Give the avatar character traits.

The interactive design and script design of the avatar itself, such as sound, dialogue, and actions, are important elements that help players achieve self-presentation during group interactions. In addition, real-time interactions such as text, likes, comments, voice, emoticons, and gifts can help players enrich their own character settings during social interactions, and enhance the fun and richness of social interactions.

The chat system of Revelation Mobile is similar to social software in real life. Players can use personalized chat methods and display their personality in real time through text, emoticons, voice and other chat tools, making the personality image of the avatar more vivid and three-dimensional. In addition, designs such as colored text and text shortcuts in the game make this chat tool more playable.

 

  • Interest interaction: Show personal hobbies and specialties

In Revelation Mobile, the player’s voice and various music-based gameplays are distinctive features that run throughout the game. This kind of interest interaction fully demonstrates the player’s self-characteristics and integrates personal characteristics into the role, and also provides the possibility of expanding social scenarios. For example, the tea room is designed based on the players’ common interest in music. In addition to exploring the love of music, traditional culture, painting hobbies, etc. can also be integrated into the game to strengthen the interactive design of the avatar.

 

Diagram: Music social interaction in “Revelation Mobile”

  • Action interaction: Cultivate avatar behavior habits

Encouraging players to use the avatar’s actions to develop behavioral habits is also an important factor in the interaction between players. In Final Fantasy XIV, there are many tasks that require players to use emotional actions on NPCs, such as encouraging, comforting, and touching NPCs. This process will continue to strengthen the player’s positive emotions. Since there are many such tasks, players will naturally get used to putting commonly used emotional actions on the shortcut bar. In this way, the threshold for interacting with other players is also very low. After everyone finishes the dungeon and meets acquaintances in the wild, they will easily make a gesture to say hello, which is much more convenient than typing in the chat box.

 

Diagram: Task interface of “Final Fantasy XIV”

  • Emotional interaction: Enhance the emotional characteristics of the avatar

In Sky: Children of the Light, players help each other to present themselves step by step through cognition and emotional progression, and gradually deepen their connection with each other. For example, by lighting the candles of other players’ avatars, they will change from small gray people to a state with a special decoration—this is the first step in interacting with people; further, players can also give nicknames to other players to deepen their memory of each other, and so on.

 

Diagram: Avatar images in different social states in “Sky: Children of the Light”

Group Interaction and Group Identification

Group identification is the process of classifying people or things, emphasizing common destiny, common goals, common emotions, and the interdependence of group members. The construction of group identification is mainly completed in the process of intra-group and inter-group interactions.

The essence of game social interaction is to achieve the goal of group interaction and group identification through joint participation. In games, ultra-temporal connections provide a situational basis for players to participate together, without considering the distance of reality. Players generate emotions due to their common love, making members naturally form a psychological feeling of “being together” or “being one of us”. Group interaction and group identification require effective social scenarios, and different social scenarios and experiences will also have different requirements for the design of avatars.

  • Avatar identity design

In games, social scenarios are created for players through task design, challenge design, reward design, and intimate interaction design.

In these group gameplays, in order to facilitate group interaction, more member identity designs and corresponding character assignments are needed, and there should be differentiated gameplay when players join the group. This can be achieved through daily gameplay. When a player joins a group, the administrator should immediately set an identity for him and inform him of the corresponding tasks he needs to do immediately. In this way, differentiation can be expanded through subdivision, the player’s interest chain can be built, and a reasonable scene for social interaction can be created. Games such as Identity V, Werewolf, and LARP (Live Action Role Playing) fully mobilize the players’ subjective initiative with such character identity settings. In some battle scenarios, the matching methods of top lane, middle lane, bottom lane, jungle, and support also strengthen the players’ interest chain and promote the division of labor and cooperation among players.

 

Diagram: Character profiles in “Identity V”

  • Avatar relationship setting

The interpersonal pattern of closeness and distance is called the “differential order pattern”. Like ripples spreading on the water surface, it extends from oneself, circle by circle, and divides closeness and distance according to the distance, as shown in the figure below.

 

In the group interaction of the game, the relationship setting between avatars can expand more social scenarios. For example, the common relationship settings such as master and apprentice, husband and wife, and gang can trigger different gameplays. Through this relationship setting and gameplay design, players are stimulated to communicate and collaborate with strangers, creating emotional bonds. Players can experience the ambiguity and warmth with the opposite sex in the game, and the communication and cooperation between teams or other groups, so as to achieve the social goals of group interaction and group identification. The gameplay of companionship, bonding, marriage, master-apprentice, grudge, and sect in Revelation applies this relationship setting method.

 

Diagram: Master-apprentice list in “Revelation Mobile”

  • Avatar display design

Putting personal business cards (equipment, titles, achievements, battle records, clearance progress, collection progress, etc.) in the display system is conducive to gaining the attention and recognition of others, satisfying the players’ desire to show off, and plays an important role in the establishment of social relationships. Designs such as likes, sending flowers, worship, and the display of top-ranked player models can not only increase the display effect, but also enhance the interaction between players.

Both Naraka: Bladepoint and Revelation have leaderboard display designs, which can increase users’ group attention and help and encourage users to obtain group identification. In Revelation, when players team up, they can also click on the character card to view detailed information and perform dynamic interactions such as “send gifts” and “step on”. Obtaining the attention of other players through the avatar display system is also one of the ways to gain a sense of identity.

 

*Diagram: Leaderboard display of players in “Naraka: Bladepoint”.

 

*Diagram: Personal display when players team up in “Revelation Mobile”.

 

Diagram: Dynamic display of players in “Revelation Mobile”

3. Inspiration from the Metaverse for Avatar Design

The popular metaverse social interaction not only has the shadow of virtual social interaction, but also has the characteristics of physical social interaction. It uses technologies such as AR, VR, and XR to build a holographic virtual reality platform. The interaction between us and our friends is no longer just simple voice, text, pictures, and videos. We can also go shopping, watch concerts, and play games together. Everyone does not have to worry about time and space, but enjoy an immersive experience.

With the metaverse empowering the game industry, the terminal devices that carry games will also be iterated, and the game industry may enter an era of wearable devices with VR/AR and other technologies as the core. The concept of the metaverse has spawned a large number of VR/AR technology implementations. Users can enter virtual reality scenes by wearing VR helmets, AR glasses and other devices to achieve an immersive experience.

The high picture quality and strong physical interaction of VR scenes give more space for the design of virtual avatars. The 3Dization of the image, the smoothness of the action, the closer correspondence between the avatar and the real world, and even the multiple experiences of vision, hearing, and touch have more possibilities.

In addition, the creation of virtual identities allows players to be deeply bonded with the game through digital assets, helping the game achieve breakthroughs in user retention. Matthew Ball, former head of strategy at Amazon Studios, said that identity, as one of the eight characteristics of the metaverse, can be regarded as an evolved version of the online identity in current games, and can represent players in a more creative and realistic way through avatars and other methods. In the metaverse game world, the importance of in-game identity and customization options is increasingly prominent. Players will have permanent digital identities and personalized virtual images. Through social activities in the game with virtual identities, they can obtain matching digital assets or custom assets, such as virtual land, houses, works of art, and pets, to achieve an immersive experience similar to the real world.

The self-expression of virtual identity is not only the continuous expansion of personalized images. With the rise of the emerging concept of self-sovereign identity (SSI), people will interact in the digital world with the same freedom and trust capabilities as in the real world. The avatar is no longer just a mapping of self-awareness, but is more likely to become one of the roles in real life.

entry.title: Is Falling in Love with Paper People Just a Daydream The Immersive Experience of Dating Sims
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

With the expansion of the female gaming market, female-oriented dating sims have also become a battleground for major manufacturers. However, judging from the data, although there are many newly launched female-oriented dating mobile games, their market performance has declined very quickly. Taking five female-oriented mobile games of the two-dimensional and mixed styles launched in 2021 as an example, compared with the first month’s revenue, the revenue in March 2022 decreased by an average of 85%. It can be seen that not all games have truly touched female players. To provide players with an immersive dating experience and break through the homogenization of the category, it is inseparable from the research on the psychology of female players in dating games.

1. The Psychological Mechanism Behind the Immersive Experience

The main reason why dating games are so popular with players is that they create a highly immersive virtual world for players, where players are psychologically satisfied and unconsciously bring their fantasies and emotions from real life into the virtual game.

Ideal Self

In reality, we always have some dissatisfaction with ourselves. Sometimes we wish we could be more charming and successfully pursue the person we like; sometimes we wish we could be braver and say no to a black-hearted boss. The game world gives us such an opportunity to become our ideal self: you can become a popular figure in school, or you can firmly engage in the career you love.

For example, in the dating game Starry☆Sky, released in Japan years ago, the heroine Tsukiko Yahisa is set as the only girl in the school and serves as the secretary of the student council, and is sought after by many people. This slightly “Mary Sue” setting, although very different from real life, satisfies the player’s fantasy to a certain extent: good looks, loved by those around her, and also has the beautiful qualities of bravery and independence.

 

Similar settings are also very common in domestic female-oriented dating games. In For All Time, the heroine is an excellent cartoonist who accidentally travels to the world of her own comics and adventures with familiar characters. During the game, the player obtains a new identity (cartoonist, etc.), and also develops a deeper understanding and identification with this identity as the story progresses.

 

From a psychological point of view, self-identity is formed by the interaction between the individual and the real world. However, in dating games, players can easily switch between real life and the virtual world to improve their self-identity. At the same time, the identity experience given to players by the virtual world is often far from the real self, but closer to the ideal self. Players can find a shadow of themselves in the game, and they long to be this character and accomplish many things that cannot be done in real life.
