Since the prospect of the sports game market is so promising and has been so stable for many years, why are there so few sports games that can stand out in China’s popular mobile game market?

1. What You See Is Not What You Think: Big Market, Few Products

The direction of users’ attention determines the preference of developers and publishers for theme selection. The audience of global major sports events is undoubtedly concentrated in football, and the NBA, as one of the most popular sports events, also has a large audience. When it comes to games, football and basketball games are also the two most numerous sports game categories. Unlike other forms of entertainment, sports are more likely to inspire people’s passion and even generate emotional attachment.

However, in China, compared with other game categories, there have always been relatively few sports games on the market. This is related to the characteristics of sports games themselves. Sports games such as FIFA, Pro Evolution Soccer, NBA 2K, and NBA LIVE all have very distinct labels: professional.

This is mainly reflected in two aspects: on the one hand, most of the fans of sports games are themselves fans or fans of the sport, and non-fans rarely get involved; on the other hand, sports games have a high threshold for research and development, such as physical collisions, operating feel, adaptation engines, player AI, etc., which also greatly increases the difficulty of research and development.

2. A Big Cake That No One Cares About?

Why is such a big cake, but the actual performance is not satisfactory?

Monotonous Gameplay, Serious Homogenization

Because sports games rely on sports events, their basic gameplay is nothing more than PVP (player-to-player) around the event, especially in mobile games, which is also the most acceptable mode for most players. However, monotonous gameplay will accelerate boredom, and PVP is not a permanent solution. Production teams often enrich the player experience by adding game modes. However, the harsh reality is that no matter what kind of attempt, it cannot solve the fundamental problem of the game. Most players will still choose the most basic PVP mode. Of course, there are also many players who will play against the computer on console sports games.

In addition, the emergence of highly homogeneous products is also a need for market competition. When a manufacturer launches a new model, other manufacturers will subsequently “copy” one. After all, they are games of the same category, and they cannot let competitors have something they don’t have, so the products on the market are developing in an increasingly similar direction. Under such circumstances, when the gameplay of sports games is too monotonous and the homogenization of sports games is strong, the potential of the entire sports game market will naturally be difficult to explode.

Loyal to the Project, Stick to the Operation

For sports game players, whether they are basketball fans or football fans, or fans of other sports, most of them continue to invest their energy in the game in order to continue the feeling of sweating on the field of their favorite sports, or to experience the operations that cannot be realized in real life in the game. In this way, even if our bodies are exhausted, we can still enjoy spiritual happiness. Therefore, sports players do not have a variety of types to choose from in terms of game selection like other players. They generally only play according to their sports hobbies. Even if new games appear, as long as they have nothing to do with their favorite projects, I am afraid they will not pay much attention to them.

In addition, for sports games that focus on operational confrontation, in order to reproduce the feel of the game on the real field through virtual programs and find a feeling of being on the scene, even if their operation methods are simplified, the operation difficulty is still higher than other competitive games, and it requires continuous improvement of self-operation to complete the game process to obtain a higher sense of accomplishment. Because there is a certain operational threshold, many mobile game players who are mainly casual will naturally not pay special attention to such games.

Prone to Imbalance

The key to the gameplay of sports games lies in operating skills. The importance of skills in such games is self-evident. Its design will not only affect novice players, but also affect the operating manufacturers.

If the gameplay skills of a video game become very important, this will lead to many players being unwilling to spend money to buy game props. Most players will have such an idea: “Anyway, I can defeat my opponent with my ability, why bother spending that money”.

In this case, ordinary props are no longer attractive. In order to strive for a better return on investment in the limited business model of sports competitive games, games may launch more props that enhance attributes; and over time, the amplitude of attribute enhancement will become larger and larger, but this is the beginning of a game losing its balance. When more and more players spend a lot of money to buy high-attribute props, it may cause a group of players who enjoy fair competition to leave the game, because on the premise of relatively close skills, the improvement of props to attributes is like an insurmountable gap, which creates a serious vicious circle: “Reduction in the number of players - Difficulties in the income of agents - Agents make money on attribute props - Game imbalance”. In the end, it will become the original sin of player churn.

3. What Do Players Want?

What kind of game do players who come from sports competitions need?

Looking at people who love sports, they have many things in common - love sports, pay attention to competitions, have a flamboyant personality, and trust teamwork. Therefore, if you want to capture the hearts of sports game users, you must start with professional needs, viewing needs, personality needs, and social needs.

Many players like to play the corresponding sports games of the projects they actually participate in in reality, because they want to replicate the feel of the hand/foot in reality, or experience some elements that cannot be realized in actual sports projects. Therefore, to a certain extent, reasonably moving reality to the virtual world is always the pursuit of developers and players. In addition, some sports enthusiasts may not have been gamers before. The low threshold for getting started with the game, while having both technology and operational depth, can play a key role in expanding the player base, especially for mobile gamers. Of course, for some products that may not pursue IP, cool and gorgeous operations are always one of the biggest selling points to attract players: I wasn’t aiming for the players in the first place. If the actions are still plain, how can I be attracted? After all, for most gamers, the operation is only temporary, but being handsome is a lifetime.

In today’s era of increasingly developed hardware equipment, games with high-quality sound and pictures often have richer expressiveness and stronger appeal, and creating a sense of presence and immersion is also an important part of the game’s ability to attract players. Especially for sports games, the viewing value of the picture and action is more important. Regardless of whether it is related to sports feelings, or to IP and classic events, even if the audience is relatively fixed, the game also needs to arouse topics and awaken players’ attention. Players also hope to experience games with higher popularity.

4. Opening Up a New Track?

Even the best wine is not afraid of a deep alley. In the face of the dilemma of the sports game market, the quality of the game alone is not enough to break the situation. For a sports game, good game quality can attract fans of this series, but to seek breakthroughs, more sports enthusiasts and even sports pan-entertainment users need to know and accept it.

Synchronous Operation with Physical Events

If you want to expand the coverage, how to promote it has become a difficult problem. It is necessary to find effective brand exposure methods to build momentum for the game before or during the corresponding sports events to attract fans’ attention.

Use promotion methods that are synchronized with the operation period of sports events, and use platform resources in many aspects, not limited to game platforms. This will help to spread the influence of the game itself, so that users of multiple platforms will continue to increase their favorability of the game. Sports games themselves, as a category with a potentially huge user base, everyone, regardless of gender, age, likes sports, loves sports, but how to subdivide and differentiate users of this magnitude, and operate them in a refined manner, is worth exploring.

Creation of eSports Event System

Create an event system, and then go out of the circle, so as to attract more fans to enter the game and increase player stickiness. For sports competitive games, on the basis of the current widespread e-sports alliance, we can try to build a complete sports game e-sports event system, while broadening the channels for public participation, and complete a larger scale of sinking and penetration; combined with community operation experience, promote “small community” type events in the game, making it easier for the public to participate in e-sports, and then introduce in-game events to offline communities.

For a sports game, the things that test people are definitely not just the above. In the final analysis, it is necessary to return to the game itself. How to design each stage of the game so that players do not have the fatigue of constantly repeating the season; how to set up players, how to let players play an unforgettable game, etc., these are also tricky. After all, the key to measuring an excellent sports game is to see whether it can narrow the distance between the game world and the real sports competition, and at the same time take into account the operability of the game, so that players can truly get an immersive and pleasant experience from the game.

entry.title: How to Build Playability Experience with Interaction in Complex Game Mechanics
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

As the game market develops, various games are constantly seeking new gameplay and game mechanics, striving to bring players novel and high-quality experiences. Game mechanics are like thousands of ways of arranging and combining various game elements, and they are gradually moving towards a more complex direction.

If a game is a process where players voluntarily overcome unnecessary obstacles, then how can we design interactions to make players willing to pay for these unnecessary obstacles instead of feeling bored? This article will elaborate on this in detail.

1. Starting with Game Mechanics

In Wikipedia, the description of game mechanics is as follows: In tabletop games and video games, game mechanics are constructs of rules or methods designed for interaction with the game state, thus providing gameplay. In other words, the mechanics of the game effectively regulate how the game will serve the person playing the game.

Therefore, this concept can perhaps be divided into two parts: “concrete mechanics” and “abstract mechanics.” The former represents the player’s actual operation when using the device, such as “pressing WASD on the keyboard respectively”; while the latter is the corresponding action of the virtual character in the game, such as “the game protagonist walks in various directions respectively..

 

《Just Dance 2》| Rasputin - Boney M. | Gameplay

When the similarity between concrete mechanics and abstract mechanics is high, players do not need to spend too much energy on the conversion mechanism between real operation and virtual feedback. For example, in the Just Dance series, the actions of the virtual characters are consistent with the player’s real actions, so players do not need to think about “what kind of actions do I need to perform to get a higher score?” They just need to imitate the characters in the game, so the playability of this game is high.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Longsword Advanced Aerial Combo

When the similarity between concrete mechanics and abstract mechanics is not high, the playability of the game decreases, but it also brings more room for operation. For example, in Naraka: Bladepoint, in order for the character to execute the appropriate combo, the player needs to press a series of buttons at the appropriate time nodes in order to realize the conversion of real actions to virtual character actions, which has higher requirements for the player’s various comprehensive operations. In this kind of more complex game mechanics, how to create high playability is a test that designers must face.

“Playing a game” is “voluntarily overcoming unnecessary obstacles.” — Bernard Suits, The Grasshopper: Games, Life and Utopia

As the game market continues to expand, the game’s mechanisms have also become more complex in permutation and combination. How to make players voluntarily accept these complex mechanisms in the game? This requires interaction design to communicate “concrete mechanics” and “abstract mechanics”, efficiently complete the interaction between players and the game, that is, the game will give feedback in time according to the player’s input, helping players make operations in the most friendly and effective way.

2. Interaction in Complex Game Mechanics

Naraka: Bladepoint, mentioned earlier, includes game mechanics such as scenes, teams, actions, confrontations, matching, and skills. Therefore, this section mainly uses the combat content of this game as an example to illustrate the role of interaction in complex mechanics.

Novice Tutorial: Auxiliary Explanation of Complex Mechanics

First of all, the most straightforward auxiliary explanation is the familiar “novice tutorial.” In games, it is very efficient and necessary to use the novice tutorial method for interaction with core or unfamiliar mechanics. In Naraka: Bladepoint, because its combat contains a lot of information, in addition to the common team and poison elements of battle royale games, it also contains many hero characteristics, souljades and other content.

Therefore, in the novice tutorial, the UI of the interface is unfolded in sequence. It can be seen that the initial interface of the novice tutorial only contains basic information, orientation, and map information that players are familiar with, while other content will appear with corresponding UI information as the tutorial unfolds. This is to allow players to gradually understand the game’s combat mechanics, and try to avoid players experiencing frustration and resistance when encountering too much complex information.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Normal Mode Combat Interface (Top) and Novice Tutorial Initial Interface (Bottom)

–

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Novice Tutorial, after guiding the player to pick up a weapon and introducing related content, the weapon-related UI in the lower right corner appears.

The novice tutorial of this game can be opened by yourself when selecting the mode on the homepage, providing a quick entry to the novice tutorial, which is also a common method for games with more complex mechanics. However, games with simpler mechanics are more likely to enter the tutorial directly when entering the game for the first time, and no tutorial entry will be provided after that. In addition, no matter whether the novice tutorial mechanism is simple or complex, it is generally necessary to provide players with a channel to “exit/skip” the tutorial immediately, such as pressing the Esc key at any time in the tutorial to return to the lobby.

Concretization of Abstract Mechanisms: Rationalizing the Logic of Creating Unnecessary Obstacles

The medium of player interaction in complex mechanics is almost still the keyboard and mouse or the controller, and the moves of the characters in the game in combat are very complex, so most of the abstract mechanics and concrete mechanics in combat are very dissimilar. To improve the playability experience of the game, interaction design can try to add concrete elements to abstract mechanisms to increase the similarity between abstract mechanisms and concrete mechanisms psychologically, so as to obtain a better immersive experience and playability experience.

For example, when using the grappling hook item in Naraka: Bladepoint, players and the keyboard/mouse/controller obviously cannot interact like the grappling hook and the character, but the aiming feedback that appears after pressing the “Q” key, and the fixed feedback of the rope flying out after clicking the mouse, all improve the player’s playability experience through the concrete UI.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 When using the grappling hook in the game, press “Q” and the aiming interaction feedback appears.

In addition, sometimes in order to increase the challenge of the game, the game will adopt the opposite abstract and concrete mechanisms. At this time, it is very important to let players feel the rationality of the interaction method in the interface. Because essentially, this is the player voluntarily giving up the means to quickly achieve the goal, and voluntarily accepting certain restrictions, choosing a “low-efficiency” way to participate in the game.

For example, in the segment of driving a wooden boat in It Takes Two, when the player controlling Cody sprays honey backwards, the effect of spraying to the left is that the wooden boat moves to the right. At this time, the direction of the player’s operation and the direction of the wooden boat are opposite, but in the interface, the form of Cody spraying honey at the tail as power allows the player to understand the logic of the opposite operation and voluntarily accept this setting that increases the difficulty. This is the same principle in its famous airplane flying segment.

 

Driving a wooden boat and an airplane in 《It Takes Two》

Efficient Arrangement of HUD Information: Facilitating Players to Voluntarily Be Bound by Mechanisms

The figure below shows the combat interface of Naraka: Bladepoint, which is also a very typical combat information layout in third-person games:

  • Highlight the central area of the screen, leaving enough vision for combat;
  • Various combat information is classified and integrated, distributed in appropriate positions around the screen.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Combat Interface Information Layout

Here, in the combat interface of Naraka: Bladepoint, the clotting salve, armor powder, and weapon box, which are also props, are displayed in different blocks, also out of consideration of content relevance, so that players can consider whether to use the weapon box to repair the weapon while paying attention to the weapon durability in the lower right corner, facilitating the player’s interaction process. In addition, there is a special key prompt block in this interface, and there are key icons at the skills, weapons, and map, also in order to make it easier for players to fight in complex mechanisms through efficient and reasonable interaction.

Complex game mechanics have limited the conditions for players to achieve game victory. The work of interaction design needs to facilitate players so that they can voluntarily accept these constraints and enjoy them. The classification and integration of information is very important here. Efficient information presentation enables players in the game to quickly retrieve the information they need on the screen.

 

Replacing Text with Images/Sounds: Serving the Player’s Efficient Information Acquisition Experience

In fact, the core of “replacing text with images/sounds” and “efficient arrangement of HUD information” is the same, that is, to achieve efficient information reading for players through the interactive interface and sound effects. Images are symbolic languages that are easier for people to process than text, and there are almost no localization differences; while the interaction of sound does not need to occupy additional vision in the interface.

Also taking the presentation of skill and prop information in Naraka: Bladepoint as an example. The UI of the ultimate skill CD is the icon of Viper Ning, and the surrounding circular progress bar and the Arabic numerals above quickly inform the player of the CD status. After the CD is completed, the outer glow effect and key prompts appear, and at the same time, it is matched with the in-game character voice prompt. The visual presentation part is efficient and cross-language, and the auditory part is efficient and extremely immediate. This interactive presentation is very efficient, and it also connects different states of the UI, thereby building a user experience that serves the player.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Viper Ning skill, grappling hook, and recovery item information presentation

Hidden Information: Reduce the Presence of Some UIs to Prevent Information Overload

Complex game mechanics are often accompanied by a more complex information processing process for players. For example, adding a “character” mechanism to ordinary battle royale game mechanics requires attention to the character characteristics of oneself and the opponent in the game; adding “skills” and “ranged/melee weapons” mechanisms is accompanied by the necessary presentation of skill and weapon information in the game. However, if too much information is presented in the interface, it is easy to make players daunting at the initial contact, or it is difficult to find the point where the line of sight needs to be focused in the game.

It can be seen that in the presentation of weapon-related information in Naraka: Bladepoint, the visual effect is weakened by increasing the transparency of weapons that are equipped but not in use, which can more intuitively display the selected state of the weapon, and also save valuable screen vision. Hiding information does not mean reducing information, but making hidden information display when needed. The same is true for pop-up windows and folded pages in various game interfaces. Players do not need to see it directly on the main interface, they just need to be able to open it smoothly and independently when needed.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Weapon-Related Information Presentation

When do you notice the presence of the UI during the game? - When the game UI is done very poorly.

The Last of Us Part II is almost a UI-less interface. Only a prompt or icon will appear on the screen, but players do not feel that there is too little information or that the operation is not smooth in the game, which is also an effective hiding of information.

 

《The Last of Us Part II》 Game Interface

3. Conclusion

Playability, also known as gameplay, reflects the impact of all internal components of the game on the player’s gaming experience, and the components can include game rules, game interaction with the player, game challenges and difficulty, etc., that is, “what players can do.” In other words, the reason why a game can become a game is precisely because it has playability, allowing players to obtain fun in its limited mechanisms.

For the presentation of game mechanics, the UI is the player’s “mechanism translator”; for the playability of the game, the UI is the player’s “operation helper”. Whether it is game workers or players, they will be excited about more and wider unknown game mechanics. How to better interpret the new composite game mechanics and how to let the mechanics bring players a high-quality experience are difficult problems that UI design needs to consider.

entry.title: “Join the Feng Ling Yue Ying Sect” Don’t Let Game Trainers Ruin the Experience
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In competitive games, normal players are deeply disgusted by cheaters. However, when some players are enjoying the game, they encounter obstacles that they cannot bypass, or hurdles they cannot overcome. There are always some people who will take the wrong path, using third-party software to modify game data, directly cheating, or cutting off the opponent’s network cable. The act of running third-party software is usually not only strongly condemned by the majority of players, but will also be severely punished by the game officials, ranging from warnings to account bans. However, in single-player games, players seem to be more tolerant of modifying game values, and prefer to call the “cheats” of single-player games “trainers”.

For example, a very popular meme among players is - Join the Feng Ling Yue Ying Sect, which is a trainer for a cultivation game. Because the game randomly generates many plots, some players are repeatedly chased or robbed and want to vent their anger, while some players’ Taoist companions are killed and want revenge. At this time, some players will ask them to join the Feng Ling Yue Ying Sect, that is, they suggest that the other party use a trainer. It seems that players are not resistant to this form, and even using it properly can enhance the game experience. So how should we correctly view and use trainers?

1. What Behaviors Can Be Called Modification?

On Steam, many games have “Workshop”, in which there are many player-made and provided game Mods. Mod is taken from the first three letters of the word modification.

There are many types of Mods. Fashion Mods are used to change the appearance of characters. In Human Fall Flat, players can use fashion Mods to turn themselves into various different characters. Map Mods can change the in-game map or directly create a new map. In CS: GO, there are many players who spontaneously form community servers to play hide-and-seek modes that are not available on official servers. There are also many other game content Mods such as sound effects and skills.

Human Fall Flat, players use Mods to create custom skins

The production of these contents is essentially a modification of the game. The existence of Mods is to increase the game content and allow players to experience things outside the game itself, and the continued popularity of many games is also due to the large number of Mods. Some people may think of DLC here, the content of which is similar to some Mods. To distinguish Mods from game DLC, Mods can be understood more as content spontaneously produced and released by players, and they are generally free to use. However, due to technical limitations, they may have some compatibility issues with the game or other Mods. DLC is officially produced and launched game expansion content, which usually requires payment to experience, and is naturally more compatible and stable than player-made Mods.

Portal 2, players create custom map Mods and provide them to other players for experience

Elden Ring wacky Mod that replaces the horse with Thomas the Tank Engine

Compared with Mods, “game trainers” focus more violently on modifying game values and reducing game difficulty, so the functions are relatively simple and crude, with a list of several shortcut keys, players only need to move their fingers to completely subvert the game values. Common functions in trainers include infinite health, infinite mana, infinite money, and so on. I believe some people can still skillfully type Panzer, the cheat code for summoning tanks.

2. Why Do Players Want to Use Trainers?

Different players may have very different pursuits and goals after entering the game, and these are also highly related to their different game experiences. In past research, we have summarized some reasons why players use trainers, and classified them.

Reduce Game Difficulty

It is undeniable that many players have strong talents in gaming and can easily clear many difficult games. However, according to the player ability grading theory, these talented players only occupy a very small part of the top of the player pyramid. We can call them pro-gamers, some of whom are even close to the level of e-sports players. However, there are still many players whose game level is not so high, and the number of these players is much larger, and the overall ability level is also at the middle of the ability grading pyramid. They have certain operating strengths, but often want to experience more games in their spare time. However, the difficulty of some games is too high, and the outward ability performance based on experience and strength may not match this difficulty, which will cause them to spend a lot of time looking up guides, learning skills, and polishing moves.

However, leisure is their biggest purpose in playing games, not becoming stronger. Especially in single-player games, the appearance of trainers can help them experience the full content of the game more easily. Although the core content of some high-difficulty games is to experience hardship and become stronger little by little, if a player cannot persist in playing, then the follow-up of this game will have nothing to do with this player, including carefully crafted content such as plot stories, visual effects, and background music.

 

Experience Different Game Content

As mentioned earlier, many game Mods or trainers can add a lot of new content for players to experience, even player-made BOSSes and side quests. The famous blacksmithing game Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice was released in 2019 and is still popular today. Some players are not satisfied with the normal + double difficulty content of the game itself, so some players have created a series of high-difficulty Mods such as Resurrection, Nightmare, and Gauntlets of Strength, among which Gauntlets of Strength even adds two side quests that are not in the main game. These game Mods have modified the difficulty of the game, added more moves to the BOSS, and allowed hardcore players to experience a cooler and more challenging Sekiro.

 

“Protect the Liver”

Many RPG games have some extremely “grindy” tasks. These tasks either have extremely high material quantity requirements, or have difficulty and drop rate bottlenecks. Players often need to complete a large number of repetitive and boring farming processes to complete these tasks. Some players may not have any complaints about this repetitive step-by-step collection, but there are also players who do not like this boring collection process, and trainers can help players shorten the boring and repetitive game process, and can also provide some rest for the player’s “liver”.

For these players, the appearance of trainers is undoubtedly a godsend. The Japanese RPG game Octopath Traveler has a game mechanism where enemies may be encountered when moving, and the level limit is tied to the experience of the game plot. Players must repeat the mechanical farming and leveling to experience more of the plot, which makes many players call out that they are “tired”. Trainers can save some farming and leveling time for players who only want to experience the plot.

 

Make the Game More Personalized

Different players will have different preferences for game content, and game makers are not omnipotent and cannot cover the preferences of most players. Trainers can provide players with a “superpower” to quickly skip content they don’t like, allowing players to customize their personalized experience and focus more on the “boutique” content they really like to play.

3. Trainers VS Game Cheats

As mentioned at the beginning, many players are more tolerant of modifying game values in single-player games. This is the biggest difference between trainers and cheats - whether your behavior affects others, and whether your happiness is at the expense of other players’ gaming experience. The author believes that using trainers in single-player games only changes the game experience of the user alone. Whether it is increasing the difficulty or simplifying the process, most of them only affect the user himself; while using trainers in multiplayer battle mode will affect the game experience of everyone in the same game, and building one’s own happiness on the pain of others is extremely unfair to other players. Here, the multiplayer battle mode not only refers to the online multiplayer mode, but also content that is related to and competes with other players can be regarded as multiplayer mode, such as game leaderboards, speedruns, achievement acquisition, etc. Using trainers and other improper means to participate in this kind of competition will also not be recognized.

Using the official trainer in Dead Cells will lock achievements

Disadvantages and Usage Guidelines of Trainers

  • Improper use will greatly accelerate the consumption speed of game content. When using trainers, direct numerical modifications should be reduced, and instead, some disliked game content should be reduced from the side. Different types of games have different core content. When using trainers, try to ensure that the core gameplay is not affected or is less affected. When experiencing survival games, when the player’s survival materials reach a level that cannot be used up, then the meaning of “survival” is lost. Therefore, in such games, try not to use trainers with unlimited resources; and when experiencing combat games, using trainers with unlimited health will distort the core experience of such games. The skipped process should be content that is meaningless to the user, not the core content of the game, to prevent the situation of being “invincible” but only being happy for half an hour, and then the whole game becomes boring.

  • It is easy to develop a dependence on trainers. The function of trainers is very powerful. Players only need to move their fingers to operate simple key combinations to solve almost all problems in the game. Such a simple and crude means of winning is easy to make people psychologically dependent. In fact, every time you use a trainer, you need to carefully consider which things should really be skipped with the trainer, so as to maximize the overall game experience. Excessive dependence and overuse of trainers can also easily make you miss important experiences and core fun points, and lose interest in the games that you originally expected and downloaded to play.

4. Conclusion

In order to obtain a “better” gaming experience, it is the original intention of most players to use trainers. In various game playthrough videos, there will be many “cloud players” who only watch game live videos and do not experience the game themselves. Some of them are because they don’t have time to grind, and some are because they are “handicapped” and can’t beat the game, so they can only see the excitement of the game in the video. Trainers do not have to be a target of criticism, but a tool that can be used well to help some players better enjoy the game. For players, if they can get more fun without affecting others, it is a successful modification.

entry.title: Is Fragmented Narrative Pretentious
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

There are many ways to tell a story. It can be expressed in novels, movies, plays, and many other art forms. Telling a story with a game has a very unique advantage, that is, interactivity. In the process of experiencing the game, players truly play the role of the characters in the story, connect with the characters in the story, and then advance the plot. In some games, the player’s behavior will also determine the final direction of the plot. The player is not only the listener of the story, but also the creator of the story. There are also many ways of game narration. This article will briefly introduce them, and focus on the advantages and disadvantages of fragmented narration and its application in games.

I. Common Ways of Game Narration

Linear Narrative

Typical linear narratives include games such as Death Stranding and the Call of Duty series. These linear narrative games make players feel like watching a fine movie in terms of plot. There are a lot of main quests and cutscenes. Linear narrative sacrifices a certain degree of freedom in experience in exchange for the stability of players’ acceptance of the plot. Players are more passive in receiving plot information, such as watching a cutscene after completing a main quest to get the plot.

 

The “Call of Duty” series uses a lot of game cutscenes, and the plot will be triggered after the player plays for a period of time

Branching Narrative

The overall structure is similar to linear narrative. The biggest difference is that branching points are added to the game. Players make different choices and enter different plot lines, such as Detroit: Become Human, Quantum Break, etc.

 

The tree-like selection interface in “Detroit: Become Human”

Fragmented Narrative

Literally, fragmented narrative is to split the overall plot into fragments and integrate them with various contents in the game. For example, after a player obtains a certain item, they obtain key clues about the relationship between characters in the game or the plot from the item description; when a player encounters a BOSS under certain conditions, they trigger hidden dialogues to obtain information; the main line of the fragmented narrative game will not be very clear. Players need to actively discover the information hidden in various corners and piece them together (sometimes requiring some imagination) to obtain a plot story understood and created by the players themselves. The following will also focus on examples.

II. Fragmented Narrative in Games

The application of fragmented narrative in games is very common. For example, in Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice, a large amount of information is integrated with props, injecting this method of finding information in props into the player’s subconscious at the beginning of the game.

The Wolf, played by the player, receives a letter from an unknown person at the beginning of the game. The description of this letter not only contains the content of the letter, but also a sentence “A letter thrown to the bottom of the well by someone”. It not only wants to inform the player of the content of the letter, but also wants the player to understand where this item comes from, what information is related to the item, who is it related to, and why. So that players slowly get used to this narrative method of integrating information into props, and gradually arouse their curiosity.

 

Many settings in the game are not directly presented to the player in the form of animation or text, but are recorded in various items obtained by the player. Players will have a more cherished attitude towards the items obtained through difficult battles.

 

Sekiro uses various props to tell the history of the Sekiro world

In Naraka: Bladepoint, the most direct plot is only the introduction of the game’s background, that is, heroes from all walks of life gather in Morus Isle to compete for the Immortal Mask. But are these heroes related to each other? For this reason, Naraka: Bladepoint also uses some fragmented narrative techniques to introduce the background of the characters and the connections between them.

 

For example, in the fashion description, the origin and story of this fashion are added, telling the background of Kurumi and her best friend Viper Ning becoming enemies. This setting also attracts many players to explore the reasons why Viper Ning and Kurumi changed from best friends to enemies.

III. Advantages and Disadvantages of Fragmented Narrative

Fragmented narrative has received widespread attention in recent years with the popularity of games such as Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice. Due to some of its characteristics, it has corresponding advantages and disadvantages.

Advantages for Players

  1. Extends game time and has a better new game plus experience

Fragmented narrative splits a lot of information into various corners of the game, and players can have a richer experience in exploration. In contrast, when experiencing linear narrative games, many players may leave the game after experiencing the main quest once, and will not open it a second time. Fragmented narrative gives players a lot of room for exploration. Players who want to piece together a more complete plot need to explore more carefully in new game plus, obtain more props and clues, enhance the player’s experience in subsequent playthroughs, and alleviate the repetition of multiple playthroughs. Players can be pleasantly surprised to discover more game details and plot connections.

  1. High degree of freedom, players can choose the plot direction they want to explore

Fragmented narrative does not directly present the plot to the player like linear narrative, but lets the player explore it themselves. This gives the player a higher degree of freedom, that is, what information they want to obtain is determined by the player’s own initiative. The plot is lengthy, unimportant, or uninteresting. Content can be chosen not to be explored, and plot connections that are of great interest can be chosen to be explored first.

When players piece together clues, they often add a process of imagination, which allows different players to have different understandings of the game plot. Under the official setting, various understandings can be made, as long as the logic is complete and reasonable. It can become the perfect story in the player’s mind.

 

In “Elden Ring”, players are allowed to interpret the story themselves. It is not just the order of reading the story, even the internal logical order of the story is not fixed

  1. Stronger sense of immersion

In fragmented narrative games, players not only need to complete combat levels, but also need to complete the collection and piecing together of the plot, and even some imagination. The process of exploration further enhances the player’s sense of immersion. Players need to actively recall, think, and piece together a complete plot, rather than passively accepting the instillation of cutscenes.

Advantages for the Game

  1. Relatively low cost and flexible development

The plot of fragmented narrative can use a large amount of text bound to props, NPCs, etc., reducing the production of cutscenes and real-time rendering, thereby reducing costs. At the same time, the content of fragmented narrative is relatively discrete, and the content connection in the plot is relatively less tight. It will be more natural to modify or delete during the development process, and the overall impact on the plot is smaller.

  1. Different players have different understandings of the plot, which will trigger higher discussion

As mentioned earlier, the plot of a fragmented narrative game requires players to collect, piece together, and imagine. Players will have different understandings of the plot, and the collision of their views will cause intense discussions. Players’ reposts and discussions on social media can increase the popularity of the game and attract more fresh blood.

Disadvantages

It should be noted that some of the above advantages of fragmented narration are also double-edged swords, which may become disadvantages for different players.

  1. Friendly to new game plus players, but not friendly to light players

The plot of the game takes a lot of time to dig out. Some places may need to be revisited, and some clues may be deeply buried. These are of course a great pleasure for players who are keen on exploring, but for some players who just want a light experience, The game burden is relatively heavier. For such players, the linear narrative movie-like plot flow experience will be better.

  1. High requirements for plot copywriting

Fragmented narrative presents players with one point after another, but in the eyes of copywriters, it must be a rigorous logical framework. A large number of clues must be guaranteed to be free of contradictions and contain a certain amount of information. If the game is full of useless clues, players will question it as being pretentious and unintelligible.

If there is a deviation in the focus of the game plot, it will be difficult for players to experience the core plot that the game really wants to convey. Excellent copywriting can ensure that more players move towards the key clues and plots, and ensure the player’s experience.

  1. Higher memory cost for players

Although many games can take out props at any time to view descriptions and clues, a large amount of text content describes the background of the story and the relationship between characters through props or NPCs, which still brings a certain memory burden to players. Players need to recall in a large number of props which props describe which characters can piece the fragments together.

IV. Conclusion

The fragmented narrative method has become familiar to more players with the popularity of Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice and Elden Ring in recent years. Its advantages and disadvantages are obvious. Players who like this method will be very obsessed with exploring the plot, so that there are so many “Soul scholars”, “Sekiro scholars”, and “Elden Ring scholars” constantly exploring and producing content to share and discuss.

Optimizing the experience of light players in the plot, while ensuring the exploration experience of deep players, can allow more players to change from light to deep, and explore those mysterious worlds. Excellent fragmented narrative plots are carefully arranged by copywriters to present players with an epic story. Those games that use the name of fragmented narrative but actually have fragmented plots, far-fetched connections, and obscurity are “pretentious”.

entry.title: The Renaissance of Nostalgic Games - Nostalgia That's Not Necessarily Long-Lasting
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 
Nostalgia is good business.

On June 16th, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder’s Revenge was officially released and achieved good results. When the theme song of the 1987 TV animation Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is played, you will know that the main theme of this game is nostalgia. Everything in the game now seems to have a sense of age, and it can immediately take people back to the time when they were sitting in front of the TV watching cartoons or playing cartridge games years ago. Its target users are also very clear, namely the audience of the animation at that time and the arcade game players in the 1990s.

Now it seems that these products born for nostalgia still have countless old players paying for them, which makes more manufacturers today see this good business. We can also see that by 2022, there are more and more products that use nostalgia to attract users. So, how to use nostalgia to attract players? And why do people love “nostalgia” so much?

1. How Does “Nostalgia” Work?

Nowadays, players who are attracted by sentiment have a relatively high tolerance for the quality of games, but with the development and maturity of sentiment, players’ demand for the quality of such games is also rapidly increasing. Many game manufacturers that play the nostalgia card have also realized the development and changes of players’ current needs, and have begun to carry out more detailed operations for the theme of “nostalgia”. From the player’s point of view, even if they have long realized that the manufacturer is using the banner of nostalgia to make money, when they see those familiar scenes and characters, they will still involuntarily feel a surge in their hearts and open their wallets.

So, how do manufacturers manipulate “nostalgia”?

Original Flavor

In August 2019, World of Warcraft Classic was launched, which can be said to be a milestone of the “original flavor” school. Behind the popularity, the nostalgic culture has set off another wave of trends in game media, live broadcast platforms, and video websites. The player group and the capital market have given double certification to Classic. The concept of “original flavor” has also been further consolidated in the minds of many game manufacturers. After all, before this, very few online games were willing to bring out old content from more than ten years ago almost unchanged and sell it, even if they wanted to sell it, they would carry out a series of operations such as “HD remake”, “gameplay optimization”, and “introduction of innovation”.

Now it seems that Classic can bring huge benefits. The rough pictures and immature designs of the original flavor not only did not expose their shortcomings, but instead became a weapon to evoke players’ feelings at the first time. While everyone complains about the imbalance and inconvenience, they don’t forget to add a sentence “It was like this back then”, and then happily eat the meal of remembering the past.

The success of all this also proves the feasibility of “original flavor” restoration from the side. If players are given the opportunity to play again from scratch, most people will burst out with a higher desire to consume than before, with a yearning for the past.

 

Old Formula, New Taste

Different from the “true original flavor” of Classic, there are also some nostalgic products that focus more on providing players with the first impression of “the same as before”, and adding new elements that meet current trends in gameplay design, functional modules, and social systems. Many of the gameplay and functions of these games are now considered to be in the category of “dead on arrival”. After years of exploration, manufacturers have also researched their own solutions that both capture the nostalgic mentality of old players and adapt to the current market.

Take Shredder’s Revenge as an example, the production team deliberately restored the previous rich scene interaction and exaggerated and humorous plot settings in the game. For example, in the previous Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series, players could hit the manhole cover thrown by the enemy to defeat the opponent; enemies would suddenly burst out of the window from the shops on the street; when players encountered various trap scenes, they might also be crushed into slices, smashed into pieces, burned into small black figures, and even rubbed their eyes when they were splashed with sand, and so on.

 

But while restoring the former flavor, Shredder’s Revenge also added a lot of new things. In terms of design, an attribute system has been added. The three attributes of range, speed, and power are different according to the characteristics of the character itself; in terms of operation, more operation commands have been added, such as double jump, dodge and other actions; in terms of gameplay, the “ultimate skill” has added an energy bar design, and a blocking system has also been introduced for monsters; in terms of social interaction, more cooperative gameplay has been added, such as combos, interactions, rescues, and so on.

 

For individual players, when this game reappears in front of them “unchanged” after many years, they will feel somewhat unclear. The players still want to play this game, but because people’s aesthetics and mentality are constantly changing, now it has put on a more “fashionable coat” and appeared in front of the players in a brand new posture, which must be more fascinating.

Creating a Social “New Trend”

For manufacturers, longer-term nostalgia is not only efficient harvesting of feelings, but also allows themselves to become a new topic of trend. In the business of nostalgia, social attributes, as a positive factor that can connect players’ emotions and promote the spontaneous spread of the game among players’ communities, can to a certain extent amplify the symbolic marketing of nostalgia and make it a new trend for a while.

Mole Manor, as a childhood memory of the post-90s generation, was originally a children’s game for elementary school to junior high school students. Therefore, when the game manufacturer relaunched this game, they needed to consider how to satisfy the feelings and attract the adult group. Based on this, the operation of Mole Manor mobile game is to push topics such as “working in the game”, “checking in at internet celebrity shops and internet celebrity attractions”, and “establishing a fan community” to the vast social platform. By fitting the current state of the players who have grown up, the social attributes are amplified, and a certain degree of gameplay is abandoned, leading to a wave of “nostalgic new trends”.

 

2. Is “Nostalgia” More Fun?

In general, this type of game is still more about nostalgia than gameplay. So why is it that playing a game from many years ago feels more fun than modern games?

Unburdened Pure Enjoyment

Today’s games are constantly improving in quality, and the game content is becoming more and more detailed, and the requirements for players are also increasing. When playing games, players have more information to receive and process: more refined graphics, more detailed music, more realistic animations and interactive systems. Although these elements make the game as a whole more refined and beautiful, it has to be admitted that they also bring more burden to players.

In other words, more delicate motion animations and more realistic sound effects bring players a “real” sense of immersion; but at the same time, the problem is that the difficulty of game operation will also increase, which requires players to adapt to the operation. In comparison, sometimes it is indeed not as good as the pure enjoyment brought by easier-to-use game operations and higher fun, which is more popular with players.

 

Finding the Joy of Playing with Friends Again

The irreplaceable emotional value can help nostalgic games recall the most loyal core players. This value is partly given by the unique gameplay of the game itself, and on the other hand, it is also deeply hidden in the emotional connection of playing games with friends in the past.

For players, when mentioning a certain game, the biggest nostalgic memory may be around playing with friends, making friends in the game, sharing interests, and enjoying the experience of mutual competition and cooperation. So when a nostalgic game is relaunched, players can’t help but recall the happiness that this game once brought them, and they will think of the time when they left their friends in the game or cooperated with them in the process of completing tasks. These experiences allow players to have a deeper social connection with others, and naturally they will pour deeper emotions into this game, prompting them to download the game again even after so many years, and then poke the friends who played with them back then: Hey, do you want to play another round together?

Insisting on Gameplay and Mechanics

In today’s various AAA games, when the game has a set of movie-level graphics and narrative, resources must continue to tilt towards the most prominent parts of the game, such as the sense of impact, the sense of substitution, the audio-visual sensory experience, etc. to improve the quality of the game in all aspects. On the contrary, some of the gameplay and mechanics have not improved with the development of the game. Such games are like a production line, one generation after another. For most players, it may just be that the graphics and actions are more realistic, and the map is larger. The old games of the past, although the game content is not so close to reality, but because of this, the excellent old games that have been passed down are more purely because of their advanced core gameplay, which is addictive.

Therefore, when facing countless masterpieces, players will unconsciously feel that they want to play every game, but they don’t want to click on any game, or they want to turn it off and scroll through their phone after playing for 40 minutes. However, playing the “nostalgic” remake with a nostalgic mentality is so fond of it.

 

3. Childhood is Back? But Not Completely

“Fun, not necessarily long-lasting”, best describes the state of this type of nostalgic game. For players, their happy experience of this type of game may only be 2 hours.

Take Shredder’s Revenge as an example, the game has the feeling of playing through arcade games before, but it cannot provide enough motivation for repeated play. Even if each level is made to feel uniquely “new”, due to the repetitive mechanism, if you play more than 10 levels in a row, you will still feel tired.

When players play, they may lose interest after playing two levels with different characters, and the gameplay lacks stamina. If you try to solve the problem of repeated play motivation through the plot, such as branch plot drive, Shredder’s Revenge does not even have a decent main plot, and it is difficult for players to have the motivation to repeatedly play levels.

However, if you want to continue to get game fun, the ideal situation is to play multiplayer online with friends you know in real life. Combined with the original intention of game development, multiplayer online can also better reproduce the feeling of playing happily with friends in the living room, arcade hall and other places when you were a child. This may be the best and most correct way to open Shredder’s Revenge. Once you can’t find friends to play with, after playing a few times with random matches, you may still quickly lose motivation due to the aforementioned factors.

Back to what was said at the beginning, nostalgia is good business. It’s okay to make nostalgic games. What is really difficult to reproduce is the days of playing games in the past.

entry.title: What Makes You Decide to Spend Money in a Game Decoding Player Spending
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

With the improvement of living standards and changes in consumption habits, games have gradually become the mainstream leisure method and social activity for consumers. In 2021, the actual sales revenue of China’s game market was 296.513 billion yuan, an increase of 17.826 billion yuan compared with the previous year, but the growth rate decreased by nearly 15% year-on-year. Affected by the epidemic and the global economy, China’s consumer confidence index has fluctuated significantly in the past two years.

 

In terms of game payment, the current game market in China presents the characteristics of “low payment rate and high payment amount”. In 2021, the number of game users in China was 666 million, a year-on-year increase of 0.22%, and the number of users is gradually saturated. The penetration rate of mobile game users reached a peak of 75.9% in 2016. Due to policy tightening and other entertainment methods such as short videos grabbing potential game users, it fell to 66.3% in 2020.

 

Young people, mainly Generation Z, will gradually become the mainstream group of game consumption. “Pursuing fashion”, “expressing self-personality” and “focusing on emotions” are all their consumption labels. To sum up, there are four obvious characteristics of the consumption upgrade phenomenon of young consumers:

  • Under the “low-desire society”, consumption is polarized: rationalization of rigid demand and high frequency of spiritual demand;
  • Consumption upgrade enters the 2.0 era: from material consumption upgrade to spiritual consumption upgrade, users are more likely to be touched by feelings and pay for the spiritual world; pursue refinement and aesthetics; improve their own literacy through consumption, etc.;
  • Cultural belonging and national trend identity are increasingly prominent
  • Consumption circles in urban and rural areas and between generations are increasingly solidifie.

 

The consumption upgrade characteristics presented by this new consumer group will also lead the trend of changes in the game industry, including changes in game pricing power (consumption is tilted towards high-quality game products, paying more attention to the multi-dimensional and deep-level added value brought by the product such as experience, feeling, and atmosphere), changes in game mode (“content + form” games and strong rule games with storylines as the main body), changes in integration paths (“game +” and “+ game” forms) and changes in experience methods (breakthrough of circle layers and fragmented time game collaboration).

In other words, the current demographic dividend of the domestic game industry has receded, but in the future, with the increase in China’s per capita disposable income and the strengthening of young people’s willingness to pay for online entertainment, the industry’s payment rate still has a large room for improvement. Next, this article will start from the perspective of consumer psychology to talk about why you are willing to pay in the game, and what factors will affect your payment decision.

1. Consumer Psychology and Purchase Intention

Consumer psychology mainly studies the psychological phenomena and behavior patterns of consumers in consumption activities. Simply put, consumer action = consumer psychology + consumer behavior.

Common consumer psychology includes seeking practicality (the use value of goods & services), seeking beauty (the artistic value and appreciation value of goods), seeking convenience (convenient to buy or carry), comparison (satisfying curiosity and not falling behind), herd mentality and so on.

Purchase intention is the possibility that consumers will buy a certain product or service, and the probability of being willing to take a specific purchase behavior is high or low. It is the subjective tendency of consumers to choose a specific product, and it is an important indicator for predicting consumer behavior. Factors that affect purchase intention are often:

  • Consumer personality characteristics: including demographics (gender/age/occupation/income/education level) and specific factors (such as the purchase intention of food is related to the consumer’s health status);
  • Product internal cues: attributes related to the use value of the product, such as use value, quality characteristics, etc. That is, consumers are to obtain the products they need to meet their own needs, which is the main driving force for consumers to take purchasing behavior;
  • Product external cues: relative to internal cues, external factors unrelated to the product’s own attributes, such as price, brand, etc.;
  • Consumption situation factors: Consumers’ purchasing decisions will change with changes in the situation factors they are in, such as store design, surrounding environment, salesperson performance, etc.;
  • Socio-economic factors: When the level of purchasing power is constant, market demand is a function of purchase intention. From a macroeconomic perspective, the lack of purchase intention of residents within a certain period of time is due to the decline in the growth of residents’ immediate income and expected income.

For consumers, the purchase decision is usually a progressive thinking: whether it can meet my needs, whether I have enough money to buy, and whether it is affordable among similar choices.

Therefore, in the real economy & e-commerce, there are many common situations related to consumer behavior and psychology.

Case 1: Set Membership Prices Through the ‘Decoy Effect’

When making decisions, consumers rarely buy directly without comparison. At this time, in order for consumers to make purchase decisions better and faster, merchants often provide a “decoy” for the target product to encourage consumers to buy.

 

Membership Pricing in APP: Both internal comparison - monthly/quarterly/annual, and comparison between single membership and combined membership to promote purchase

Case 2: Pay Attention to the ‘Ambiguity Effect’ to Promote Ice-Breaking Consumption

People tend to choose clear options and avoid unknown options. If users don’t understand your product, or a particular feature, they won’t choose it. If you want to design a mall gift package for the game, you need to give players a full understanding, especially for those new players who are just starting to experience the game, what props they can get in the gift package, and what price advantages they have, need to be fully described.

Case 3: Use the ‘Anchoring Effect’ to Highlight the Value of Props

When people make judgments about something/someone, they are easily dominated by first impressions or the first information they receive, just like an anchor sinking to the bottom of the sea, fixing people’s thoughts somewhere. For example, if a consumer sees the price of a certain product for the first time, then the price of this first impression will have a huge impact on her.

In the game, the pricing of the mall often plays the role of “anchor”. Perhaps the sales of direct purchases in the mall are not high, but when the event gift package is launched, players will compare the price in the gift package with the mall pricing, thus feeling cheap and affordable.

2. Game Motivation and Payment Motivation

Currently, more and more people believe that games are closer to a service industry. Players experience the game, in fact, they are enjoying the service content designed by the game developers and paying for it. Not only the game play design itself, its social atmosphere, operation mode, and economic system are all part of the player’s evaluation. With the weakening and disappearance of the demographic dividend, the game industry has turned to competition for existing players. Doing a good job in the game and doing a good job in experience is also more important for each manufacturer.

To understand players’ payment motivation, we can start by understanding players’ game motivation. Many organizations and individuals have studied players’ game motivation, mainly out of personal self-satisfaction, social needs, etc.

Quantic Foundry Player Motivation Model

In order to meet the game needs of different types of players, the paid content in the game has become increasingly diverse, and players with different motivations can find the one that suits their needs in the game. For example, players whose main game motivation is “achievement” are more likely to pay to achieve the goals of the achievement/collection system; players who value “social” have a greater willingness to buy appearance items; players who want to “crush others” are more interested in ability-enhancing paid content.

3. Factors Affecting In-Game Payment

Game products can be divided into hardware products (game consoles, accessories, etc.) and software products (online games, mobile games, etc.). Here, we will mainly discuss game software products, especially the payment design in non-buyout games, that is, the payment content related to the game itself.

Games are no longer a “one-shot deal”. Paying attention to the player’s full-process experience in the game, putting users first, and improving user experience are one of the tenets of most game manufacturers. Combining factors such as game motivation, game design, and consumer psychology, we can also extract some factors that may affect players’ payment in the game, so as to better understand why players choose to pay in the game, and what kind of game experience they hope to obtain through payment. In addition to the theme characteristics of players (gender, age, education, etc.), the following factors are worth paying attention to.

Social Entertainment & Self-Fulfillment

In an analysis of the online game consumption behavior of college players, researchers found that “entertainment and sociality” is the biggest influencing factor. Players are eager to make new friends, maintain and deepen existing friendships while enjoying online games. At the same time, they hope to gain a sense of existence and achievement that cannot be satisfied in the real world through self-participation.

In addition, players also hope that the game can entertain themselves and relieve pressure. They hope to express themselves through better dressing/strength, or show their economic strength and attract attention.

In-Game Practical Value

Most in-game paid content has practical value in the game, such as improving character abilities, saving game time, accumulating game resources, facilitating certain game activities, helping to complete certain tasks, etc. For these reasons, players may take payment actions.

Game Quality Itself

According to the statistics of Gamma Data, among the top 250 games in China in 2019, only 15.3% were “obviously innovative” types, but they contributed 62.3% of the total revenue of these games. Chinese players are obviously more willing to pay for games with excellent graphics and innovative gameplay. With the tightening of policies, some homogenous games with ordinary graphics, monotonous content and gameplay, and short player life cycle value will gradually disappear. The increase in the proportion of high-quality games will hopefully drive the overall ARPU value of the industry.

ARPU, that is, average revenue per user, is an indicator used by operators to measure the revenue from each end user.

Whether the game is innovative and refined enough (including picture quality, gameplay content, story theme, game style, plot characters, etc.), whether it is easy to get started, and whether the quality of related services is timely and effective will affect players’ payment decisions.

External Market Impact

The game industry is not operating independently. Players also pay attention to the legal and policy environment, such as the anti-addiction regulations for minors that manufacturers have been working to optimize in recent years; marketing such as celebrity effects, IP linkage, etc.; and hardware configuration, players’ network speed, and the dependence of game products on device configuration.

Consumption Preferences

Game payment is no different from other payment behaviors. As consumers, players will first consider the economic value of their content: whether the price is affordable, whether it is reasonable, and whether it is affordable; some game prop content also has a certain ‘investment value’, and players consider whether they can sell it at a higher price in the future; there will also be some players who regard game payment as ‘one of the necessary game processes’.

Other Payment Experiences

Game payment can also learn from the experience of e-commerce payment. For example:

  • The impact of website speed (purchase process): As long as the waiting time exceeds three seconds, 57% of consumers will give up browsing the webpage, and 80% of consumers will not return to the website;
  • Overall website design (payment design UI): 92.6% of consumers said that visual enjoyment is the main factor affecting purchasing decisions, and they will decide whether to consume in just 1 and a half minutes;
  • Price discrimination: In the口碑崩盘 (kǒu bēi bēng pán - reputation collapse) incident encountered by the game “Invisible Guardian”, “inconsistent pricing” triggered a lot of negative reviews from players.

 

4. Conclusion

In general, paying in a game is not a one-way request, but providing high-quality services to meet the needs of players. Game as a Service (GAAS) on the one hand means that the game is no longer a one-time purchase for consumers, but a longer-term participation, and it is a commitment by game developers to provide players with continuous operation and continuous updates; on the other hand, it also requires developers to pay attention to the full-process and all-round experience of players in the game journey, and continuously polish products with the goal of “providing a better game user experience”.

entry.title: How to Read Minds Through the Eyes Using Eye Tracking in Game Research
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In user research, researchers often encounter this situation: a player, after experiencing a process, cannot answer any questions during the follow-up interview: Was there this feature? Did I perform this operation? Why did I do this at that time? Whenever this happens, researchers feel a tinge of helplessness, wishing they could read minds at this moment.

Once players forget details, making it impossible to describe their behavior, the problems observed by the user researcher may not be solved. Fortunately, eye-tracking testing, as an objective measurement method, can measure players’ pure experience responses, supplement players’ physiological response data, and combine with traditional subjective research, which can, to a certain extent, avoid some biases caused by players’ subjective feedback. So, from the perspective of user research practice, how can visual attention data be applied to product design and user experience research?

1. Principles and Characteristics of Eye Movement

Player Attention Distribution Can Be Derived from Gaze Point Movement Data

Eye Movement is the process of the eyeball discovering, fixating, and tracking visual stimuli through movement. Eye tracking, which sounds very sophisticated, from observing the player’s eyes to reading the player’s mind, can actually be understood in two steps:

First, the prompt is right in front of you, where exactly are they looking? In other words, how do we measure the player’s eye movements?

The answer is Gaze Point. Modern eye-tracking instruments can calculate the movement of the eyeball through infrared light reflection, and we can see in real time where the player’s gaze point is and what they are looking at.

 

Schematic Diagram of Eye Movement Gaze Point

Second, they clearly saw the prompt, where is their attention actually?

In fact, the player’s eye movements and their attention distribution are closely related. By observing eye movement trajectories and behaviors, we can还原(huányuán - restore, reconstruct) the reasons why players did not operate in time, such as more urgent incentives (monsters rushing towards them, pickups not far away).

Simply put, eye tracking is to display the test subject’s gaze point on the screen in real time, and present this performance in the form of data afterwards; researchers or products can intuitively understand what information the test subject looked at, what they didn’t look at, how long they looked at a certain piece of information, etc. It can be used as direct evidence for interface and prompt optimization.

Eye Movement Research Can Supplement Objective Behavioral Data

At first glance, eye movement seems to be able to obtain a lot of detailed data, but what are its advantages or differences compared with commonly used research methods? As a kind of behavioral data measured by technology, eye movement can solve the following problems:

  • The reading cost of measurement results is too high: Eye movement data can be intuitively presented with a heat map, which greatly reduces the reading cost of the original data, and even people who have not been exposed to eye movement can easily read it;
  • Players subjectively speculate on behavioral details: Through eye movement data, the situation where players recall and explain specific details is avoided, preventing players from hypothesizing details afterwards;
  • The experimenter needs to frequently interrupt the process: Using other methods, the experimenter may need to frequently interrupt the player to ask for details of the experience, while eye movement can ensure that the player is tested without interference, especially suitable for scenarios that emphasize immersion.

The limitations of eye movement are also very obvious - in essence, eye movement obtains behavioral data and cannot provide explanatory information about the cause of player behavior. In order to understand the complete link of players’ “behavior-eye movement-motivation-cause”, it is often necessary to add post-test follow-up, ask players’ subjective attitudes and experience, and supplement with demographic characteristics and related experience, in order to obtain relatively complete research insights.

2. Commonly Used Eye Movement Indicators in Practical Applications

As mentioned above, the data obtained by eye movement methods has a very high granularity and is very comprehensive, and various types of analysis can be realized according to the needs of researchers. In user research practice, there are three types of data that are frequently used (taking Tobii Pro Lab analysis software as an example):

Eye Movement Video: High Analysis Efficiency, Can Discover More Than 80% of Problems

Eye movement video is a screen recording of the player’s experience process + the player’s real-time eye movement gaze point data. Through the software, researchers can clearly see the landing point of each gaze of the player. By watching the video, researchers can restore the changes in the player’s attention at any time during the test, which is the simplest and most efficient way of eye movement indicators. In specific use, researchers can see: where the player looked, where they didn’t look, what content they were more concerned about, and the order of attention.

As shown in the figure below, when a player was experiencing the Naraka: Bladepoint novice tutorial, because of personal operation, they did not see the AR prompt text, resulting in not using the “Sprint” button for a long time. The eye movement video allows the experimenter to intuitively identify that the player did not operate as expected here, and focus on the impact caused by this in the subsequent game process.

 

Eye Movement and Video Playback Can Be Synchronized in Real Time in Tobii Pro Lab

Heat Map and Gaze Plot: Visualize the Problems in the Video and Facilitate Comparison

Heat Map and Gaze Plot are both visualization methods that reflect the player’s gaze situation within a certain period of time, and they are also relatively intuitive to use. The longer (more times) the player gazes, the more it is displayed as red on the heat map, emphasizing the overall situation and relative density of attention. The gaze plot can show the order and trajectory of all the player’s gaze points. This indicator is mainly used for the verification of existing interface design, and the usage scenario is usually to study relatively static area combinations.

 

Merchant Tutorial - Heat Map

–.

 

Merchant Tutorial - Eye Movement Gaze Plot

For example, in the picture above, when observing the player’s understanding of the merchant tutorial, it can be seen from the heat map that the player pays extra attention to the merchant sign on the map (the red highlighted area in the picture above), and from the trajectory map, it can be seen that the player looks at the text and video对照(duìzhào - in comparison) (the numbers of the gaze points in the figure below).

Quantitative Indicators - Time to First Fixation and Fixation Duration are Most Commonly Used

Quantitative indicators can be exported through software, and the obtainable indicator data is divided into Fixation, Visit, Saccade and other series of data. These indicators are often used for quantitative user behavior research. If necessary, the most commonly used and easy-to-use ones are the following two:
