  • Fixation Duration: That is, the duration of the player’s gaze within a certain period of time. It is generally understood as the player’s degree of interest. The longer the fixation duration, the more interested the player is in the corresponding position.
  • Time to First Fixation: That is, the time when the first fixation occurs. It can be seen whether the player pays attention to the content in the first place and the time spent. According to the time to first fixation, we can analyze the cause of the player’s time consumption, the distribution of stimulation points, etc., so as to adjust the prompt position, intensity and other related UI design elements.

The above three types of indicators have their own focus and can complement each other. The recommended analysis method is: first watch the eye movement video to find possible problems; then use heat maps and gaze plots to visually compare specific problems; if necessary, in-depth analysis can be carried out through quantitative data.

3. How to Interpret Commonly Used Eye Movement Indicators in Practical Applications

Direct Analysis Through Eye Movement Video

As mentioned above, eye movement video is the most intuitive and efficient indicator. Combining player behavior, eye movement, and interface information can reveal problems.

The following is a player experiencing the novice tutorial of Naraka: Bladepoint on console. After defeating the enemy, the player does not know what to do, walks around randomly for a period of time, suddenly releases the Y skill once, and then enters the next stage. Through eye movement, we can find that in this stage, the player only sees the prompt requirement in the upper left corner of the screen at the end, resulting in not achieving the task goal and getting stuck. From this, we can judge that this player did not find the task prompt in the first place as expected, and the researcher may need to further verify the existing UI design for repeated testing.

 

《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Excerpt of a Player’s Y Skill Experience Eye Movement Video

Comparative Analysis Through Different Players

Through comparison, we can also use certain player attributes as variables to see the characteristics of a certain type of player group and the problems they may encounter.

For example, in the eye-tracking test of the mobile game Meteor Butterfly Sword, experienced players are familiar with the game UI and task flow, so their eye movement trajectory can be used as a reference for players in use. Comparing it with the eye movement of new players, we can find the difference in attention between novices and experienced players.

 

《Meteor Butterfly Sword》 Mobile Game Novice/Experienced Player Battle Level Three-Star Task Eye Movement Heat Map and Table

It can be seen from the eye movement data (the numbers in the figure below indicate the number of fixations (time to first fixation)) that experienced players will pay attention to the requirements of the three-star task from the beginning, while novices do not pay attention to it throughout the process; experienced players pay attention to it, indicating that this is a relatively important goal when clearing the level, while new players do not see it, indicating that the information is not conspicuous enough when used for the first time. By comparing the focus of new and experienced players, it is helpful for the product to adjust the problems in terms of player onboarding.

Comparative Analysis Through Different Materials

We can also discover the similarities and differences in player behavior through the comparative analysis of different materials. This method can be used for the comparison of similar processes.

Taking the video teaching in the Naraka: Bladepoint novice tutorial as an example, players will experience the “Merchant” and “Whirlwind” tutorials (both of which are in the form of text + dynamic video). A certain player showed that he carefully watched the previous video, but did not pay attention to the latter video at all, but the final result was the same - the player’s actual operation was very smooth.

 

Gaze Plot - Merchant Tutorial (Left) and Whirlwind Tutorial (Right)

Why does this happen? Through the player’s attention to the content of the page, we found that in the Whirlwind tutorial, there is a description of the display content of the small map, and the player does not need to watch the video to know the approximate style of the icon; while in the Merchant tutorial, the text description does not prompt the icon style, which leads to the above eye movement behavior.

 

Text Description in the Tutorial - Merchant Tutorial (Top) and Whirlwind Tutorial (Bottom)

4. Conclusion

Eye movement is behavioral data, which can complement traditional interviews. Through eye movement videos, visualizations, etc., researchers can accurately and meticulously identify and analyze problems. Eye tracking can not only be used directly for analysis, but also can be combined with experimental design for targeted exploration.

From a practical point of view, eye tracking, like other user experience research methods, requires a clear research plan, reasonable and measurable assumptions for the problems to be explored, and targeted player interviews after the test, in order to draw convincing conclusions and form inspiring insights. In user research work, any technical means are only auxiliary. Understanding the player’s motivation, needs, and cognitive process, experiencing and understanding with empathy, is the so-called “mind reading”.

entry.title: Small Red Dot, Big Impact Red Dot Experience Design in Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

1. The “Little Red Dot” in Games

“Red dot notifications,” as a simple and eye-catching reminder, are ubiquitous on today’s smart device platforms. It can attract everyone’s attention with a strong visual presentation in the interface, convey the content of the prompt information, especially in the multi-level menu jump, it can also clearly guide the user, and it is the key to attracting users to obtain information. It can be seen that the role of the little red dot is self-evident. There is a big role hidden in the small red dot. In fact, “little red dot” is our popular and vivid term, and its official name is “Badge.” So, what is a badge?

A badge refers to a red dot, number, or text that usually appears in the upper right corner of an icon or text, indicating that there is new content or information to be processed. Its purpose is to guide users to operate and increase clicks, thereby increasing business exposure. A small number of red dots can provide effective information prompts for everyone, but when red dots appear all over the screen, it will become a disaster for obsessive-compulsives.

Little Red Dots in Mobile Phones

There are many theories about the origin of the little red dot badge, but the most widely accepted theory is that the badge originated from the BlackBerry mobile phone system. In 2009, in the 9700 series mobile phones launched by BlackBerry, a small red dot with an asterisk (*) appeared in its system. Later, in 2013, Apple used the small red dot in its system and registered related patents. Since then, the small red dot has been carried forward in the iPhone. Later, the Android system also adopted the visual presentation of the “little red dot”. Until today, we have become accustomed to the appearance of the little red dot.

Little Red Dots in Games

In games, in order to effectively remind players to pay attention to function activation, content updates, reward collection, mail notifications, and other information, game developers are also very fond of small red dots, wishing that the interface was full of red dots. Even for players, playing games every day is to regularly clear the refreshed small red dots.

Of course, in the game, the more red dots, the better. If red dots appear all over the screen, it will make players feel confused, unable to distinguish the importance of the information conveyed, and confused. It will also strongly force players to eliminate a large number of red dots, causing players to be bored and reducing the game experience.


《Onmyoji》 Mobile Game Interface

2. The Big Role of the Little Red Dot

From the perspective of the game itself: Why have a little red dot?

The eye-catching way of the small red dot can undoubtedly quickly attract the attention of players. From the perspective of the game itself, it can not only effectively improve the efficiency of players’ information acquisition, but also guide players to perform expected behaviors. For players, the appearance of the small red dot breaks the balance of information transmission, and the “discomfort” it brings will greatly attract players and induce them to click to eliminate the small red dot.

  • Reminder and attraction: Improve the efficiency of players’ information acquisition

    • In the game, the use of small red dots is mainly for reminders and attraction. Reminders refer to promptly delivering new messages, gameplays, updates, and other information in the game to players, allowing players to obtain new mail information, notifications, discover new costumes, skills, equipment, attributes, and other content. Attraction is to further guide players to click to increase clicks and exposure on the basis of basic reminder functions.
    • At the same time, because players’ game time is becoming more and more fragmented, developers must provide players with more convenient ways to use small red dots to allow players to obtain more content within a limited time, reducing invalid exploration and searching.

  • Guidance and expectation: Guide players to perform expected behavior operations

    • Another important role of the small red dot is to guide players to perform expected behavior operations. In the game, if the guidance is done well, it can allow players to obtain a smooth experience, but if it is not done well, it will make players feel bored and irritable. For example, in the hero interface of Naraka: Bladepoint, a “plus sign” shaped red badge is used in the upper right corner of each hero to allow players to click to view new heroes and updated costumes, equipment, etc. of heroes, guiding players to click step by step to view updated content and understand the details of items. After the player clicks to view, the red dot will disappear, which can effectively guide the player to obtain information, and also clear the “red dot” in time, so that the player has a clear and smooth experience.


《Naraka: Bladepoint》 Hero Interface

From the player’s perspective: Why deal with the little red dot?

From the player’s point of view, why do players always can’t help but click on the little red dot?

This is mainly because the appearance of the red dot breaks the balance of information transmission, distinguishing and enhancing the primary and secondary relationship of information. At the same time, it brings players the discomfort of breaking the stability, so it will force players to “deal” with the small red dot.

  • Break the balance of information transmission

    • The principle of similarity mentions that objects with common elements appear to be more related, usually manifested as visual elements such as shape, color, and size. We also tend to regard similar objects as a group when observing things. When there is no small red dot in the normal state, the information is in equilibrium. The appearance of the small red dot makes it different from other content in the group, breaking the original information balance, efficiently presenting information to players, and allowing players to quickly obtain information.

  • Bring “discomfort” to players

    • The use of small red dots in the game can be said to take advantage of the player’s obsessive-compulsive disorder psychology. When there is disharmony, abnormality, and other content in the interface, it will make players feel bored, and they will try to clear and correct these “errors”. The “discomfort” brought to players will greatly attract players, making them actively click to eliminate it, and also complete the game guidance.

3. How to Design the “Little Red Dot”?

After understanding the origin and role of the little red dot, we will next explore how to better design and utilize the little red dot in the game interface to provide players with an efficient, smooth, and comfortable experience.

Reduce Excessive Appearance

The little red dot is not a panacea. When there are many small red dots in the interface, the red dot loses its original meaning. Red dots all over the screen will make players confused. Perhaps some players will click on them one by one under the guidance of obsessive-compulsive disorder, but more players will choose to ignore the existence of red dots, and even feel disgusted. Therefore, the excessive appearance of red dots should be reduced in the interface, the number of displays should be controlled, and key information should be selected for prompting, so that the small red dot can show its due value.

One-time and Easy to Eliminate

Many players encounter situations in the game where they cannot eliminate the small red dot, which will cause them to feel extremely irritable. Therefore, in the design, players need to be able to easily eliminate the red dot and make it disappear with a simple operation, restoring a concise and refreshing interface. In some games, this is ignored, and the red dot that is always on will greatly affect the player’s game experience. The red dot elimination principle should meet the following 3 points:

  • One-time reminder, disappears after clicking
  • Click to disappear, reset after re-login
  • Can be cleared when conditions are met

Ensure a Clear Guidance Path

When there are new content updates or reminders for players to collect rewards, it is necessary to use red dots to attract players and guide them to the final page. In the process, if there is a guidance break or a sudden stop, it will cause players to be confused. Therefore, when using small red dots, it is necessary to ensure the clarity of the guidance path. For example, in the reward collection guidance of Harry Potter: Magic Awakened, the appearance of red dots well guides the reward collection path. When the player enters the final page, the red dot disappears, and the collection of the gift package is displayed in the form of special effects. When the player takes the wrong path, the red dot will appear again to correct the player’s path.



Game “Harry Potter: Magic Awakened”

Performance in Line with the Game Style

In the game, the appearance of the small red dot provides players with clear information reminders, but in different scenes, the form of the small red dot should also be different. Of course, no matter what form it appears in, it should have a strong visual effect. In the design, it should also be considered comprehensively from three aspects: color, shape, and form of expression.

  • Color: Not just red
    • Usually, the appearance of small red dots is mainly red. This is because red will give people a sense of warning, danger, and eye-catching, and it can form a strong contrast with other information, thereby attracting players’ attention. Therefore, designing small red dots in red can well attract players to click.
    • Of course, in games, due to the different styles and theme colors of different games, the use of “small red dots” can also be flexibly designed. For example, in Knives Out, the theme color of the game is mainly yellow, so in order to fit the theme color, yellow is also used in the design of the “small red dot”. At the same time, the bright yellow can also attract the attention of players.

《Knives Out》 Interface

  • Shape: Diverse styles
    • Also in the choice of shape, especially in games, it is not limited to circles. In the design of the shape, it can be set according to the worldview and style of the game itself, making the interface more holistic. For example, the “small red dot” in Harry Potter: Magic Awakened adopts a pentagonal design, which is selected from the packaging of candies in the original work; the “small red dot” in Naraka: Bladepoint adopts the form of a “+” to indicate update reminders; in Onmyoji, although the red dot method is also used, its shape is integrated with the game style, and it is also more unified in the interface.

《Harry Potter: Magic Awakened》/《Naraka: Bladepoint》/《Onmyoji》

  • Form of expression: Vivid and image
    • In terms of expression, the shape of the small red dot can also be more vivid and image. The combination of pictures and text, the presentation of text, and the performance of micro-motion effects can all enrich the style of the “small red dot”. For example, in UNO!, the small red dot becomes the form of a bubble, and an exclamation mark is displayed in it to indicate information reminders, which can easily attract the attention of players; in the Onmyoji store, the text form is directly used as a badge, which also effectively conveys new information; in A Chinese Ghost Story, the friend badge adopts the form of mail and is presented in the form of micro-dynamic shaking, which can also vividly display the reminder information in front of the player, thereby attracting the player to click. The diverse forms of expression make the “small red dot” more emotional and interesting, and it is also easier to bring players a pleasant experience.

《UNO!》/《Onmyoji》/《A Chinese Ghost Story》

Allow Players to Eliminate with One Click

In the game, in order to allow players to get a good experience, the function design that allows players to eliminate red dot prompts with one click can be described as a boon for obsessive-compulsive disorder patients. In the interactive interface, you can design an interactive button to eliminate red dot prompts in a more conspicuous position, or you can put it in the settings for players to choose the red dot message reminders that need to be eliminated. One-click elimination of red dot prompts is not to close it once and for all, cutting off players’ reminders to get messages, but to provide players with more choices, slow down players’ irritability experience, and red dot prompts will also appear again after re-login to the game (but one-click elimination will also inevitably bring some mistakes).

Of course, when designing the interaction of the one-click elimination button, it can also be more interesting. For example, as early as 2014, QQ added the “drag and disappear” interaction method to eliminate red dots, which is both convenient and interesting, and at the same time can avoid the embarrassment caused by one-click elimination.

4. Conclusion

Overall, the little red dot has become an effective way of information reminders in the game. Although different forms will be adopted in different functions and usage scenarios, the design of small red dots in games should be more efficient and friendly, effectively reminding players to obtain information. It should not appear casually in order to cope or excessively highlight certain information, which will eventually lead to the proliferation of red dots, causing confusion to players and affecting the player’s game experience.

At the same time, when designing the “little red dot”, you should also consider the necessity of the appearance of the red dot, as well as the consistent form of expression with the game style, and increase the fun of the “little red dot” dynamic effect performance in appropriate circumstances, so that the small red dot can play a big role, truly and efficiently transmit information for players, and reduce players’ boredom with the “red dot”.

entry.title: Talented Scholars and Beautiful Ladies, White-Clad Officials How Does Appearance Help Shape Players' Social Image
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

Why do we love playing games? Because they provide us with the opportunity to satisfy our inner psychological needs. For MMORPG players, satisfying social needs is an important factor that drives them to the virtual world. In the joyful world of resolving grudges with a smile, we can choose to play completely different roles and interact with others. “Being yourself” or “no longer being yourself” are both choices. And the premise of “playing” is “personalization.” Fashion appearance is one of the most direct personalization systems in the game.

How players dress up their characters is also a part of self-expression in social interaction. Therefore, players’ needs for fashion appearances in the game may also reflect their expectations for the image presented by the characters they control in social interaction. So, in MMO games, what is the relationship between players’ choices of fashion appearances and players’ self-expression in the virtual world?

1. “Compared to Being Good-Looking, I’m More Unique”

With the iteration of the overall quality of games, the character images in MMO games are becoming more and more refined and beautiful. Players also have more methods and channels to pursue beauty and individuality. For example, in Revelation M, players can customize the colors and patterns of certain fashions, presenting different styles with the same tailoring and design through their own thinking. Players can also trade in the store and earn income by selling their creations.

 

Revelation M’s Stylist System (top) and Player Styling Store (bottom)

In such a highly free customization system, some players have begun to pursue another extreme of aesthetics (as shown below). The left side is created by players through dyeing and printing on the basis of the clothing on the right side. Why do players pursue to emulate the “Shamate” (杀马特 - shā mǎ tè, a Chinese subculture known for its extravagant and often garish fashion) style, and even take photos and share them.

 

Player-customized Shamate style (left) and the corresponding original clothing (right)

Because the “Shamate” style does not mean that players lack aesthetics, but is a way for some players to pursue social recognition.

As mentioned earlier, personalization is an important prerequisite for social interaction. In Revelation M, where even NPCs are handsome men and beautiful women, “good-looking” does have a thousand faces. But when everyone is as beautiful as a banished immortal, the extreme tuwei (土味 - tǔ wèi, meaning “rustic” or “tacky”) is more eye-catching and more impressive. This kind of behavior is no different from the pursuit of “riding a server-limited mount and swaggering through the streets”. Both are self-expression in social interaction. The only difference is that the former tries to seek recognition by showing personality, because such a dress conveys the message “I am very interesting, I have a personality”.

In fact, after the aesthetic significance is greatly reduced, it is not difficult to see that such a dress is completely for social needs, and it may lose its meaning if it is not seen/commented on by others.

 

Revelation M players in groups, all dressed in Shamate style

It is worth noting that there is a subtle difference between such personalized customization and what is called “not good-looking”. First, Shamate dress is often high-profile and direct. When customizing fashion in Revelation M, you can adjust the color temperature and hue to make the entire fashion emit fluorescence, announcing at the first time that “this dress is tuwei“. Second, others can see that the Shamate appearance is intentional by the player, and not really a lack of aesthetics. It can be seen that the two players dressed up in the picture above actually put a lot of effort into it. The male character in fluorescent yellow in the picture above needs to adjust the hue and color temperature of all the color blocks on the whole body to be uniform to achieve a harmonious tuwei; while the player on the far left, who dyed and printed each part of the clothing with reference to the “Northeast China floral袄” (dōng běi dà huā ǎo, a traditional Chinese jacket with a bold floral pattern), carefully chose suitable prints and adjusted their positions.

In contrast, players rarely choose appearances like the one below, where it is difficult to tell whether it is “intentional” or “just their aesthetic”, as a symbol of showing off their personality.

 

A fashion in Revelation M that has received negative reviews

2. “This is My Wife, He’s So Handsome”

Games are a virtual world, and players can choose to play a role that is completely different from themselves, even including gender. In MMO games, it is very common for the player’s gender to be inconsistent with the character’s gender.

 

The character’s appearance, the player’s gender, and his custom tag

Taking male players as an example, a typical dress for the female characters they control is a fair, youthful, and pure image. For example, in the figure below, the two dresses are from characters controlled by players of different genders. It is not difficult to see that the left picture is a character controlled by a male player.

 

If you think about it carefully, the way male players meticulously dress up their characters seems to be no different from girls playing with Barbie dolls in terms of expression. This kind of behavior may be considered by some to be detrimental to traditional masculinity. Similarly, looking at female players, choosing a male character means giving up the exquisitely detailed dresses. Given the high opportunity cost and potential risks, why are players still enjoying choosing opposite-sex characters?

Because when the player’s gender is inconsistent with the character’s gender, the character image is no longer equivalent to the player’s social image in the game, but a projection of personal aesthetics. In other words, at this time, “I am no longer me”, and the player and the character have a subject-object relationship.

Taking the “Ni Su” (逆苏 - nì sū) culture, which has often been mentioned in recent years, as an example, Ni Su, that is, “reverse Mary Sue”, originally meant that in the fan circle, fans gave traditional female qualities to their favorite male artists through secondary creation of materials related to them, reconstructing the gender roles of themselves and the artists, and forming a new dominance relationship. For example, calling a male artist their “wife” is a typical “Ni Su”.

In MMORPGs, some female players also have similar behaviors when manipulating male characters. In their gaming habits, the male characters they manipulate are more like the image of the opposite sex they idealize, and they will dress them up according to their own aesthetics. But in game social interaction, no matter whether the character’s appearance is cold or noble, female players often have distinct personal characteristics. They have no intention of playing “a翩翩公子 (piān piān gōng zǐ, a handsome and elegant young man)”, but comfortably reveal their own personalities as social beings.

 

A female player’s dress-up of her male character in Justice Online (Source: Weibo Justice Online Super Topic)

In this case, players have fixed expectations for the characters they manipulate, which contain the player’s own aesthetic preferences. The player’s main consideration is no longer the group’s aesthetic standards, but whether they like it and whether it exceeds their expectations.

3. “Talented Scholars and Beautiful Ladies, Naturally White-Clad Officials”

In the fashion stores of various MMO games, there is always a white fashion that sells very well. “Fairy”, “elegant” and “noble” seem to be eternal keywords. In the research, we found that when players evaluate the aesthetics of fashion, they pay more attention to the temperament shown behind the fashion. In today’s extreme pursuit of personalization, why do many female players have such similar preferences.

 

Because in the pursuit of white clothes, players also become more “beautiful” people, to ultimately gain public (social) recognition.

Many MMO themes in China are based on various martial arts/xianxia masterpieces. Most MMO players are from the 80s/90s generation and have been deeply influenced by martial arts writers such as Gu Long and Jin Yong. They have a similar understanding of the events of the jianghu (江湖 - jiāng hú, the martial arts world), for example, when it comes to the true, good and beautiful female image in the jianghu, there are the following descriptions:

“Her appearance is peerless, both beautiful as a fairy and bright and gorgeous, with skin like ice and bones like jade, as pure as a fairy from Gǔyè, with a natural and spiritual beauty; her martial arts are light and elegant, defeating enemies and winning in a graceful and charming way.” “She is upright and bright, broad-minded, and repays grievances with virtue.”

The above is Mr. Jin Yong’s description of Xiaolongnü in the original novel “The Return of the Condor Heroes”. In fact, if you read carefully, you will find that these two descriptions do not mention clothing and appearance, but the association given to people is a female image with white clothes and black hair like a waterfall. When the entire group has been influenced by a certain culture, individual aesthetic preferences may also be assimilated.

From this perspective, we have formed a connection between qualities such as “natural and spiritual beauty” and “bright and gorgeous” and concrete features (“white clothes” and “skirts”), because in too many film and television/artistic images we have seen, white-clad swordsmen who uphold justice, that is, elegant women in white clothes, are more likely to be recognized by the public. Therefore, a white dress may also be more attractive in the eyes of others, thereby gaining the recognition of others. Of course, this process is not necessarily conscious, that is, players do not necessarily buy to seek recognition, but as a form of self-expression, gaining recognition is one of the influencing factors of personalization.

Does this phenomenon have scalability and practical significance?

In previous contacts with Revelation M players, we classified daily temperaments and confirmed their preferences through player choices. The actual sales of related fashions and players’ preferences for temperament confirmed and expanded the above conclusions: in addition to “fairy white clothes”, some “non-white clothes” appearance designs with “elegant”, “noble” and “classical” temperaments are also very popular with female players.

 

In summary, fashions with elegant colors, flowing skirts, and exquisite and atmospheric fabrics are more likely to be favored by female players; at the same time, they need to outline the slender and beautiful limbs of female characters and show a graceful waist. Many players are disgusted with the bloated look (such as thick skirts and sleeves, fluffy fur collars and shawls).

4. “How Can a Macho Man Wear Pink?”

In male players’ choices of fashion, there are also such group characteristics. Their sensitivity to fashion details is relatively lower, but many male players have a common demand, that is, the characteristics of fashion cannot have a feminine or charming temperament (i.e., cannot be “effeminate”). Even as society becomes more and more tolerant of male aesthetics, this is still a major minefield in the design of game fashion appearances. Why can’t many male players accept clothes with this kind of temperament.

 

Because while rejecting the “feminine” appearance, male players are also avoiding the possibility of a setback in social status, so as to maintain their dominant position in the group/society.

In the traditional gender binary, men and women are given stereotypes in society that are not related to gender itself (“pink is for girls, blue is for boys”). More deeply, the social status of men has been higher than that of women for thousands of years in the past (“three cardinal guides and five constant virtues”). Traditional masculinity has gradually become equated with higher social status in practice. Conversely, having traditional female qualities means “being dominated” and “submissive”. Therefore, for some players, wearing pink fashion is so “disgusting” because it means that traditional male characteristics are dissolved, resulting in the loss of power and status, and they cannot be recognized as men.

In MMO games, when a male player manipulates a male character to wear clothes with traditional female qualities, he is likely to be ridiculed by men and even some women. This is detrimental to the social image, so many male players may consider avoiding such fashions to avoid image frustration.

As a positive example, the “breakout hit” appearance “Jing Hong Yu” (惊鸿羽 - jīng hóng yǔ, meaning “Graceful Feather”) previously launched by Justice Online also confirms this view.

 

Launched in 2020, this fashion was a breakthrough in the appearance design of Justice Online - exposing the chest and abdominal muscles of male characters; once launched, this fashion was a double harvest of popularity and sales. In fact, the design of Jing Hong Yu also has the characteristics of large-area exposure and bright colors. But why are its sales so high?

Because the freshness brought by the “design breakthrough” made the overall public opinion at that time tend to be positive, this fashion was considered to be “lined”, “domineering” and “sexy”, and even female players requested to buy it in public opinion. In this scenario, buying Jing Hong Yu does not damage the traditional masculinity, on the contrary, it is another emphasis on the ideal social image of male players. Therefore, male players of Justice Online have passionately placed orders for this fashion that “looks very domineering” and “is liked by young ladies”.

Generally speaking, appearance characteristics that may be considered by players to have traditional female qualities include: bright colors, exposed skin, soft makeup, etc. However, whether it is “effeminate” or not is a very subjective concept, which varies from player group to player group. For example, in the above-mentioned Justice Online, male fashions presented in a V-shape always fail to escape being described as “feminine”. But in Revelation M, players are more tolerant of this type of clothing design. But in any case, as long as the player feedback on a male fashion forms a clear negative public opinion about “wearing it is very effeminate”, the sales of this fashion are likely to decline.

5. Conclusion

This article starts from the choice of fashion appearance by MMO player groups, and analyzes the situation where the choice of fashion is affected by social factors. After being given social significance, players will consider the social image they present in communication when choosing fashion appearances. For example, in order to pursue a higher evaluation, players often choose fashions with features that are generally recognized in the group, such as elegant and ethereal white clothes; to avoid potential risks, such as a setback in social status, male players will avoid choosing appearances with specific designs that may be considered to have a certain temperament.

User and player research will not be a combination of independent characteristics. As individuals, players’ needs, behaviors and habits affect each other on different levels. Understanding and explaining player behavior from different perspectives can help us build a more comprehensive understanding.

entry.title: Where are the Potential Minefields for Nijigen Players: Analysis of Several Game Fails
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

In recent years, nijigen (二次元) users have increasingly become the focus of game developers as a potential audience, and on this basis, a variety of genres and gameplay of nijigen games have emerged. However, not all nijigen games can fully meet the needs and expectations of nijigen players. Numerous cases of games stepping on landmines also tell development teams that, as a highly specific player group, nijigen players have some significant minefields in terms of game experience and evaluation. This article will start from the characteristics of nijigen players and analyze the potential experience minefields that nijigen games may encounter.

1. Why Do Nijigen Players Play Nijigen Games?

Before answering this question, we must first define what nijigen is. Nijigen, originally meaning “two-dimensional world”, originated in Japan and later became a specialized term in the ACGN subculture circle (including animation, comics, games, novels, etc.), mainly referring to animation, comics, and game works composed of two-dimensional images, as well as the virtual world constructed by their derivatives. In a sense, nijigen is used by the ACGN subculture circle as a term for a fictional world or a fantasy world. It is essentially an existence distinct from the real world (sanjigen, 三次元, meaning “three-dimensional”).

 

Considering the broad concept of nijigen itself, the definition of “nijigen games” is also diverse. According to the target players, nijigen games can be divided into two types: “surface nijigen“ and “core nijigen“. Surface nijigen games refer to traditional genre games with a nijigen aesthetic style. The nijigen art style is just a way and means for the game to package traditional gameplay; while core nijigen games are more complex, they explore the deep-seated needs of nijigen culture and users. In terms of game worldview and plot construction, character design, and gameplay ideas, they more reflect the characteristics and preferences of nijigen users as a highly specific subculture group.

In order to understand the reasons why this core nijigen game may attract nijigen players, we used questionnaires and in-depth interviews for research, and summarized the following points:

  • Game factors, including but not limited to fun game mechanics, good-looking game character design, and attractive plots.
  • Social factors, including wanting to integrate into the surrounding circle of friends, socializing with like-minded people, etc.
  • The tendency of nijigen culture itself to be dreamy and escapist, including players’ emotional sustenance for game characters, and the game world view can help players escape from real-life pressures and problems.

2. Where are the Potential Minefields for Nijigen Players?

Considering the many needs of nijigen players for nijigen games, in recent years, domestic game developers have continued to make efforts and launched a variety of nijigen games. However, it should be noted that not every nijigen game is fully in line with the needs and expectations of players after its launch. What’s more, some games have stepped on landmines during the launch and continuous operation, which ultimately led to a decline in players’ in-game activity and out-of-game reputation. Why do these games touch minefields? Where are the potential minefields for nijigen players? By analyzing famous nijigen game failure cases on the market, this article draws the following conclusions.

Minefield 1: The Game Background and Character Settings Do Not Meet Players’ Expectations

Nijigen players often have their own understanding and expectations of the cultural background, worldview, character settings, and their relationship with the characters in the game. Therefore, there may be differences in understanding between game developers and players in terms of the game worldview/cultural background, character settings, and the relationship between players and characters, which may lead to deep-seated misunderstandings and conflicts.

For example, in September 2021, the new SSR Shikigami, Hagishime and Shokurei, announced during the fifth anniversary celebration of Onmyoji, caused a lot of controversy in player gathering and game exchange communities such as Weibo Super Topic and Zhihu. By analyzing the negative public opinion feedback from players, we found that the focus of the controversy was mainly on the art style of the two Shikigami.

 

“The art style of the Shikigami is very inconsistent with the game’s art style. Hagishime looks like a traditional Japanese-style Chinese girl, wearing a tight-fitting small cheongsam, which makes me feel sick.”

“The Chinese style elements of the new Shikigami are not well reflected. They are purely Japanese-style Shikigami, but they are mixed with Chinese style elements, which is very abrupt when they stand with other Shikigami. Onmyoji doesn’t look like Onmyoji anymore.”

“It’s very uncomfortable. The concept is already a Japanese-style game, but now it packages Chinese culture as Japanese characters, speaks Japanese, and can also blow sugar figures, our intangible cultural heritage. It’s hard not to make people think too much.”

It can be seen that the main trigger of this public opinion incident was that the design of the new Shikigami was mixed with Chinese style elements, which was relatively abrupt compared to the original Japanese style of Onmyoji. We know that nijigen culture originated in Japan. Although it has a significant influence in East Asia and even the world, the Japanese-style imprint of nijigen itself is still very distinct. Based on this, nijigen users are very sensitive to the possible Japanese/Chinese style mixing in nijigen works, and feel that it is a challenge to the “purity” of the cultural background of the work.

In addition, domestic nijigen players are very sensitive to possible historical hints related to Japan and China in the game. When designing the worldview and characters, it is also necessary to try to avoid domestic players’ negative historical imaginations, including but not limited to wars of aggression, colonial history, etc.

In addition to the game’s worldview and cultural background, nijigen players also have a unique understanding of the character design, art style, and their relationship with the characters in the game, which also requires developers to continue to pay attention during the game development and continuous operation. We still take Onmyoji as an example. In 2019, the official designed a new skin for the Shikigami Onikiri, as shown below.

 

As soon as the new skin was launched, it was questioned by many players. Players believed that the bangs, the sharp blade designed in the style of a kitchen knife, and the kariginu (狩衣) that resembled an apron made Onikiri, known as the “most powerful demon-slaying weapon of the Minamoto family”, appear “maid-like”, which was very different from its long-standing image of a “sharp blade” in the hearts of players. This case also tells us that in terms of character portraits and skin design, nijigen games should be in line with nijigen players’ imagination of character rarity, personality, and combat strength. Even when setting the skin and skill strength of popular characters, it is necessary to carefully consider player expectations.

The characters and settings in nijigen games are not completely independent of the players’ imagination. On the contrary, nijigen players are considered to be consumers with the characteristics of productive consumers (prosumers). They are often not limited to unilaterally consuming the acquired nijigen content, but also provide new content possibilities through their own understanding and reprocessing. This also requires nijigen games to provide interfaces for players’ active deconstruction and reshaping in terms of worldview, character, and plot design. Generally speaking, this interface is through the direct relationship between the player and the nijigen character, which is generally divided into four relationships:

  • Cyber Lover Relationship: Mostly appears in games with romantic elements. Players believe that they have an ambiguous relationship with the characters. “Playing the game is like falling in love with a paper person”.
  • Cultivation Relationship: Mostly appears in games with strong cultivation elements. Players believe that they are raising the characters, and the characters are their own “children”.
  • Immersive Relationship: Players believe that they can immerse themselves in the characters and integrate into the game world through the observation and behavior of the characters.
  • Spectator Relationship: Mostly appears in games where the characters have their own storylines. Players are more of spectators and plot promoters, watching the love and hate between the characters.

Nijigen players often have their own understanding of their relationship with the characters in the game. The same character in the same game can even have completely different plot and character network development when interpreted by different players. At this time, nijigen games need to try to avoid large errors between their own design of the plot and character relationships and the players’ own imagination. For example, if a player regards a character in the game as a “waifu”, but a real official NPC partner appears in the process of advancing the plot, this will cause discomfort to the player’s experience.

Minefield 2: Failure to Effectively Handle the Relationship Between Nijigen and Sanjigen

The previous minefields are limited to nijigen games and users themselves, but under this minefield, nijigen games need to face the broader impact of sanjigen reality. In the eyes of nijigen players, one of the important demands of experiencing nijigen games is to escape reality. Although nijigen and sanjigen have mutual influence, it is necessary to make a clear distinction when necessary. For example, players are very taboo about nijigen characters having significant sanjigen prototypes or private settings, which they believe affect their own immersion and imagination. In addition, in the selection of spokespersons for nijigen games, nijigen players have their own screening strategies: in addition to being in line with the character settings, they will also consider a certain ranking of spokespersons. Celebrities and idols from sanjigen may even be criticized by nijigen players for their traffic and influence.

But this does not mean that nijigen games and sanjigen are completely unrelated. If there is a problem with the behind-the-scenes staff of sanjigen (including but not limited to legal, political, and moral issues), which affects the player’s experience of nijigen characters, most nijigen players cannot tolerate it, and the official needs to respond quickly.

3. Summary: How to Analyze the Game Needs of Specific Groups of Players?

The analysis of the possible experience minefields of nijigen players in nijigen games shows the importance of analyzing the characteristics, preferences, and minefields of specific player groups for the successful development and continuous operation of games. What kind of ideas and methods can be summarized from this?

In terms of research ideas, it is first necessary to analyze the portrait and needs of specific player groups. The development team needs to understand the characteristics of the player group and analyze the possible needs of players for the game from the characteristics.

In terms of research methods, questionnaires can cover a larger group of players in a short period of time, which can help the development team to draw relatively “universal” group characteristics. However, if you encounter situations where you need to dig deeper into details, you can use more qualitative in-depth interviews and focus groups for research.

References:

  1. “二次元” Baidu Encyclopedia https://baike.baidu.com/item/二次元/85064?fromModule=lemma_search-box
  2. Bilibili user Mirandanu’s column article “What is a Nijigen Game” https://www.bilibili.com/read/cv12042991

entry.title: How to Interpret the Emotions of Players from European and American Communities Through Their Online Chats
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

Player interactions within the game community are an important channel for us to collect player feedback. Unlike face-to-face communication, when we look at the chat content in the community, we lack information beyond language, such as eyes, gestures, and tone of voice, to help us grasp the player’s emotional tendency. If we only focus on the literal meaning of the chat, we might take the player’s sarcasm seriously.

Take the following messages as examples:

Example 1:
Game just entirely froze right as the last team came into view. In a gold 1 rated ranked match….nice

Example 2:
New patch for bots is lovely there absolutely a joke now thanks naraka

Example 3:
Player 1: whens gta6 coming out
Player 2: 2045
Player 1: damn that early?

“Nice”, “lovely”, “thanks”, “early” seem to reflect the player’s positive emotions, but if you look closely, you can find something wrong: How can it be a good thing to have a problem (froze) in a gold 1 ranked match? If the bots after the new patch are really lovely, how can they be a joke? Is it really early for GTA6 to come out in 2045? It seems that no matter what language the players use, they like to use sarcasm.

Therefore, in order to correctly interpret players’ emotions from their expressions, in addition to mastering the language used by players, we also need to understand some of their emotional language expression habits.

1. Understanding the Emotions of European and American Players from Word Transformations

Words are composed of letters, so players will manipulate the letters to transform the words. Common methods include using uppercase letters, repeating letters, and replacing words with letters or numbers that sound similar.

Capital letters are generally used at the beginning of sentences, proper nouns, etc., so capital letters are more powerful than lowercase letters, which are usually used. Players will use capital letters to spell words or sentences to express emphasis and strong feelings. For example, we once saw a comment like this: “WHY IS THERE NO SHOWDOWN FOR HALLOWEEN?!?!?”. The player likes Showdown and really hopes to be able to play this mode during Halloween, so the whole message uses capital letters, and the formal deformation is very eye-catching, so as to express their strong desire to play the Showdown mode.

Repeating letters is related to lengthening the pronunciation. For example, one “i” in “ship” is a short vowel, while “ee” in “sheep” is a long vowel. Players can lengthen the word and pronunciation by using repeated letters in the word, such as Morrnnninnggggg (morning), Leeeeeeeeaaaavvvveee (leave), Chilllllll (chill); it can also be used to emphasize the loudness of the sound. SHEEEEESH in the rooster meme below is an example of this usage. Both the image and the text of the rooster meme indicate the loudness of the sound.

 

Meme containing repeated letters

Repeated letters can also be used to express emphasis, “I have 2 buckets candieeees”. This is a player participating in the in-game Halloween event, where players can get event items by giving candy bags to other players, but this player has two candy bags that cannot be given away, and naturally, they cannot get event items. Players sometimes encounter fellow singers in chat and suddenly start a lyric chain, you say “PROVOKINNNNNGGGGGG”, and I say “BURY THE LIGHT DEEP WITHINNNNN”, using both capitalization and repetition, making people feel the loudness and energy of the song just by looking at the message.

 

Players engaged in a lyric chain

Players will also use letters and numbers to replace words or parts of words that have the same pronunciation, such as “b4” for “before” and “U” for “you”; sometimes they will also use the pattern of an item with the same pronunciation to represent a word, such as: “U owe me a skin no [image of a hat]”, the hat pattern at the end of the sentence refers to the word “cap”, and “cap” here means “lie”. This sentence means “you owe me a skin, don’t lie”.

Players bet with skins in the game, and the loser has to give the winner a skin. Since “lie” has a slightly serious accusatory meaning, the player uses “cap” instead of “lie” to make the conversation more relaxed and lively. Using the hat pattern instead of directly typing the word further weakens the negative color of “lie”, making the sentence more euphemistic, like a friend reminding jokingly, “Hey, you owe me a skin, don’t lie”. Players also use spaces and line breaks to change the presentation of words and sentences. For example, adding spaces between each letter of a word, L i e s, gives the feeling of spelling out each letter, highlighting the player’s serious attitude and emphasis; another example is using line breaks to split a sentence into paragraphs:

No

One

Is

Gonna

Grab

Me

Each line break is a pause. This form emphasizes the content of each line, which better reflects the player’s pride and confidence in their gaming skills.

2. Simplify Writing to Create a Relaxed and Interesting Atmosphere

In addition to using memes, European and American players also like to be lazy, using many abbreviations, omissions, or slang in community chats. These methods can not only save typing time and improve chat efficiency, but also help create a relaxed and interesting atmosphere.

Abbreviations are a great way to be lazy. We have also encountered abbreviations before, such as ASAP for “as soon as possible”; players will also use the first letter of each word to represent commonly used phrases or sentences, such as “rn” for “right now”, “goat” for “greatest of all time”, “ngl” for “not gonna lie”, “wdym” for “what do you mean”. When we encounter similar abbreviations, we can google the original phrase and accumulate them and create a “player’s common slang library” for future public opinion work.

Omission is also used skillfully by players. Players will omit vowels or consonants in word spelling, and omit punctuation in sentence spelling. In word spelling, vowel letters are omitted, leaving only consonant letters to provide clues to the pronunciation of the word, such as “abt” for “about”, “smh” for “somehow”, “tlk” for “talk”, “nvm” for “never mind”. Although the words are not spelled completely, players who are familiar with this method can restore the complete words through consonant letters.

In addition, players sometimes omit consonant letters, such as “em” for “them”. In order to avoid sensitive words, players will also omit consonant letters, “shi” (omitting the final t). In addition, they will also use symbols with similar shapes to replace letters ($ for S) or use spaces to break up words. As for the omission of punctuation, the first to bear the brunt is ‘, so can’t becomes cant, and I’ll becomes ill.

There is also some slang among players, such as “cap” for “liar”, “simp” for “a person who is overly attentive to someone they like”, “beef” for “brag, show off”. If you can use abbreviations, omissions, and slang skillfully, you must be an active member of community communication and have made great contributions to creating a relaxed and interesting community atmosphere.

3. Mixing Other Foreign Languages to Find Partners and Demonstrate Language Skills

Players will also mix other foreign languages besides English when communicating in the community. The use of foreign languages is either to find partners who use the same language, or to enhance feelings in the process of discussing foreign language learning. Mastering multiple languages is also a manifestation of ability. For example, players will also mix in a few sentences of Spanish or French when chatting, with the purpose of finding friends who speak the same language:

Player 1: Como vas amigo (How are you, friend)
Player 2: Bien. Y tu? (I’m fine, and you)
Player 1: Esperando encontrar una partida (I want to find a partner to play games)

In the vast sea of English, the sudden appearance of a few sentences in Spanish is like an indicator light, guiding two players who use the same language to get to know each other and become good friends who play games together. But not all friend requests sent in foreign languages will be responded to, for example:

Player 3: alguien habla español ¿? (Does anyone speak Spanish?)
mi nick es “ ……” (My game nickname is…)

This player sent a friend request in Spanish and attached his game nickname, but failed to meet a partner who also speaks Spanish in the channel.

 

Player looking for a Spanish-speaking partner

 

Failed to find a Spanish-speaking partner

European and American players also have foreign language courses in school, the most common being Spanish and French. Occasionally, players will ask other players for help with foreign languages in the community.

Player 1: First language is Spanish but have been learning English since 4th grade
Player 2: Teach me espanol

It can be seen that mastering multiple foreign languages is also a manifestation of ability. Players’ community IDs will also use other languages. Some are Korean players such as “서융”, and some are influenced by Chinese games and use Chinese IDs like “卧虎藏龙” (“Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon”).

 

Players Using Korean and Chinese IDs.

Speaking of using Chinese IDs, players have repeatedly mentioned the Chinese game Naraka: Bladepoint in game-related discussions, and have the impression that Chinese players are good at Naraka: Bladepoint because of low latency. Therefore, some players inevitably complain that they are afraid of seeing Chinese names, and that a large number of Chinese players use smurf accounts to play on their servers:

Player 1: chinese named players strike fear into my soul i stopped playing for a while to see if the player based would become more diverse and now i hear xbox has naraka
Player 2: Spoiler alert
Half of those CN names
Are NA players
Like me

But another player told him that half of the players with Chinese names in the game are not Chinese players, like he uses a Chinese name. Later, some players explained that using Chinese names is to scare enemies.

 

North American Players Using Chinese IDs

In addition to Chinese nicknames, a phrase called “raw dragon” frequently appears in player chats. At first glance, it seems inexplicable because it has nothing to do with the context. But if you translate these two words into Chinese separately, “raw” = “生”, “dragon” = “龙”, and the combination is “生龙”, doesn’t this pronunciation sound familiar? Isn’t this the “升龙” (“Shoryuken”, “Rising Dragon”) in the game? These foreign players really understand the word.

 

Example of ‘raw dragon’ usage.

4. Emojis/Memes Used All Over the World

Some say that music transcends culture and language, and so do emojis. Emojis use pictures to express emotions, and the meaning of most emojis can be inferred and felt from the picture, without being affected by language.

European and American players like to use emojis in chat. In Discord, emojis are roughly divided into three categories:

● One is Discord’s own basic emojis, which are free for players to use;

● The second is the emojis provided by each server in Discord to players, which can only be used within that server (unless you subscribe to Discord Nitro). The official Naraka: Bladepoint server provides a set of emojis for players, including emojis based on in-game heroes and emojis newly created based on popular emoji elements (Pepe the Frog, etc.);

● The third is GIFs. Players can search for popular GIFs or save the GIFs they encounter in chats for their own use.

European and American players use these three types of emojis when chatting in the community. Discord’s own emojis and the emojis provided by the current server are the most frequently used by players and are most likely to generate emoji chains, because everyone can use these two types of emojis freely, which is a common language among emojis.

 

Various Emoji usage on Discord.

Players use different emojis according to the chat content, and sometimes use emojis to express simple meanings. The meaning of basic emojis (similar to the emojis that come with Apple products) is not affected by language, such as [heart] to express “love”, [eyes emoji] to express “watching”, “secretly observing”.

Complex emojis can express richer meanings, so players need to observe the pictures and feel their emotions. For example: this emoji is slightly different from the usual dog head, and the meaning is also more friendly, with the meaning of “leisure”, which can be used to watch other players chat, and is also easy to cause emoji chains. However, the most frequently used emoji is Rua. This flustered kitten will not go wrong in any occasion. It has mixed meanings of “surprise”, “excitement”, and “greeting”. It is simply a versatile emoji that is not easy to go wrong in any occasion. But if you delve into the meaning of Rua, the answer can only be “Rua is Rua!”.

 

Common Emojis.

Emojis can also be used for dialogue. Taking server emojis as an example, players will take out server-limited emojis that previous players have not posted, which is a tacit understanding of the same server; the same situation applies to personally collected GIFs. If a player who prefers Dragon Ball GIFs encounters another player who also has a large inventory of Dragon Ball GIFs, the two will communicate with each other using emojis, while other players who lack this type of emoji may not be able to join the conversation.

 

Emoji Usage in Discord Servers

In addition to the emojis in Discord, players will also use emoji characters, which are slightly different from the common emoticons we see. The emoji characters used by European and American players are relatively traditional, basically vertical, and need to be rotated ninety degrees to be understood, :), :(, B(, :<, :C, D:, D;, xD, :D, and some emoji characters can be repeated in the mouth part, deriving emoji characters such as :)), B(((, xDD. By repeating a certain part of the emoji character, players can express stronger emotions. Players also use horizontal characters, such as -.-, T_T, o.O, but rarely use more vivid emoticons or patterns built with characters.

The GIFs collected by players may be very different, but the emojis provided by Discord and the server are shared resources of players on the same server. When players use these shared emojis, it is easier to get corresponding emoji feedback. In addition, when using classic emojis (such as Pepe the Frog) in personal collections, it is also easier to elicit responses from other players.

5. Conclusion

When understanding European and American players’ feedback and needs for games through player communities, in addition to language skills, we also need to understand the language expression habits of European and American players in order to accurately grasp the player’s emotional tendencies and understand the player’s real needs. The set of online communication methods in the player community described in this article, such as emojis, abbreviations, omissions, and unusual word and sentence presentation forms in chat, are like eyes, gestures, and tones of voice in face-to-face communication, which can provide us with a basis for grasping player emotions and try to avoid falling into the trap of players’ sarcasm.

entry.title: Thousands of Troops in Battle, Who Will Lead Them - A Preliminary Exploration of Battlefield Information Interaction in SLG Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

1. Overview of the Development of SLG Mobile Games in China

Sid Meier, the father of the Civilization series, once expressed his understanding of games with this sentence: “A game is a series of interesting choices.”

Game developers choose and design game mechanics, while players experience choices within the game mechanics, and ultimately, players choose the game. The broad concept of SLG games can be traced back to Civilization in the 1990s. With the development of the Internet era, players gradually began to desire social elements on the basis of single-player gameplay, and SLG mobile games emerged.

 

In 2015, with the huge success of Clash of Kings (COK) in the Chinese mobile game market and worldwide, the relatively niche sub-genre of SLG mobile games entered the vision of the general public and game manufacturers. In the same year, just as large and small game manufacturers in China were preparing their own COK-like mobile games, NetEase released a sandbox strategy mobile game called Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy (率土之滨). This mobile game, based on the historical background of the warlord separatism in the late Eastern Han Dynasty, did not become a follower of COK. Instead, it created a unique gameplay mechanism in the SLG category and developed into the pioneering work of the “Romance-of-the-Three-Kingdoms-like” category of games that would contend with COK-like games in the future of domestic SLG mobile games.

 

In the development and iteration of SLG games in recent years, various COK-like and Romance-of-the-Three-Kingdoms-like mobile games have sprung up. The limitation of these games is that they only made micro-innovations in the worldview and some mechanisms, but essentially did not deviate from the underlying framework of COK or Romance of the Three Kingdoms.

Currently, most mainstream domestic SLGs are simulation strategy war games, whose main feature is a sandbox map as the core activity space, with high social strategy. Unlike SLG series such as Civilization and Romance of the Three Kingdoms, the core experience and fun of current SLG mobile games have gradually shifted from the content provided by the game itself, that is, the interaction between players and the game, to the behavior and interaction between players.

Therefore, as the main body of player-game interaction and the carrier of interaction between players, the importance of information interaction on the sandbox map of SLG mobile games is self-evident. This article will conduct a preliminary exploration and analysis of battlefield information interaction in SLG games.

2. The Underlying Logic of Sand Table Types

According to the interaction logic of the sand table, the sand tables of SLG mobile games can be divided into two types: coordinate type and path type.

 

The coordinate-type sand table is based on a two-dimensional coordinate system. The map elements on the coordinate-type sand table map are all independent “points”. You only need to input coordinate instructions to go to the target position. The sand table maps of Clash of Kings and Rise of Kingdoms belong to the coordinate type. The path-type sand table is similar to a network topology. It adds path requirements on the basis of the coordinate-type sand table. Players need to have “connecting land” to reach the target location.

 

Different sand table types bring vastly different depths of gameplay strategy and division of labor. For example, the unique mechanisms of “road paving” and “battle-free period” in Romance-of-the-Three-Kingdoms-like games come from this. Although the path-type sand table type can provide deeper and broader playability, it also increases the game burden on players to a certain extent.

Although some Romance-of-the-Three-Kingdoms-like games have introduced functions such as AI automatic road paving or scheduled occupation, overly intelligent proxy operations also compress the player’s operating space, resulting in a decline in the game’s DAU. The future trend of SLG mobile games may be to achieve a balance between auxiliary tools and game experience, so that players with different levels of dedication can “get what they want” and maximize the game experience in their respective positions.

3. Interaction Design of Map Elements

Thanks to the real historical background and reliable element architecture, in the grand sand table map of over 2.25 million tiles, Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy not only has historical cities of the late Eastern Han Dynasty, famous historical sites admired by the world, and natural terrain processed for balance based on strict adherence to real mountains and rivers, and resource lands for player development, but also includes building elements with military or development functions. These rich map elements jointly participate in the construction of the game mechanism of this work, giving it a strong historical atmosphere and a strong sense of immersion.

 

In order to enable players to efficiently and stably obtain the information meaning of many map elements and minimize the occurrence of misoperations, Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy mainly designs from the following two levels:

In terms of visual interaction, Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy designs visual elements consistent with its semantics for each map element, which greatly reduces the cognitive burden of players. For resource lands with two to nine levels, it first uses four typical characteristic elements of mountains, forests, iron smelting, and rice to distinguish them, and then differentiates them according to the number of elements (two to four levels) and buildings (five to nine levels). In addition, in order to meet the visual preferences of different players as much as possible, the game also provides 2D/3D visual schemes for players to freely switch.

In terms of map interaction, when the player clicks on any land unit on the map, the detailed information of the unit and corresponding operation prompts will be displayed. For operations that cannot be performed, grayscale images are displayed instead of being directly hidden. Moreover, when the player clicks on the interaction option, the reason why the operation cannot be performed will be informed in text, so that the player can understand. Through detailed interaction feedback, Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy not only greatly reduces the learning threshold and cognitive burden of new players, but also effectively avoids many misoperation events caused by inadequate information interaction, which greatly improves the player’s interaction experience.

 

Similar to Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy, the resource lands of Rise of Kingdoms also use characteristic elements and buildings to graphically distinguish resource lands, and further directly and clearly mark the level of resource lands in the form of text. This visual interaction design achieves a win-win situation in terms of experience and efficiency. However, Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy is limited by the overall map style and is not suitable for direct map marking, so it can only be supplemented by interaction feedback.

In addition, the map resource search control of Rise of Kingdoms can quickly locate the target type and level of resource land, freeing players from the tedious map information retrieval, which greatly improves the player’s interaction efficiency and game experience.

 

4. Exploring the Connotation of Marching Markers

“Marching” in Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy refers to the command operation of sending a team from a certain starting point to a certain end point. When the player issues this operation, a marking line composed of directional arrows will be formed between the starting point grid and the end point grid, so that the player can obtain marching information. At the same time, there will be an army element walking along the marching marker line. This element consists of a marching icon, a marching countdown, and the troop composition: the enemy and friend can be identified by the icon and the color of the marching marker (blue for allies, red for others), the marching countdown shows the time remaining until the end of the march; the troop composition represents the arms that make up this troop.

 

In actual combat, the information value provided by marching markers is far more than what is shown on the surface: by identifying enemies and friends, you can judge the approximate scale of the enemy and our forces invested in the current land/war zone; by analyzing the troop composition of the army element, you can analyze the arms attributes and characteristics of the three generals that make up this troop, and guess the configuration of the incoming troop based on the mainstream troops of the version; according to the marching countdown and the preview of the marching time, you can grasp the timing of the troop’s attack.

 

The marching marker elements of Rise of Kingdoms are similar to Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy. Players on the same sandbox map can obtain information such as enemy and friend information, marching countdown, and troop composition through marching markers. But unlike traditional SLG mobile games, the RTS control mode of Rise of Kingdoms adds more possibilities to marching. Although RTS has higher requirements for the player’s online time, and micro-operations are difficult to truly realize on the mobile game platform, this flexible mode with a stronger operating experience has attracted a large number of players and received good market feedback.

5. Design Iteration of the Strategic Map

As the core element of the SLG mobile game mechanism, the alliance (nation) mechanism is not only a centralized social window in the game, but also the main platform for players to obtain settlement rewards in the season process. The confrontation between players takes the form of wars between alliances. In the vast sandbox map, it is crucial to distinguish enemy and friend information intuitively and efficiently. Clash of Kings uses different land grid colors to distinguish the ownership of different alliances, while Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy has innovated the land ownership information in multiple dimensions: the player’s own land units are marked in green, alliance units are marked in blue, non-alliance units are marked in red, hostile alliance units are marked in dark red, and friendly alliance units are marked with a blue border…

 

“Six Secret Teachings” says: “Ascend to high places and look down to observe the changes of the enemy.” If you can see the overall situation, you can plan to defeat the enemy; if you are blinded by a leaf, you will inevitably be trapped. On the battlefield, if you can quickly grasp the situation of both the enemy and ourselves, you can make more accurate strategic judgments. The core of the SLG requirement path is a strategic model based on multi-person participation in phased requirements (exploration, expansion, development, elimination, etc.). With the continuous development and improvement of the SLG mobile game alliance mechanism, and the refinement of the division of labor of players’ roles and positions in the alliance, the early lower-level map information mode based on land unit information can no longer meet the information needs of local tactical strategies and even global strategic posture formulation.

 

Limited by the screen size of mobile games, players can often only obtain more information by constantly sliding the screen. This method is not only inefficient but also easily confuses information, which seriously affects the game experience of some users. Although the “larger field of view” configuration option provided by early developers in the game settings already has the prototype and awareness of a strategic map, this does not fundamentally solve the problem. In the strategic map level, most of the map elements have become generalized summary information. At this time, land unit information is no longer important. These information unrelated to decision-making will be filtered out, leaving more global map information for decision-makers.

 

In the August 2022 update, the strategic map function was officially launched in all season servers of Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy. Players can enter the strategic mode by zooming out the screen view. In the strategic mode, the visual range is 20 times that of the normal view, providing players with a more macroscopic observation perspective, so as to easily grasp the overall situation and provide strong support for the strategic decision-making of alliance commanders.

Different from the detailed land information in the normal view, the strategic view abstracts and simplifies various information elements, focusing on key strategic information such as land ownership, marching routes, garrison status in war zones, native cities and facilities, and extreme weather effects. Although the strategic map of Romance of the Three Kingdoms: Strategy was launched later than similar competitive products, this strategic map that deeply fits the gameplay of Romance of the Three Kingdoms effectively reduces the burden of information recognition for players, highlights the important information that players really need in strategic analysis, and greatly optimizes the map information interaction experience while improving interaction efficiency.

 

6. Conclusion

As the main body of player-game interaction and the key carrier of interaction between players, the SLG game sand table battlefield not only carries the logical framework of the entire game, ensures the harmony and unity of the screen style and theme setting, but also takes into account the player’s interaction experience and provides corresponding support controls. It can be said to be the most basic and most worthy of repeated consideration in SLG games.

This article mainly focuses on the information interaction of the sand table battlefield, and briefly discusses the underlying logic of its sand table type, the interaction design of map elements, the connotation mining of marching markers, and the design iteration of the strategic map from the perspective of user experience. So far, the problems to be solved and the contradictions to be coordinated in the SLG sand table map still exist. It is believed that with the development and progress of the industry, better competing products or updates will bring a better game experience to players.

entry.title: Breaking the Fourth Wall - Meta Elements in Narrative-Driven Games
entry.content:
Machine Translated from Chinese to English
Original article written by ThunderFire UX (NetEase)

 

The fourth wall is a virtual wall facing the audience in a traditional proscenium stage with three sides, symbolizing the boundary between the audience and the actors, reality and virtuality.

Compared to traditional stages such as movies and dramas, narrative-driven games are stages with more interaction; when the boundary between the game and reality becomes blurred, the player’s cognition of the game will be challenged. Imagine that you are controlling the protagonist to do “silly things” in the map for fun, but he suddenly turns his head and stares at you, and asks you to stop… This kind of design that breaks the fourth wall belongs to meta.

Meta-games, also translated as “metagames” or “hypergames,” and out-of-game elements beyond the gameplay itself can be called meta elements. Narrowly speaking, a meta-game refers to a full-process game that takes breaking the fourth wall as its core gameplay; in general narrative-driven games, meta elements of different depths can also be added to produce a momentary stunning effect.

In traditional game design theory, emphasis is placed on creating a virtual world isolated from real life as much as possible through various rules and restrictions, as well as graphics, music, dialogue, etc., to maintain the player’s immersion.
